Cons: Lots of sidework, late nights, no teamwork
Advice to Management: Promote more effective teamwork instead of one man for himself!

Title: "Server"
Pros: Good company with good benefits
Cons: Strict rules for all employees

Title: "Fun environment"
Pros: Great staff, easy to change your schedule if you want or need to.
Cons: You don't get your schedule until the beginning of each week and it changes so it makes it hard to plan
Advice to Management: None at the location where I worked

Title: "Server"
Pros:
Atmosphere is great
Management is always involved and available
Co workers are helpful
Cons: No cons at this time

Title: "Worked at Cheese for 9 years"
Pros:
Good for students as they do offer flexible scheduling
Usually good tips
The staff (NOT management) really make the job bareable, you become like family
Cons:
The company and its standards is not anything close to what it used to be.

Favoritism
Frequent management changes
Lack of support in upper management
Long ticket times which effects the money you will make
Does not adhere to their own standards
Frequent sexual advancements from upper management
Lack of mobility
You are just another person on their employment roster of over 300+ employees, so you are easily replaceable and they frequently remind you of it
Advice to Management:
Treat your employees with more respect.
Get back to the original model that Cheese was 10+ years ago.

Title: "You can't win 'em all"
Pros: There are chains all over the country, so you have the flexibility to move anywhere and have a job. This company is also extremely busy, so it is more stable than many restaurant jobs.
Cons: The company does not care about its employees. You are just a number. They want you to do things a very specific way, and yet constantly sets you up for failure by not allowing you the supplies you need to perform well. Also, because the company's motto is the "upmost guest satisfaction," even though there are 200 things on the menu we are supposed to still allow the guest to create whatever meal they want. There are 200 things on the menu and the guest can't choose one? Then the kitchen gets mad at you for making their life complicated and yet you are just following the company motto. Ridiculous.

Title: "overall great experience"
Pros: Thriving culture. there are so many employees, scheduling is always convenient. very thorough training.
Cons: very strict corporate regulations.

Title: "The Cheesecake Experience"
Pros:
I recommend if an individual needs fast income.
Convenient for students in school or someone looking for a flexible schedule.
Sustainable pay.
Cons:
Zero room for growth.
Lack of appreciation and/or recognition.
Abuse of power & poor management.
Little teamwork.
Overworked staff.
Advice to Management: Acknowledge your staff, listen and understand the needs of your coworkers and the guests as a whole unit. Enforce discipline and provide positive reinforcement. Provide meals to those that stay working a double shift of 12-13hrs of constant movement with nothing to sustain their energy.

Title: "You are worth more than this place."
Pros:
Flexible scheduling
Scheduling App
Moderate sections
Discounted meals
Cons:
No auto-grat
Inconsistent scheduling
Inconsistent management (changing rules depending on manager)
Favoritism
Frequent sexual advancements from management to hourly employees

Title: "True to the Mission"
Pros: The Cheesecake Factory is a dynamic place with dedication and excellence demonstrated at every level and at the same time a warm, family atmosphere.
Cons: Although they solicit a lot of feedback, it's difficult to determine if your feedback will actually impact change.

Title: "Belittling for money"
Pros: We got short breaks every 4 hours
Cons: They were short staffed so 1 person would do the job normally given to 3 people
Advice to Management: Do not overwork your employees because you are shortstaffed.

Title: "Manager"
Pros: Culture and People. Fun environment and lots of food around the Corporate Support Center
Cons: Slow decision making by Management.
Advice to Management: Don't be slow to try out new things. Other companies are getting much ahead of the curve leaving us behind, and we are supposed to be the leaders!

Title: "Busser"
Pros: Good hours, tips are good.
Cons: Long hours, sometimes you don't get out till 2 in the morning.

Title: "Server"
Pros: Great company culture, flexible hours, caring management
Cons: Working all holidays, variable income

Title: "Overall, a wonderful and challenging work environment!"
Pros:
Money is good if you know “the Cheesecake way” and you’re in the right location (I worked at the Sawgrass location and brought home on average $150 a night).

Room for growth within the company! I started as a server and was promoted to bartender with no bartending experience within a year and a half. If you do your job well and show commitment, they WILL recognize you.

If you like change and a challenging job, this is the job for you! New menu roll outs happen every six months. Corporate takes items that don’t sell so much off and replaces them with new and exciting dishes.
Cons:
The larger and more recognized locations (based on annual revenue) have a large amount of servers (52 at my location). Off season can be rough, as management cannot favor veterans. This means you don’t get the 5 shifts a week that you’re used to, resulting in a decrease of weekly and monthly income.

Management has the revolving door effect. They transfer managers from one location to another for internal reasons (promotions, issues at another location, etc.). Typically, one or two managers out of five or six go within the year. Each manager is assigned to a specific work group (servers, bar, bakery, etc) and managers switch work groups every six months. If a manager doesn’t favor you, good luck because your designated manager makes your schedule. This wasn’t a con for me, but it certainly was for others.

Title: "Great Employer"
Pros: Great company to work for. Very accommodating with schedule
Cons: Don't have many cons to talk about

Title: "Okay"

Working on the line at one of the busiest locations in the midwest
Fun environment, fun people
Vast menu
Cons:
Very low pay rate for start
Often overworked

Title: "Dadeland location"

Cons:
Zero teamwork, Favoritism, disorganized management,
Management discourages teamwork.
Advice to Management: Build a team

Title: "Serving"

Title: "EKM with benefits"
Pros: Good benefits , competitive pay , closed on Christmas and thanksgiving, take one cash one vacations, potential to make more money through steps
Cons: Staffing issues and long hours , large menu , Sunday and Saturday brunch menu , inventory every week at 4am

Title: "GREAT COMPANY"
Pros: Great as far as restaurants go
Cons: late nights, long checkout process
Advice to Management: get rid of the cashier end-of-shift check out

Title: "Cook/Certified Trainer"
Pros: The food is great
Cons: Long hours alot of Hard work
Advice to Management: Be blessed on time and come on time

Title: "Server"
Pros: The food is very tasty!
Cons:
Management style - favoritism/unprofessional/bad sections to new employees
Odd hours/low pay (dependent upon section)
I could not stress enough how bad the management was at this location.
Sections do not rotate/based on seniority I would leave with on average 30 dollars a night because I was continually placed in low volume section
The tip out is 30% of pay!!! Absolutely crazy-tip our bartender/bus/food runners
The sidework was UNBELIEVABLE-took over an hour to complete!!
It was the worst job I’ve ever had in my life...but I’m happy I have quite a few horror/funny stories to tell about my experience there
Advice to Management:
Implement training programs-hopefully they restaffed
Rotate sections
Decrease % for tip out

Pros: Benefits, pay is above average, great food, can make a huge career from it.

Title: "Server"
Pros: The people are great to work with. And the money is good

Not strict

Title: "Server"
Pros: Good money, large friendly staff, flexible shifts
Cons: no organization, no consistency, tolerance for rude guests
Advice to Management: be more assertive

Title: "As far as restaurants go to serve in this is a better one for tips"
Pros: You get discounted food after your shift and sometimes a free meal for completing a task a manager needs. The sidework is really minimal as well and rotated based on the section you’re in
Cons: Training. Training. Training. The training is multiple weeks long. There is a menu knowledge class in the morning for 1-2 weeks where you’re not really getting paid. Menu is enormous and you have to memorize it.
Advice to Management: Some managers I had there cared about their employees and some didn’t at all.

Title: "A little about Cheesecake Factory"
Pros: Fast pace, interact with guest, great teammates and management was awesome
Cons: On my feet for about7-12 hours a day
Advice to Management: Keep doing what you are doing!

Title: "Great place to start a career"
Pros:
The Cheesecake Factory is a melting pot for some of the best managers and chefs in the country. The atmosphere is fun, extremely fast paced, and mature. The staff will help you move forward and will take time to help you develop personally or professionally. The staff are very forgiving of mistakes, which makes learning your job much easier. If you're afraid of being harassed for a mistake, it won't make you afraid of making the mistake, but of the person.

For someone just starting out in the industry, it's well worth starting out here. With a 200+ item menu and standardized restaurant operation, it's probably one of the best places in the United States to begin working at right out of culinary school to get a good look at your textbooks at work. You will meet life-long mentors and make good friends. Just be sure to brush up on your spanish if you're on the coast.
Cons:
It's sometimes difficult to hold a second job because of schedule requirements, requirements that nearly each other restaurant simultaneously requests. The Cheesecake Factory typically opens in areas that require a higher income to live within a reasonable range of work. This means that sometimes even staff without dependents can have a difficulty sustaining a necessary second job to maintain their residency. Excluding overnight jobs of course. For staff with dependents, a second job is an absolute necessity.

As with any restaurant job, maintaining a family life will be difficult.
Advice to Management: When staff offer information, listen. You are the communication hub for the entire restaurant. If a staff member informs you about something, they aren't telling you what to do, they're making you aware. It's important to realize that on unusually busy nights, we will run out of food to serve, the dishwashers will get backed up, the prep team will be behind on delivering critical prep items, FOH staff will end up behind on side work. As long as the managers remain calm and the staff communicate with each other - ensuring that everyone is aware of 'need to know' information - the night will smooth out.

Title: "Don’t take care of their managers"
Pros: Great staff work hard but under paid
Cons: Doesn’t take care of managers and if the Akom doesn’t like you,You will not move up.
Advice to Management: Start taking care of your managers and moving them up in the company

I had to quit because I felt like I was I wasn't appreciate with A FREAKING BREAK .. so busy daily which makes the time go by but your going to be a in bad mood everyday with your employees attitudes and customers...THE PAY IS NOT WORTH THE PAIN AND STRESS!

Advice to Management: I feel that I should have been getting paid more for how much work I did. I took other workers shifts and worked for almost 12 hours straight without a break because it was inconvenient for management at that time to give me a break.

Title: "Favoritism"
Pros: Coworkers are nice...hours were good, in the beginning at least. 25% off when you eat as a guest and 50% on the clock. Free soup and soft drinks.
Cons:
Ugh. Where do I begin? Let me start off with this goes for the Valencia location, in California. I cannot stand this place with their favoritism.
The only way to move up in this place is if you do doubles all the time and kiss up to them.
I get harassed by my managers with weird comments. I don’t want to get hit on by my managers.
I literally only get 10 hours a week when I was offered 24-30 hours a week.
They are CONSTANTLY HIRING PEOPLE when there is NO need to hire anymore people. 20 hosts is a ridiculous amount already. Why are you hiring more?

Moving up to a server as a host? Oh, you’re funny haha. This is a position that is at the bottom of the totem pole to the restaurant.

Told my manager I needed more hours and he still only gives me 10.
This place is driving me crazy.
Advice to Management: Please....just be more professional and stop hiring boys who just hit on employees all the time. And please stop hiring mass amounts of people all the time. And STOP with the blatant favortism. I can see on HotSchedules who you schedule more often and it’s always the same few people every week. It’s so rude and unprofessional.

Title: "hostess"

Cons: long hours, rude guests, disorganization

Title: "Great work environment"
Pros: We work as a team and no one is ever left out. The managers do their very best to make every employee feel as if they were at home. We have a very extensive menu allowing customers to have many options and servers to have a more diverse food experience. By memorizing and knowing in full over 150 items on a menu expands your marketing and sales skills.
Cons: Working for a larger corporation means less independency. If you are seeking to have very close relationships with managers and corporate, this is not the job for you. The job is also extremely face paced and for some people can be very tiring.

Title: "Great Serving Position"
Pros: Great environment great tips great team.
Cons: Busy fast paced environment

Title: "Worst job I've worked (plater)"
Pros: Free cheesecake and sometimes food
Cons:
Only one plater in the bakery in the morning. This means I opened alone.
I had to sort and organize and inventory in the freezer that was -5 degrees. It took me anywhere from 10-60 minutes depending on the size of the order.
We would have two cashier behind the counter and one or two more handling curbside. But the plater is the ome that has to habdle the cakes, prep, stock, and clean. The cashiers were always just standing there doing nothing. Watched some play with staplers while I was running myself ragged.
The pay is crap
My schedule was never right. I would be scheduled to be off at 2 but really I wasn't off until 5.
There were no structured breaks and, since the cashiers stood around most of the time, I often went an 8 hour shift without a break.
You dont get comped meals. You have to cross your fingers for a green ticket.
Advice to Management: Add some structure to breaks and staffing

Title: "Busser"

Cons: Managers give off the vibe that they care most of the time they do but a bunch of the time they don’t care for what we need
Advice to Management: Listen to your employees.

You are supposed to claim tips, they expect you to claim 12 percent of your daily sales, sometimes you don't make that much and are then disciplined for not claiming the right amount.

Various employees were getting into it on the floor right in front of customers yet all the managers would do was talk to them and maybe give them a "slap of the wrist" type of punishment.

Title: "Serving at The Cheesecake Factory"
Pros: High volume, good tips, only 3 other people to share tips with: busser, bartender and food runner
Cons: Sharing tips with 3 other people, favoritism, if you don't get tipped you better hope your state pays a good minimum wage, support shifts are required, culture is to comp food for slightest dissatisfaction or grievance, people realize they can get an easy comp so they test you, no automatic gratuity for large parties, it often took a very long time to receive my tips and actually leave work because the cashier for the bakery is the person who distributes your tips and they are required to serve customers before giving you your tips so if there is a line out the door for the bakery you won't get your tips for awhile
Advice to Management: Better system for receiving tips and checking out, eliminate seniority and favoritism culture when assigning preferred sections, don't be so quick to comp a guests bill, trust your servers and stop micro managing them, mitigate in-fighting between employees better, establish an automatic gratuity for parties of 8 or more

Title: "Server"
Pros: Honestly, this company has a lot of resources and makes really good money. That being said, it is a very Top-Down Corporate run place: meaning that you do it their way or you will not last in the company. I've worked at 3 different locations throughout California and the managers (mainly the General Manager) make all the difference in the world. Once you start with the company, it can take time to prove yourself and earn the better shifts. It is pretty easy to make good money even in sections that are not good. It is a lot to take in at first, the menu is huge. The restaurant gets insanely busy and you have a lot to do work wise. But they tend to hire great people, and it has been a wonderful experience. James Frasier of Cerritos, CA, and James Westbrook of South San Jose are the two best GM's you could ever ask for :)
Cons: Their business model is to appease any guests that complains enough. I saw this devalue the restaurant and train guests to be needy and difficult.
Advice to Management:
Get in touch with the "grunts" who make everything function. Start actually listening to what bartenders, cooks, servers, bussers, and hosts have to say. We see things that you are just not able to see and understand from your angle.

Stop attending to guests who abuse your generosity in hopes of appeasement. It is OK to tell people they are wrong and make them pay for things that THEY ORDER.

If you are going to seat every seat the moment it is available, even when servers and the restaurant is slammed, have extra hosts and bussers help with drink orders, bread, and greets :)

Title: "Host"

Title: "Server"
Pros: Incredibly flexible work environment by and large. My restaurant was high volume, so you could count on a regular income.
Cons: Off-kilter management who so happened to be in charge of the server schedule. Somewhat broken restaurant and with it being so busy, if any link in the chain came undone, we as servers were on the chopping block being that we interfaced with the customers.
Advice to Management:
Pay increases for the BOH staff and you wouldn't have so much turnover or end up short handed which in turn causes flaws throughout the restaurant. The term 'broken restaurant--broken kitchen, etc' was used redundantly, and I completely understand why.

If you want to bring Cheesecake back to its once high reputation, then look to offering competitive compensation, equitable server schedules, etc. Even a slight improvement would go a very long way.

Title: "Server"

Title: "grueling"
Pros: great people to work with
Cons: two weeks training program is almost pointless

Title: "Got me through college!"
Pros:
This was my first real job at the age of 18 and it taught me great customer service skills. I started as a host and was then moved to the bakery. During the end of my employment, I found out that I was pregnant, and they started to give me more shifts where I could sit in the office and take orders over the phone. At this location, I worked a lot of doubles and close to open shifts. I went to school during this time, and the managers were all very flexible about my schedule. This job will teach you the ins and outs of how restaurants operate and the longer you stay, the more responsibility you will be given.
-understanding coworkers and managers, who are always willing to listen to any problems you might have
-ample amount of breaks throughout your shift if you ask
-free soup, bread, and drinks
-50% of meals, and free meals if you work a double or are rewarded for hard work
-ability to work very few hours, or pick up shifts and work many hours
-ability to move up in the company, but it will take years so stick with it
- you have the ability to earn tips
Cons:
-consistently stressful, loud, and crowded
-fast paced
-some guests were very rude to the staff
-kind of feels like high school, some staff and guests just won't like you no matter how hard you try.
-always on your feet
-never affected me, but I saw some hostess ostracize one another and it felt cliquy
-the work gets pretty physical and can definitely do damage if you're a hard worker
-if you're a hard worker, you might be moved linearly in the company rather than further up in position..sure you'll get more experience in a different area but you'll have to work harder for a very small raise (about .50 each raise)
Advice to Management: #1 advice: love each other and be on each other's side. Be more holistic in your expectations of your employees, and play by the same rule book. If something isn't allowed, then all of the managers should be on board about enforcing it. Try and make more time for team meetings or one on one reviews. The team meetings always helped remind workers of what they should and shouldn't be doing. I loved the Tigard management team and respect the amount of work they do to please all of rude guests and whiny pregnant hostesses they have to put up with (;

Title: "Hard work, good pay, hit or miss depending on Management"
Pros: The money is great, as you'll get regulars who spend a lot of money because they consider the food better than your average casual restaurant, but you also get a ton of special occasion parties. If you live in a city with a lot of conventions, you'll make great money. My training has been a huge boost to my resume, as I am told at almost every service position I've applied for that Cheesecake Factory has one of the best training programs, and people who come from there are always a cut above. I started out with them, and it was hard without any experience at all, but once I learned how to be a good server with a place that big and with that kind of menu, I've been set ever since. They taught me a lot. I also loved how flexible the schedule was, compared to some jobs I've had. I miss all the cash flow!
Cons: It's all about management. Starting out, the managers were there for the staff. After a few years, positions rotated, people left, and new Managers came in who dealt with staff as though they were wayward children, and it was at that point that I left. I liked that CCF treated us like adults and gave us respect. A few bad managers changed the whole dynamic, and the restaurant went downhill from back to front. My $ started to suffer because the kitchen was so badly managed and the FOH management was operating via negative reinforcement (taking away the bread knife, over-stacking the food-running schedule and still forcing servers to run food every time we came back on the line, etc.). I was sad when I left, as I had to watch it go downhill right before my eyes. It's a great company, but that bottom-line mentality seems to be affecting their standards.
Advice to Management: Treat employees with respect. Punishing is for parents, not for managers.

Advice to Management: Know when to be flexible and when not to be

Title: "A strange place to work"
Pros: They really train you to know their 200 + item menu, it's a really sanitary environment, health benefit options once you hit full time, great employee incentives
Cons: Tips from guests usually range about 15% at the location I was at, co-workers and managers were racist/homophobic, so many ridiculous requests and bill splits from guests, unfair distribution of sidework, not a fun environment to work in.
Advice to Management: I would advise management at Cheesecake to remember that they work for a major national brand. Some of the racist and homophobic remarks that came from management's mouth in a "joking" way only reinforced that it was okay for their subordinates to do so as well. I was truly appalled by some of the things I heard.

Title: "This is non biased"
Pros: The managers were in the beginning excellent the trainers are still excellent. But they demean you they want you to think cheesecake is your life. No family no friends just work. And forget making a schedule request they say in the interview they will work with you but that is a lie.
Cons: Mangers. Teamates for the most part are good but one of the bartenders lied on me and got me in trouble for no other reason that I rushed her at making my drink
Advice to Management: Listen to employees

Title: "Good pay"
Pros: Good pay, steady hours. They offer great benefits for employees who work more than 25 hour weeks. Lots of opportunities to grow within the company.
Cons: It's a very high stress environment due to the flow of guests in the restaurant. Each teams depends on one another and if just one person doesn't do there job, it can cause problems for everyone.
Advice to Management: For the most part, the restaurant is run excellently. However management could definitely take more time to ensure that when you come to them with an issue, that they resolve it in a fast paced manner.

Title: "Don't work here"
Pros: Reduced meal on breaks and free coffee
Cons: Management turned horribly lazy after restaurant opened. Favoritism. New employees were in charge of dishwashers. People acted as if they were doing work to make themselves look good. Managers do NOT care about you. Had an accident and when asking for help a manager told me to go away and get back to work because they were busy. Talked to other staff members, waiters did not split tips properly. Worked 80+ hours a week. Break and shift meal not guaranteed. Almost no days off. Staff came in drunk and smelling like weed. Also saw employees taking liquor. Helped prep food but no additional pay. No career advancement. Working here is like running a race and everyone is told they're in 1st place and that they're going to be rewarded.
Advice to Management: Quit and make room for people who value employees and hard work

Title: "Second Home"
Pros: Sense of family, top notch pay & benefits, emphasis on quality of life.
Cons: Rapid expansion, thinning talent pool, staffing challenges, unreasonable labor expectations.
Advice to Management: The busiest restaurant should not be running the thinnest labor numbers. People first, not profit.

Title: "Server/Bartender"
Pros: Great company to work for.
Cons: Over-staffed at times. Hard to make money when you're only scheduled 2 days a week.
Advice to Management: take care of your staff and they will take care of you

Title: "Good Multinational Company to Work"
Pros:
All the necessary equipment is always ready to work, the team work actually works in this restaurant.

The do several interesting team activities outside work.

Manager in general try to motivate employee in several ways like competitions and others.

The low season almost don't exist, always have clients!

They use hotshedules app to make the turns, is really convenience, usually conceives the day off request.

You can travel/work when you like to any USA state. One week a weaken or more time.
Cons:
You have to take to much test and memorize the extended menu. The trainee is hard in comparison to other restaurants.

Some managers apparently are not aware about pregnancy protections in PR and treats pregnant women really bad.

They are to demanding about don't make mistakes, the administration monitoring voids likes comps. That can bee more stressful to the already high demand profession (server).
Advice to Management:
Corporate have to understand San Juan PR legal protection to employees better. Is not the same as USA 50 states.

If a server work hard and hace several years in the companies you can pay more than $2.13hr. Keep your good talent, can go to better well paid restaurants.

Title: "server"
Pros: great work environment. keeps you very focused
Cons: gets a little too strict sometimes, but the tips is well worth it
Advice to Management: if it becomes more of a fun environment, everyone is happy. I do understand it is a franchise and it goes by specific requirements

Title: "Great company"
Pros: They respect and recognize hard work. They work as a team and management takes advice and input from lower employees.
Cons: Sometimes management is unwilling to promote. They over work all the servers. Pay is not quite whay id like for the hours I work and people I deal with.

Title: "Good Place to Work"
Pros: They definitely take care of their employees
Cons: Lots of lazy managers, because there is much red tape as there is to get rid of employees.

Title: "Hard work"
Pros:
Great pay
Had a good manager (varies)
Fun coworkers
Decent benefits if you're full time
Cons:
Little or no chance to move out
Lots of people come and go
very very stressful job
Some a**kissing coworkers
Managers pick favorites
Outtime is always 2 hours later than given time
Be prepared to work 8-10 hour shifts

Title: "Server"
Pros: I was able to make great money in a short amount of time.
Cons: The management team was awful in Palm Beach Gardens and was basically a revolving door. They did not promote within unless you worked as a server for a minimum of 10 years.
Advice to Management: Look at the leadership qualities of the staff you have and hire from there. This is too big a corporation to hire outsiders with no knowledge of the "cheesecake way".

Title: "TCF"
Pros: Good tips, good restaurant experience
Cons: too hectic at times, ill-prepared for shifts
Advice to Management: Prepare better for shifts

Title: "Busser"
Pros: Good tip money on the right days bussing the right sections
Cons: Free-for-all among other bussers for plates, glasses and silverware from the dishwashers. If you didn't have enough dishes, silverware, etc. for your station you'd get way less tip money at the end of the night. There were times I had plates, silverware, glasses and napkins stolen from my station because of other bussers' lack of common courtesy.
Advice to Management: Buy enough supplies so bussers never have to worry about running out or stealing from their coworkers.

Title: "server"
Pros: great company, great management, always room for advancement
Cons: nothing bad to say about cheesecake

Title: "Cashier"
Pros: Amazing people. They give you a lot of hours. Management respects the days you request off. Always busy so you always have something to do. Hardly any boring moment. Somewhat easy to move up.
Cons: For some people, the hours might be too much and could be too busy for some people.
Advice to Management: Please just learn to appreciate the people that give their best and not to focus on just the bad things.

Title: "Great Money Hellish work place"
Pros: Always busy, flexible schedule, well known and loved restaurant concept, great benefits
Cons: Miami location is one of the poorest in quality out of the entire country. Senior management abuses employees and plays favorites. High stress enviorment
Advice to Management: Have respect for your staff

Title: "Say Cheese"
Pros: best place to work hands down
Cons: there are none for me

Title: "baker"
Pros: if you are passionate about working with desserts, then this job would be perfect for you. Coworkers are helpful and friendly.
Cons: None that I can think of. You just need to have flexible hours and know your station.

Title: "Waitress"
Pros: Good atmosphere and pay was decent
Cons: Long hours with minimal break times for double shifts
Advice to Management: Build and develop employees careers

Title: "Great management"
Pros:
Good tips
Great Management
Great team
Cons:
Have to dress up for work
Don't grat
Advice to Management: Keep it up!

Title: "They are terrible"
Pros: A Free slice of cheesecake
Cons: Just about Everything else about the job
Advice to Management: Do better

Title: "Sinking Ship"
Pros: It's a busy restaurant & tips average to be pretty good.
Cons: Current General Manager is not a manager. He manages nothing & holds no one accountable for anything. He's causing the place to fall apart.
Advice to Management: Get your act together!

Title: "Designated Trainer"
Pros: They give excellent Hours options
Cons: Unfortunately they are Open late
Advice to Management: Great job

Title: "Fast paced"
Pros: You'd never have to worry about not getting hours, employee discounted lunch, friendly atmosphere, opportunities to move up to Line/Prep Cook
Cons: Very busy on weekends, sometimes don't close until late/ early AM, could do a number on your body if you aren't used to it

Title: "Best serving job I have had"
Pros:
Lots of room to move up into management
Great training events and worker motivation
Opportunities to open restaurants in different countries/states
Great leaership experience
Cons:
Management could use better communication
Many times essential tools provided by management are not available or broken for long periods of time
Serving sections will greatly dictate your pay
Advice to Management: Make use of technology to communicate better both to management and to employees. This could fix numerous problems that occur daily in the restaurant.

Title: "Assistant Manager"
Pros: Great name to work for and training structure
Cons: Too corporate, I like creative freedoms.

Title: "Cashier/baker"
Pros: I always had Flexible Hours. I worked with an awesome crew.
Cons: I do not have any that i could think of
Advice to Management: None

Title: "Server"
Pros:
Coworkers can be very amicable
Tips can be very high due to the high prices on the bills
Cons:
Want workers to be fully involved in serving and neglect outside responsibilities or opportunities
No set schedule
Progress to a higher level of management is unlikely
Advice to Management:
Be more understanding and considerate of employees personal lives
Moderate employee conflicts
Follow company regulations, because they are not just limited to servers

Title: "Server"
Pros: Great company really care about employees
Cons: Will have have that one manager!
Advice to Management: If you cant handle the stress of restaurant management then find another job

Title: "Hostess"
Pros: Friendly and very organized management
Cons: There really are no cons

Title: "Cashier"
Pros: hours, good pay, caring managers, food, guests are nice
Cons: unpaid breaks, constant change in management

Title: "Area Director"
Pros: Great people, systems, training, standards and benefits.
Cons: be prepared for high complexity, high expectations and accountability.

Title: "Manager"
Pros: Plenty of opportunity for growth
Cons: Talk down to employees and treat them as tools
Advice to Management: Remember the people are your greatest resources

Title: "Okay"
Pros: Always busy above average money easy to get time off
Cons: better money can be made at plenty of other restaurants

Title: "Prep Cook Slicer"
Pros: Free food ( staff menu ). free drinks. free soup and bread. 25% off.
Cons:
Managers try and kick you out before shift ends. If you're not going fast enough they will put someone who's been there for a long time to finish and send you home. they'll ask someone to help you when they're finished making them eventually dislike you because they have to stay longer. When you're suppose to take your break, no one really goes because they're trying to finish fast. which leaves you to be the oddball bc you want to sit down. I never took my break besides when I was training.
Lastly and most importantly because it was the main reason why I decided to leave was the fact that there was no love here. recipes were too corporate and sad. we didn't hand cut many things and there was no passion. The key to why I chose this profession was because I saw others passion and love. There were no high stakes. No make it or break it, as you would see in a restaurant owned by a chef or a mom and pop. if you honestly could care less about that then I highly recommend this job.
Advice to Management: You say you send us home early because its slow and you're losing money but the cheesecake factory is a huge corporation and I have a hard time believing that they can't pay for us to work our scheduled hours. I also don't understand why you force others to help us. you're basically making our coworkers slowly dislike us. So my advice to you is instead of sending someone home (especially if they're new) have them work alongside the faster person so they can note some tips they have and slowly mimic them in order to gain speed. I grew faster at the morning things but never had much practice at the end of the list (meats, bread) because by the time I would get around to it you would send me home.

Title: "Cheesecake Rocks!"
Pros: growth opportunities, great benefits, competitive wages, stability, professional environment, team oriented. Top 100 of best companies to work for.
Cons: very demanding, unpredictable, cater to the guest more than necessary.
Advice to Management: Listen to your employees more

Title: "server"
Pros: flexibility in schedule, hot schedules
Cons: Need better management and organization.

Title: "Server"
Pros: The Store is very busy. There are many good people that work there . The food is a scratch kitchen and the variety is huge .
Cons: Little to no benefits, they don't give there employees anything . Since the store is so busy the staff and managers are always stressed out
Advice to Management: Make employees happy it goes a long way . Give them good benefits, insurance, happiness . They will work harder for you .

Title: "Don't bother working here"
Pros: When you find coworkers you get along with, it really does feel like a family
Cons: Constantly understaffed. The same few team members constantly call out but never seem to be disciplined or fired. High stress environment in a constantly busy restaurant.
Advice to Management: Listen to your staff more. It feels like our concerns constantly go unheard and unanswered.

Title: "Management can make the difference"
Pros: I loved my coworkers and the money was consistent. Always busy so time always passed quickly. Flexible schedule and plenty of people on staff just in case you need off in a pinch.
Cons: Clientele gradually got worse and found it hard to advance in my store due to GM. Had support from all other managers but GM kept asking for me to do more and more with no end in sight. Good job but hard to advance in some stores if you're looking for a career.
Advice to Management: Don't take advantage of hard-working, loyal employees.

Title: "Best company to work for"
Pros: You make amazing tips and meet great people
Cons: The managers are very hit or miss at their job
Advice to Management: Remember when you were a server

Title: "manager"
Pros: money menu culture food challenge
Cons: lack of being able to advance quickly

Title: "Eh"
Pros: Great management and awesome staff
Cons: Horrible tippers in this area

Title: "fun enviroment"
Pros: Great culture. Always busy! Food is great
Cons: Employee benefits could be a lot better

Title: "job review"
Pros: lots of opportunities to move up
Cons: long holiday hours, a lot of weekends

Title: "Benefits"
Pros: Good medical, use to be better
Cons: Long hours and very strict management

Title: "Server"
Pros: People run your food for you and managemament is nice also you get to be flexible with what days u work
Cons: They sometimes give you jobs to do that you didn't sign up for like being a food runner even though your a server
Advice to Management: Hire the specific people for the specific job you want if I'm a server I do not want to be working a breaker shift it shows how much they don't care

Title: "Flexible and fun"
Pros: I have worked for Cheesecake Factory for over five years now and really enjoy the flexibility they allow me on my part-time schedule. It's a fun work environment where I have made many friends and a great secondary income stream.
Cons: Restaurant is very often super busy so shifts can get stressful.
Advice to Management: Keep up the good work!

Title: "Excellent Place to Refine Skills and Network"
Pros: for a server/bartender, the pay is above average for similarly priced restaurant options; definitely a place to grow; excellent travel opportunities; Fortune 100 Top Companies to work for (#48) for the fourth year in a row
Cons: very rigid and sometimes unrealistic corporate guidelines; management salaries for external hires is higher than internal promotions

Title: "Make that money"
Pros: Excellent community of workers, business is strong and steady
Cons: Inconsistent messages from management and frequent management turnover
Advice to Management: Get on the same page, promote the people who deserve it regardless of personal feelings

Title: "Server at the Cheesecake Factory"
Pros: I loved working at the The Cheesecake Factory. I really like having a flexible work schedules. The Managers in Tucson are fantastic. It is what you make it. If you want to work a bunch and make money you will if you don't want to work as much you can work less.
Cons: I really don't really have too many cons. It was one of the best jobs I have had.

Title: "Should add gratuity"
Pros: Flexible schedule. Staff of honest, and hard working people. Promote teamwork.
Cons: Serving 90% tourists and You will get 0 tip one to two times daily! Very hard work for a resteraunt.
Advice to Management: Care more about your employees please. Add gratuity like other restaraunts do. Please!

Title: "server"
Pros: work with great people, make money anytime you work, great management
Cons: no gratuity any more, at the mercy of the guest who come in

Title: "Server"
Pros: Discounts, flexible schedule, different positions to fit different personalities
Cons: Busy most of the time
Advice to Management: Improve teamwork

Title: "Server"
Pros: Fantastic company to work for! Very flexible with scheduling.
Cons: No cons that I can think of.

Title: "Working for the Big Cheese"
Pros: It is full of great people that I love. Very flexible to accommodate doctor appointments and family engagements and vacations.
Cons: Some of the management are still adjusting and communication is sometimes poor. Just take your time and always deliver your needs and wants clearly.
Advice to Management: Please take more time to listen to and help your staff. A lot of the reason we are often behind or frustrated is because we need your assistant and are unable to receive it.

Title: "Good place for first job"
Pros: Flexible hours and good pay
Cons: some customers are very arrogant
Advice to Management: keep up the good work

Title: "Fun Place to Work - A lot of DRAMA"
Pros: Lots of Perks: $5. Cheesecake Sales, Summer Picnic, Christmas Parties, Catered Lunches, Monthly Activities, Fun Outings, Soda Machines, convenient Kitchenettes
Cons:
A lot of DRAMA - Anything to deflect or get ahead is accomplished through back door conversations
Parking is not optimal
Work Life Balance is not optimal
Advice to Management: Look at your core team of executives - are they doing what they say? Or doing to get ahead? Listen to the staff members.

Title: "One of the "Top Places To Work" for a reason!"
Pros: A family environment! Also filled with tons of perks such as health benefits, paid time off for hourly employees, discounted meals, etc. I have been able to request off and travel freely as well.
Cons: Intense, fast paced environment at times. Working with the public can be tough.

Title: "Busser experience"
Pros: Good tips, flexibility with schedule, good staff
Cons: Waiters can be greedy sometimes

Title: "Love but hate"
Pros: Benefits great company to work for they will take care of you lots of room to advance can move anywhere
Cons: Management only cares for them self will hire anyone off the street that can walk or talk no brakes on you day will work 4 doubles in a week and not hit over time will close one day open the next making it a revolving door
Advice to Management: Take better care of your employees show us why it's in the top 100 places to work for

Title: "love it"
Pros: you can make good money here
Cons: long hours in a busy environment
Advice to Management: good job

Title: "General Manager"
Pros: great pay great business model, great sales
Cons: long hours, no holidays off, long shifts,

Title: "Sub Par"
Pros: The best thing about this place is that it was very busy which meant more tips.
Cons: You have to tip the bartender out based on you food sales even if they didn't make you a drink. Food sales has nothing to do with the bar. Cheesecake Factory is greedy and wants the servers to pay everyone instead of them having to do it.
Advice to Management: Advice to the CEO: Stop being greedy and have the servers tip so much to all the other employees in the restaurant so you don't have to pay them.

Title: "Good place to work in college"
Pros:
- Great staff
- great food
Cons: -extraordinarily long work hours, but that's expected

Title: "dishwaher"
Pros: great pay for what you
Cons: i dont really have any

Title: "Great!"
Pros: The management is really understanding. The restaurant runs smoothly. Flexible hours and great discounts and pay. Overall a great time!
Cons: Not many complaints. All really dependent on your coworkers. A lot of the busers would show up late or mysteriously disappear during work and I as a hostess would have to step in and do their job.
Advice to Management: Encourage more full restaurant interaction. As a hostess I don't feel like I really knew any of the kitchen staff, including the kitchen managers.

Title: "Hostess"
Pros: Fast-paced environment, fun interactions with guests, occasional free food
Cons: Stressful and not enough rewards, short shifts, not consistent enough with enforcing dress code, favoritism
Advice to Management: Stop picking favorites, understand that it's okay if someone doesn't get seated under a certain time (there is more to life than Cheesecake Factory)

Title: "Server/Foodrun"
Pros: Co-workers are like family, we all help each other out and the money can be great. The hours are flexible.
Cons: Management is horrible. Kitchen is inconsistent. Clientele is awful. Too stressful to be "just a serving job". They always manage to send you home right before you hit 8hours so you never get paid OT.
Advice to Management: Hear us out. Stick up for us because we're not allowed to stand up or speak up for ourselves.

Title: "Server"
Pros:
Busy
Good food
Flexible schedules
Cons:
Open late
Huge menu
Food running required
Advice to Management: pay food runners directly instead of allowing servers to pay what they want and make less than 9$ an hour

Title: "Hostess/Server/Bartender/Curbside Takeout"
Pros: Worked at Cheesecake Factory Winter Park for many years. I loved everything about it. Flexible scheduling, good pay, great management, great benefits and training, and coworkers who are now lifelong friends. They know in order for the company be successful, they must first make the employees sucessful.
Cons: None- really. I mean that.
Advice to Management: Keep doing what you do!

Title: "multi"
Pros: great structure room for advancement
Cons: coworkers are not dedicated consistently
Advice to Management: care

Title: "Amazing restaurant to work for."
Pros: Amazing training and helpful employees
Cons: Management may be stressed at times.
Advice to Management: Listen

Title: "Overworked"
Pros: Work/Life balance was great!
Cons: Horrible management staff. Would only promote favorites without proper training.

Title: "Busser"
Pros: Good money and a lot of hours
Cons: A lot of coworkers with poor attitudes because of stress during the job

Title: "Best Restaurant I have worked for"
Pros:
Always busy
Higher menu prices
Company has strong morals and structure
Cons:
Some management should be retrained
Broken / missing essentials for getting job done
Failure to address issues at their origin, allowing the issues to persist
Advice to Management: Communication between management and staff needs to be more clear and structured. Issues go noticed but undermined as something that should be addressed seriously.

Title: "Precise to a Tee"
Pros: very easy to earn great tips, and its a challenging job that keeps you moving
Cons: very strict. the individual employee does not matter. since they are all-out business and 0% about the employee, i noticed a very high turnover rate
Advice to Management: treat your employees correctly and value the work they do. people have lives outside of work and try to leave them at the door. don't be so quick to fire someone because the make a mistake. we are all only human

Title: "Server"
Pros: Good benefits, volume, room for growth
Cons: Instability, mandatory runner shifts and breaker shifts
Advice to Management: Change mandatory runner shifts

Title: "Area Kitchen Manager"
Pros: Great place to work for
Cons: Opportunity to grow and quality of life
Advice to Management: Great

Title: "Good Company"
Pros: They invest a lot in your training, there are a lot of oportunities to grow in the company, its a very friendly work environment, there is a lot of motivation and recognition
Cons: Advancement is very competitive, pay isn't as good as it should be for a company of this size, communication is lacking, turnover is very high so there are always new people training
Advice to Management: Take the time to listen to your employees and allow them to work together to solve their own problems. Never take veteran employees for granted, or make anyone feel disposable.

Title: "Server"
Pros: Flexible schedules and consistent tips!
Cons: none, love working here.
Advice to Management: Keep it up!

Title: "for guests it seems great other hand for kitchen and prep workers not any good reviews"
Pros: great atmosphere for those to maintain positive attitdte with co-workers
Cons: very unorganized system in the back kitchen really no structure

Title: "Operations Support Technician"
Pros: Great family environment. Best benefits in the restaurant industry.
Cons: Lack of cohesive team work. Managers are so overwhelmed with their daily tasks, that they often forget important details.
Advice to Management: Provide more opportunities for advancement in the OST role. This is such a critical role in the operations of the restaurant and yet it often gets treated as an afterthought.

Title: "Very rewarding in many aspects."
Pros: High level experience due to the fact that the menu is one of the biggest in it's category. If you can make it here you can make it anywhere.
Cons: The only cons are that to make good money you need to do alot of no break doubles it wears you out.
Advice to Management: None needed...

Title: "Cheesecake Factory"
Pros: The atmosphere is great and friendly
Cons: No breaks for extremely faced paced
Advice to Management: Make sure everyone gets a break

Title: "Server"
Pros: Great money and great atmosphere cheesecake rocks
Cons: There are no cons in my mind
Advice to Management: Keep being positive and supportive

Title: "Cheesecake Factory"
Pros: Amazing people, great work environment, and a great opportunity to make quick money.
Cons: No set hours, very few full time positions, no benefits.

Title: "Server"
Pros: Great money, great gig to get through college. Flexible hours.
Cons: Management doesn't do a very good job communicating company values, beliefs or mission. It feels as if you're being led blindly. No ACCOUNTABILITY whatsoever. If you want the day off, just call in. They won't fire you... or even write you up for that matter. It's frustrating to those who work hard. I've unfortunately been victim to picking up the slack of lazy workers because the management has no backbone.
Advice to Management: Become a better middleman between your corporate managers and lower level employees. Instill some accountability into your workforce, and 'trim the fat.'

Title: "server"
Pros: new food items a couple of times a year.
Cons: management hires some not so bright folks.

Title: "Can be really lucrative but varies through the year"
Pros: When we are busy, it's pretty easy to make money, but during the slow seasons, (there are two) it's really hard to even make over $100 a week.
Cons: Can be a very disorganized restaurant, making busy times at the restaurant chaotic and difficult to perform simple tasks.

Title: "Unbeatable structure & efficiency!"
Pros: rigorous and informative training, great staff as well as helpful, knowledgeable, and experienced management, and always upholding their pristine reputation for quality and superb service.
Cons: too many people working at any given station at once
Advice to Management: fire some people. keep the best and let them shine through instead of hiring loads of people at once, and leaving their strengths unnoticed.

Title: "Serving"
Pros: Coworkers are great, food is great, and sometimes the money is good but varies.
Cons: The clientele is not great and sometimes deal with terrible people. Management is unorganized.

Title: "It's ok"
Pros: None because the restaurant is all about numbers
Cons: Total disaster when management doesn't hold staff accountable
Advice to Management: Learn to be there for staff.

Title: "Cheesecake factory great place to work"
Pros: Very team oriented. and great management team
Cons: No cons presented themselves

Title: "Waitress"
Pros: All the employees are fun to work with. Busy restaurant so typically good money.
Cons: The clientele can be a bit rough sometimes, especially at the galleria.
Advice to Management: Do not have so many favorites. Everyone deserves a chance to work in the best sections.

Title: "It was Disappointing and unrewarding."
Pros: Being able to cook, with people & share the experience.
Cons: Broken equipment, weak management, teamwork was not there. Poor problem solving skills.
Advice to Management: Properly train new employees.

Title: "Server at Cheescake"
Pros: It's always busy so there's always an opportunity to make money
Cons: Management does care to fix actual issues
Advice to Management: Apply time and effort to real issues within the restaurant as opposed to minor ones

Title: "Great Company"
Pros: Working for a company that takes pride in everything it does can be a wonderful experience. Great benefits and stock options for managers and excellent salaries.
Cons: Long hours and some General Managers that do not respect your days off can make things difficult.
Advice to Management: Area directors should treat their managers like they expect their managers to treat the staff.

Title: "Overall experience as a server"
Pros: Great working environment, business at all times of the year (not just during season, I live in Florida).
Cons: During holidays like Valentine's Day, Mother's Day, etc., one would have to work doubles without break. On the bright side, you can always give your shift away, or at least try to.
Advice to Management: You are definitely in the right direction.

Title: "Host"
Pros: Great company! Very organized, simple, and fun eviornment with room for growth! Was a great, qvove minimum wage job for me while i was in college. Flexible schedule as well.
Cons: Sometimes hosts are left short staffed for awhile or not enough move up to filler positions but that is eventually resolved.

Title: "Ups and downs"
Pros: A lot of the people I worked with were extremely friendly. Some of the managers were nicer than others. Not many places better to be a busser though. Great tips
Cons: Long hours. No breaks. Not a great employee discount
Advice to Management: Provide a food break for double shifts

Title: "Summer Job"
Pros:
Learned valuable customer service skills
Made a decent wage
Fast-paced and high demanding, that created a good work ethic
Cons:
Ever-changing work staff
High stress job

Title: "Server"
Pros: There are many pros to working here. Corporate really takes care of you and find many ways to hear your voice. The job itself is hard because when it gets busy it's insane but you make a lot of tips depending on where you are.
Cons: Group managers play favoritism therefore it's really hard to get the sections of the restaurant that you really want. Also during slow season- if you don't have a second job you're basically making nothing.
Advice to Management: Stop showing favoritism and treat each server equal unless there are extenuating circumstances. Learn how to schedule so that during slow times there are fewer servers on the floor.

Title: "Busser"
Pros: Decent tips, flexible scheduling. Tipped out at 2% of restaurant's sales.
Cons: Tips are shared between bussers regardless of one person working more than another.

Title: "An amazing place to grow and learn!"
Employee Title: Lead Trainer, Food Quality Manager, and Server
Pros: Family atmosphere above all. The ability to grow and learn is of the utmost importance. The Cheesecake Factory allows team members to harness abilities and move forward. Foremost, the pace is fast and the guests are amazing!
Cons: High pace environment and extensive menu.

Title: "Racker"
Pros: Very useful for future jobs
Cons: Not ask that friendly towards black people

Title: "Great people and atmosphere"
Pros: The people here are amazing and the company is awesome to work for. One of the best server jobs I ever had! Always busy so there is always money to be made.
Cons: The uniform is not the most comfortable, but its not the worst. The shirts can get messy very easily and need to be replaced. One food run shift is required per week,

Title: "Reliable, easy job."
Pros: Flexible schedule, great location, supportive management, this company does care about it's employees and ensures there are ample ways to take care of them.
Cons: High turnover, have been told other locations even within region are more enjoyable.
Advice to Management: Some people get away with things others never would. The concept of "playing favorites" is easily seen throughout FOH and BOH.

Title: "Senior General Manager"
Pros:
People
Fortune 100 company
Compensation and benefits
Pride and cultural diversity
Sales and quality
Cons:
Long hours
Demands of volume of sales number of guests and staff
Level of fun and enjoyable shifts
Advice to Management:
Be prepared to deal with volume that you haven't seen
Attention to detail is paramount
Depth of knowledge takes a lot of time and self direction

Title: "Hostess"
Pros: One of the best jobs I ever had! Management was wonderful, extremely helpful and very professional. And the food is to die for
Cons: Just the messy employees, they talk way to much. But other than that nothing negative to say
Advice to Management: Keep being professional and doing what you're doing. But pay a little higher please

Title: "Server"
Pros: I love my job and working with others.
Cons: There are no cons I can think of
Advice to Management: None

Title: "Hostess"
Pros: 50% off food but ONLY the day you work.
Cons: Terrible management. Cant begin to explain how power hungry and childish the managers are. They choose quantity over quality. Meaning, if you're full time-you better forget it cause they'll hire like 10 people at a time and you'll get 2 days a week that are 3 hour shifts.
Advice to Management: Quit being so power hungry. When an employee needs your help, don't treat them like they're stupid and that you're better than them.

Title: "Server"
Pros:
-Big Company to work for
-Ability to move into management positions based on your work ethic
Cons: The management team is all about the guests and sometime step on the servers toes or make the server look bad just to appease the guests.

Title: "Great company, but work lots of hours"
Pros: good benefits, great company reputation, competitive compensation
Cons: LONG hours, high stress, thankless
Advice to Management: It is important to not only hear how one can improve, but also to know that you've done well at a task, and I never experienced positive feedback from area directors, despite receiving positive feedback from direct supervisors.

Title: "Terrible"
Pros: Good values, strong benefits, caring
Cons: Long hours, little pay, lot of responsibilities

Title: "Server"
Pros: Ability to pick up/give up shifts, friendly employees/managers
Cons: Very corporate atmosphere, very different management styles.
Advice to Management: None

Title: "Working At The Bakery"
Pros: I got to meet new people and I love the smell of the cakes and expresso drinks
Cons: A little unorganzied at times but thats about all.

Title: "Fun job"
Pros: meet fun people, diverse environment
Cons: management would say they would listen to your schedule and requested days off but then do the opposite
Advice to Management: Pay attention to workers

Title: "Server"
Pros: It was a great paying summer job. They like to promote within as well. I would make at least $100 a shift, with the top end up to $300 a shift.
Cons: The managers would often be too stressed to help any issues and often times were hard to find in the event they were needed. The customers often times expect the world delivered to them with no compromise to speed or quality.
Advice to Management: The customer is not always right. Constantly comping their meals because they find a problem (after they ate most of the meal) just invites this behavior to continue and justifies them being angry for no reason.

Title: "Really depends on the location"
Pros: made some great friends and learned a lot about the restaurant industry. lots of opportunities for internal advancement, you just have to be willing to go for them. great place to work if you move around a lot because of the number of locations
Cons: customers can be awful, but not really something the restaurant can control, it just seems to be kind of a magnet for them.
Advice to Management: keep helping the staff when things get hard

Pros: Best GM in the world.
Cons: Nothing that isn't currently being improved.

Title: "Server - intolerable favoritism, not ideal for really good servers"
Pros:
Good money if you are a good server and have energy to flip your tables.
Plenty of shifts.
Decent food.
Easy system and easy menu despite complexity/size (if you're not incompetent).
Cons:
Too many open shifts. They always want you to work more and will push your availability to the limit or even schedule you outside of it.
Everyone around you will frequently be angry or stressed out; managers, especially co-workers.
Fellow servers and bartenders will pseudo-haze you pretty bad here compared to other places.
Favoritism is the strongest I've ever seen at any place. If your managers don't like you or if you are a more business-minded person who is there to work or have reasonable standards for hours/shifts, you will never move up.
Terrible sections with no fair way of assigning them. Not based on any merit besides seniority or if the managers like you.
Sections are way too small. I know 4 tables is a lot for some people, but I was relaxing with 4 for months and never got moved up to a better or bigger section. It made me work less hard and become lazy because showing that I had time to help others and maintain restaurant was not paying off as much as waiting or picking up shifts would.
Discount could be a little better, when things go wrong they go really wrong overall.
Advice to Management: Be less biased toward new workers. Value quality of work over hours worked. Somehow find a way to play favorites less. Show a good side of your company to new employees so you aren't a revolving door constantly desperate for people to work shifts because people quit once they realize they will be stuck in a 4 or 5 table section in a bad area of the restaurant.

Title: "Review"
Pros: Good benefits and free meals
Cons: Long hours and very busy company

Title: "Hostess"
Pros: Great fellow staff. Great atmosphere. Great food. Sort of all the reasons you would go there as a patron were also good reasons to work there.
Cons: Did not always have the support or man power that it felt like was needed to be able to perform our jobs well. Also, we were sometimes criticized and scolded by management for over-quoting wait times, even though that would prevent meltdowns from patrons when they would have to wait longer if we underquoted them.
Advice to Management: Support your front desk staff better. Those women and men are the first face and impression when you walk into the restaurant and also deal with some of the worst attitudes.

Title: "work"
Pros: great friendly place and good environment to work. The company treats its employees very well and equal.Good opportunities to advance in the company.
Cons: have to work nights and days and weekends.
Advice to Management: HE COM

Title: "No life outside of work apparently"
Pros: Learn a lot and can advance your career at your own pace.
Cons: GMs are hard to get a hold of to help with learning. Micro managers. Hectic and unsanitary practices. Unfair treatment of staff at times mainly kitchen. Managers are not backed up in manager staff issues.
Advice to Management: Staff needs to be held more accountable. I caught several cooks stealing and nothing serious ever came of it .

Title: "It was an appropriate job for the time being."
Pros: Flexible. Most of the time it was a fun environment to work in. Food is good. Great job for students or as a second job.
Cons: Uniforms suck. High volume restaurant that also reflects in the variety of customers; good and bad. Management was at times odd. Lots of favoritism and pressure. Seemed like management would turn a blind eye to somethings, even managers that would act or say inappropriate things to other employees.
Advice to Management: Be more normal.

Title: "Great company"
Pros: Good management and company to work for.
Cons: Not many considering it's a fast paced chain restaraunt.
Advice to Management: keep doing what youre doing

Title: "Server"
Pros: Excellent flexibility in schedule, make decent money, coworkers are awesome
Cons: Very hectic and unorganized sometimes, clientele can be bad
Advice to Management: Listen to your employees

Title: "Front Desk"
Pros: Management is great, really supportive of staff!
Cons: Customers are often very rude!

Title: "Host"
Pros: The staff are very friendly and the location is beautiful. They are also very diverse.
Cons: The managers are horrible with scheduling.
Advice to Management: Pay attention to workers' scheduling.

Title: "Great Perks!"
Pros:
The company itself is a great company to work for.
I enjoyed the perks and benefits.
Pay was pretty decent as well.
Cons:
Management wasn't the best.
Hired FT would end up working less than 32 hours. I was lucky if I got 20/hrs.
Advice to Management: Work together! If management was on the same page I may have stayed.

Title: "Cheesecake Factory Corporate"
Pros: The company puts a lot of effort into making sure their employees are happy. The general environment is one that's healthy, friendly, and encouraging.
Cons: The company is very traditional and the office is very corporate. As for career building skills, I'm not sure one would find a lot of movement here.

Title: "I just don't know"
Pros: Staff is allowed free soup, bread, and soda and 50 percent off an item for working a shift
Cons: Not enough managers on the floor, not enough expos, no one supervises employees opening duties. Guest to managers on duty to handle problems are not addressed. Long cook times. No grats allowed on parties.
Advice to Management: Tend to your flock and your flock will bend over backwards for you. There shouldn't be food prep in hall outside of bathrooms

Title: "Cheesecake"
Pros: Working at Cheesecake (Waikiki) has taught me a lot about human relations. I get the have the opportunity to meet many different guests whom traveled from different places and learn something new about them.
Cons: Although, Cheesecake factory (Waikiki) is one of the most popular factory in the United States, working with your coworkers can sometimes be frustrating because of all the pressure. Therefore, negativity is a constant cloud that floats on everyone's head.
Advice to Management: Be more understanding of not your the restaurant's guest but your coworkers.

Title: "Great management"
Pros: Managenemt is wonderful and well organized. They know how to act professional regardless of situations.
Cons: Money can be hard to keep stable as holidays come and go. You have to have a tough side otherwise people will pick you apart. There is lots of gossip too.
Advice to Management: Youre doing a wonderful job as it but we would you prefer if you look at our requests off and grant those to us. Thanks.

Title: "Server - austin location"
Pros:
People
Flexible
Benefits
Really, these are the only pros. The location is so slow it's a struggle to make $400 a week! Unlivable wage.
Cons:
Inconsistent
No money
Managers are inconsistent
Kitchen is horrible (long ticket times, inconsistent food)
Unappreciative
Austin location started out great, as the time went by things just went downhill. Training new employees was unsatisfactory. New trainees are thrown out on the floor unprepared. The Kitchen has horrible ticket times. Food would always be taken back because it was prepared wrong.

Title: "okay"
Pros: Good pay for the work. Tip sharing with bar staff, bussers, etc.
Cons: Called in for shifts and sent home if not enough guests showed up. Being asked to block off time and not be paid for it.
Advice to Management: N/A

Title: "Great Staff - Exhausting Job!"
Pros:
You meet tons of great people because of the vast amount of staff.
Most managers are very nice accommodating and helpful.
Food is amazing.
Pay is pretty great.
Very easy to obtain overtime.
Cons:
Can get EXTREMELY busy and stressful.
Some managers will not want to do their jobs.
Very specific sometimes outrageous customers.
You will barely ever have a time for a break especially once Lunch and Dinner rush begin.
If you close you will be there late.
You are always forced to stay overtime if you try leave without your specific duties being done.
Advice to Management: Listen to lower staff more! From experience, they usually know the best and most efficient ways to complete their job fully and efficiently.

Title: "part time"
Pros: It was a lot of fun
Cons: It was very busy during dinner
Advice to Management: nothing

Title: "Server/Designated trainer"
Pros: Benefits food schedule flexibility environment
Cons: Poor recognition process clientele turnover
Advice to Management: Teamwork is key and management should work to help their employees feel like they too are part of a team to help them in anyway and not just part of management

Title: "Fair& Honest"
Pros: Fair, honest company. Good opportunities for promotions from within. Strong family culture
Cons: Difficult, somewhat overwhelming work expectations, strong family culture
Advice to Management: Take the time to speak with all the staff members beyond your group/your side. Its difficult with the amount of staff and sales volume but goes a long way to develop the family culture.

Title: "Line cook"
Pros: One of the best growing restaurant companies.
Cons: This company hires unprofessional managers with little or no education.
Advice to Management: Go to college get certified :)

Title: "Great Place To Work But With Its Consequences"
Pros: Great Advancement, Learn the entire business, fun, health benefits are really good
Cons: A RIDICULOUS amount of work, long hours, difficult to get the time to advance, bonus structure is terrible, accrue vacation hours with time.

Title: "Great Company"
Pros: Working at this company was very fun, the management was great and super supportive, while the job itself was very flexible which was great
Cons: Work tends to be very fast paced which gets very tiring, and get very messy working here.

Title: "Stress, Incompetence, and more stress"
Pros:
Good pay, good hours, good food.

Latest new system made it easier for salad/sandwiches coworkers (no more randomly asking for W/salad...but they still asked for them anyway even with the new system in place).
Cons:
Incompetent managers making stupid decisions such as this: Management foolishly hired two new people to pizza; thus, leaving me to fend for myself. While I was being overloaded with salads/sandwiches, the two guys in pizza stood there helplessly with nothing on their screen. While they couldn't do anything to help, the idea of hiring two people to pizza instead of an extra to salad/sandwiches was an incompetent thing to do, and it only added to the stress of working inside a hot, nasty kitchen.

Working in the salad station was/is a trap, and I see why hardly anyone lasts in that station without either transferring or quitting completely. Salad/Sandwiches must remember all the ingredients for EVERY salad. Sounds easy until you see that there are far too many salads to remember by heart. Management would not allow you to move on to another station unless you remember salads that not even the management knows. It was simply their way of keeping a coworker confined to salad/sandwiches...and now I see why other coworkers avoided working over there.
.

High stress was to be expected, but hardly getting help (being a female worker) was ridiculous. I had to operate both salad/sandwiches when both screens were packed full of orders, and the management expected me to literally do all of those things at once. When overwhelmed with work, I was told that it was my fault for not being organized. Yeah, excuse me for not having four extra arms.

I wanted a clerical position, but I soon found out that moving to that position wasn't going to happen since the salad/sandwiches position is a TRAP.

Management regularly allowed orders pass the closing hour, even after the kitchen closed.

At certain locations, management made up rules---basically trying to flex their managerial muscles on coworkers who they felt they could.

Many other male coworkers (when frustrated) would throw serious fits of rage, (slamming things, bouts of swear words etc), but those same coworkers seemed to have kept their jobs....coworkers who worked there for YEARS. When I became angry, I was written up twice and threatened with suspension---which ultimately left ended with a subtle "you're fired".

Servers were at times more annoying than guests with asking for salads before they would even appear on the screen, and often getting orders wrong which resulted in me stopping my rush flow to make side salads....yet they wondered why salads were coming out late most of the time.
Advice to Management:
Particularly at the North Star Mall location:

You take the sides of your incompetent managers before you would your coworkers, and then you wonder why salad/sandwiches is always looking for workers. Kitchens are expected to be busy, but don't expect one person to do twelve thousand things all at once. Treat your coworkers with respect, especially females working in the back of the house.

Train up managers who actually know what they are doing, and not snotty minded people who have to bully coworkers just to flex their managerial muscles.

Last but not least, hire an exterminator....figure it out.

Title: "Server"
Pros: Very flexible with your schedule
Cons: none.. management and co-workers have treated me excellent
Advice to Management: Keep up the good work

Title: "Great life experience"
Pros:
-Flexible hours
-Great money
-Solid corporate infrastructure
-Value extends beyond money
Cons:
-Inconsistent pay if server
-Management issues
-MUST have a thick skin
-Very, very stressful at times
-Long hours, constantly moving
Advice to Management: The management needs some work, way too drama-oriented and disrespectful towards staff at times. Certainly not horrible, but a few bad apples.

Title: "Waitor"
Pros:
Flexible Hours. Easy to fit to my schedule.
Good management is present. We often work in a team environment to accomplish tasks and initiatives.
Great coworkers makes for a great time even when at work.
Cons: Difficult and rude individuals are a norm working in a restaurant. The management and team creates a positive environment in order for this to not effect the state of the work place. Overall great place.
Advice to Management: Everything is great. There may be a need for more staff during busy hours. Improving overall customer service and delivering on great food should be our goals.

Title: "Great for students"
Pros: Depending on managers, your schedule can be very flexible allowing you to do both school and work at the same time. Fun environment to work in if you are in your twenties. It's great fast and easy money.
Cons: Very corporate. Corporate does not take into consideration how employees feel when it comes to certain things. They have tunnel vision when it comes to being "by the book" and "how it looks to a guest" rather than what is more practical. It's all about the look rather than what's more logical.
Advice to Management: Be open to listening to your staff

Title: "Room for Growth"
Pros: Tips are decent year round. Holidays are great money makers.
Cons: Communication between the management team and different work groups is lacking.
Advice to Management: Sensitivity and diversity training should be extensive.

Title: "My time"
Pros: Great food great service great time
Cons: I don't have any cons
Advice to Management: Great job with the staff

Title: "Fun Job! :)"
Pros:
Wonderful, friendly, helpful coworkers!
Fun!
Great atmosphere!
Good pay!
Glitzy and classy but still casual enough to really enjoy.
You get to make people happy!
You get to sing!
You're up and moving for 4 hours and it doesnt feel like work.
Great food ;)
Cons: I dont have anything bad to say about Cheesecake Factory. Its the best restaurant.

Title: "Server"
Pros: Very steady money for a serving job.
Cons: Lots to learn about the menu.

Title: "Kitchen manager"
Pros:
Fast pace, never bored, always something to do or look over, friendly and hugely involved,
always in a station or working the expo window.. multiple times throughout your day to coach staff.
Cons: very much the same thing everyday, hardly anything new to come through the kitchen, hundreds of employees so head always on swivel. people who have worked there for years will still come up and ask the same questions everyday, very little employee retainment of knowledge. cooks and servers hardly keep any information.
Advice to Management: keep positive, you will be pulled away from tasks all day to help and coach other staff members, never tie yourself down to one project otherwise it will more then likely not get done,

Title: "Server"
Pros: Great company with good benefits. Lots of sales with decent tips.
Cons: too many employees. hard to get a regular schedule. New people get only 2 or 3 shifts which makes it hard to make money.

Title: "Just another resturant job"
Pros: bus tables, refill water, etc etc. job is simple.
Cons: employee politicts really get in the way
Advice to Management: none

Title: "Best Company to Work For (Forbes 100 approved)"
Pros: Flexible schedule, world class training, phenomenal corporate leadership, ease of ability to share your voice and ideas with people who have power to change policy and procedure
Cons: They change the menu every six months and that can be challenging for die hard fans of specific entrees. Not EVERYTHING changes, but sometimes a favorite gets deleted to make room for a new item.
Advice to Management: It helps to have shift alignment every shift to keep servers happy. And please manage the 86 list so we don't have to chase you down for updates.

Title: "Good company"
