Pros: Working as a server the tips are great and it helps that they have food runners so that you get more tables to serve.
Cons: Every few weeks you have to food run and you only make about half the tips as you would when you serve. Sometimes pretty long hours.
Advice to Management: Be more respectful to employees and try not to play favorites or act rude when trying to explain things.

Title: "Service"
Pros: Great start up job for anyone
Cons: Hard to move up

Title: "Dishwasher"
Pros: Lots of hours and overtime. That is all the pros about this job (you need a 20 word minimum to submit this review so I'm just wasting words)
Cons: Extremely busy therefore your coworkers and even management give you poop about taking your break. If you do a good job they won't move you up into a better position, if you do a bad job they also won't move you up so you're stuck as a dishwasher until you quit.
Advice to Management: PAY YOUR DAMN DISHWASHERS WHAT THEY DESERVE!

Title: "Server"
Pros: great work environment, restaurant set up is great for servers to move around and get their job done, great management, flexible scheduling, great tips, no coupons
Cons: getting write ups when someone walks out on their bill even when it's not your fault, side work can take up to an hour or more, the uniform always gets dirty or messy

Title: "Not what it used to be"
Pros: Some of the most amazing coworkers, fun work environment over all, generally busy when other restaurants around us are not
Cons: Some condescending, unsupportive managers. Policy and procedure enforced inconsistently, equipment is aging and not replaced
Advice to Management: Although food servers/waiters are highly replaceable in this area, treat us with respect, and as though we matter, and we will stay. Our employee morale is directly related to how we are treated...good morale begins with you

Title: "Server"
Pros: Good small company, your opinion is heard
Cons: There are no health benefits

Title: "Living Wages"
Pros: The healthcare plan at this company is actually pretty decent and less expensive than searching for a plan of your own. This company cares about its employees, often asking for their input on new recipes, policies, and ideas.
Cons:
Unlike many other restaurants, Cheesecake Factory has refused to reinstate the18% automatic gratuity for parties of 6 or more. Occasionally, a server can go home with $0 after taking care of a party of 20 for two to three hours.

The management varies from location to location and can make or break this job. Some managers are willing to listen and to help, but some managers border on tyrannical with several gender or racial biases. Again, this is not the case for every location.

Title: "Great place for a first job"
Pros: I was a buster when I was at the Cheesecake Factory and it was a great job to have in school. The schedule was very flexible and they worked around my classes and sports. All of the other buses loved to work also. So if you needed a shift off, most likely someone else who is off will want the shift. For night shifts I was walking away with over $100 under the table just about every time I worked. Day shifts were a little bit slower but still brought home around $50.
Cons: Long hours with no scheduled break, on your feet for 8 hours at a time

Title: "Server Trainor"
Pros: Great team, flexible hours, good pay and benefits
Cons: weekends are required, schedule not flexible

Title: "Server"
Pros: Provides experience for fine dining in a family service restaurant. Constantly teaching & critiquing proper server etiquette which encourages improvement.
Cons: Assistant management felt entitled in certain areas and lacked exceptional communication skills.

Title: "Great tips, crew and managers"
Pros: It all depends on your manager and the tables you get. Everyone I worked with was great and I had great managers. Everyday is different depending on your customers and the table section you get. Do your job well and you will get great tips and be happier.
Cons: Feet hurt, people can be rude and you eat a lot of cheesecake!!
Advice to Management: Take care of good employees

Title: "Server"
Pros: High energy restaurant with corporate regulations but family type atmosphere. High sales means high tips.
Cons: Not guaranteed a certain wage due to fluctuating tips. Having to perform food run shifts. Not having auto gratuity for large parties.
Advice to Management: Management varies from location to location but overall it's improant to listen to staff and care about the restaurant. If a boss doesn't care, employees won't care.

Title: "Don't waste your time at this place"
Pros: For the most part the schedule is flexible although employees are required to be available on Sundays.
Cons: They take pride in the fact that they are part of the "Fortune 100 best companies to work for" but they treat their hourly employees like dirt. At my location they are so over staffed that no one can work enough hours to keep their health insurance. The managers have bad attitude all the time. A lot of the times the servers get stiffed on large amounts of money because they don't add the gratuity on large parties, but are still expected to tip out. Those are just a few of the many things creating a hostile work environment. Most employees are leaving or looking for a second job because you can't live with what you make there. However, if you are looking for a serving job, have no experience, and don't know what you are doing, you most likely will get hired.
Advice to Management: Stop hiring so many servers, bring the gratuity included back, work on your bad attitude or get another job that you can deal with.

Title: "Cheesecake Factory Review"
Pros: Hard working people. Kind and considerate, always willing to lend a hand. Free bread, soup, and drinks.
Cons: Understaffed dish pit. Physically demanding work, and extremely loud.
Advice to Management: Heat protection gloves for the catcher. A minimum of at least six people for the busiest days.

Title: "Server"
Pros: Paid training, no hidden expectations, high volume, fast-paced. The products sold are top-notch and therefore easy to sell. Daily shift meetings provide time for sharing concerns with management. Food runners are available to help during prime times and the entire staff works like a team.
Cons: Parking at different locations can be challenging. Many employees are long-term which can make upward movement potential seem slow or limited.
Advice to Management: Rewarding staff can promote superior performance.

Title: "Decent job"
Pros: Discount on food, and co-workers were fun and nice.
Cons: Management had no idea what they were doing. They loved to use intimidation to get things done, instead of just being kind to their employees. Made for a very tense work environment.

Title: "server"
Pros: employment discount in any cheesecake restaurant. schedule is very flexible.
Cons: not all the managers care about the business, rude costumers

Title: "The Cheesecake Factory Forbes Top 100 Workplace"
Pros: Competitive advantage and job security in the industry.
Cons: Bonus structure below peer group.
Advice to Management: Benefit, vacation, and bonus plans can be more in line laterally.

Title: "Kitchen manager"
Pros: Great company have a lot of aportunity to learn more
Cons: Lot of hours but very great company

Title: "Cashier/Baker/Food Runner"
Pros: Working in the bakery at the Cheesecake Factory was an alright part-time job when I was in college. Some of my managers and coworkers were really hard-working, caring, interesting people. It was also very easy to change my schedule, which was a nice perk. Free soup, bread and soda at lunch was nice too.
Cons: There weren't always enough people scheduled to work in the bakery, which made weeknights very stressful - mentally and physically. Bakers received minimum wages, and cashiers made little extra in tips, so there wasn't much of a monetary incentive to offset the aggravating aspects of the job. I planned to work my way up to serving, but noticed that servers with bakery experience were often given low-earning bakery shifts.

Title: "Management"
Pros: The money, flexibility, great co-workers
Cons: Management lacks consistency, long hours especially on weekends
Advice to Management: Learn how to talk to and treat your employees better. Show that you genuinely care for your staff.

Title: "OK place to work"
Pros: Free meals for working doubles.
Cons: The hours weren't great, short staffed, and too much overtime.

Title: "Operations Support Technician"
Pros: Benefits, regular hours, paid vacation.
Cons: Low pay, little room for growth.

Title: "good atmosphere"
Pros: One of the most flexible jobs you can have. The money is there if you work hard to find it. I love hotschedules.
Cons: There aren't enough breaks. Sometimes working as a server requires 12-14 hours on your feet with minimal breaks.
Advice to Management: Value your employees. Reward employees for taking initiative. Be sensitive of doubles and allowing breaks. Hold all management and team members to a high and consistent standard.

Title: "KM"
Pros: Eat free everyday and the staff are awesome!
Cons: Nmro every 6 months and prep list are crazy!!! (100% scatch kitchen)
Advice to Management: Please be honest with each other ....dont talk behind ppl backs and if you have issues take it up with that person and definitely not the staff.

Title: "Server"
Pros:
Great Staff members
excellent quality and portion sizes
lots of team players
always a food runner
always a busser
Cons:
bad organization
lack of communication w/ management
Management needs to work on treating ALL employees the same
too much favoritism
unfairness
Clientel

Title: "dishwasher"
Pros: good hours time goes by farily fast free food.
Cons: stinks, hot plates, understaffed, messy

Title: "Level 1 manager"
Pros: Growth potential. Leading chain. Looking to innovate. Company takes feedback well. Employee recognition.
Cons: Low pay, long hours, labor shortage, unrealistic expectations.
Advice to Management: Cost of living increases annually, more vacation, realistic bonus structure.

Title: "Good company, long hours"
Pros:
Decent pay
Supportive management
Employee discounts
Cons:
Long shifts
Heavy work load
Advice to Management: Be more proactive in informing staff on phase times, wait lists, and opportunities for upward mobility to those who express interest. Not every good worker wants to threaten you with quitting to move up.

Title: "Server"
Pros: Super flexible work hours and they really go out of their way to make sure your schedule is the best for you. They also truly care about their employees.
Cons: Some of the management team that they hire or promote are not qualified for their positions but get the promotion because they have seniority.
Advice to Management: Remember when promoting staff or hiring new management staff that the ability to lead is important not just dictating.

Title: "Line cook"
Pros: Great teamwork environment, you feel like you're part of a family, great pay as well
Cons: Management can be demanding and also inconsistent. Corporate visits are particularly stressful
Advice to Management: Don't have someone who has just been promoted to ekm or gm take over a store than has many issues.

Title: "Busser"
Pros: I worked here for 3 years and it was a decent experience. Coworkers are nice people and are there to get the job done.
Cons: A lot of the times it seemed that management did not really care about the employees. There was lack of communication.
Advice to Management: Show employees that you care more. I would get the feeling from management that I was easily replaceable and they didn't care about me.

Title: "Only here because of the money"
Pros: The money is good, that's the only reason I gave 3 stars.
Cons: Management is lazy. They act like they care, but in all reality do not give two craps about their employees. They are way overstaffed and keep hiring more people, so if you're able to work 5 days a week, count on getting three shifts.
Advice to Management: Give priority to those who actually do their job. Fire those who need it.

Title: "CCF Kitchen Manager"
Pros: CCF had the best health insurance of any company I've worked for. Their training is unsurpassed. Great team work throughout the company. Great opportunity to advance with them too.
Cons: Be ready to work hard long hours. Of you move up through the tanks they may not pay as well as when your hired from outside.
Advice to Management: Try harder to not burn out your managers. Make better efforts to keep the facility safe

Title: "Hostess"
Pros: Lots of interesting and cool co-workers
Cons: Needs people who can give a lot of time to the restaurant.can't take a few days off during holidays.

Title: "Not the best"
Pros: Easy to get shifts if you are a hard worker, reliable work schedule, they do not wear all white any longer
Cons: Too out for bartenders is not mandatory. You can work extremely hard and still not make much money depending on server tip out.
Advice to Management: Find a way to make sure your employees are taken care of when it comes to tipout, no oversight and no accountability

Title: "Host"
Pros: Great people to work with. Great learning environment. Flexible schedule. Busy and productive environment.
Cons: High stress. Demanding. Not great benefits for those not in management.

Title: "great money, great company"
Pros: the flexibility within the schedule. "hot schedules" allow you to modify your schedule as needed. sooo convenient
Cons: nothing. cant say anything bad

Title: "Hard working friendly"
Pros: How kind all of the employees were, how we all worked together to get something done.
Cons: The was I as a busser received my pay, it was hard to keep track of who had your money or how much they had. It was all based on the honor system and if there are corrupt CEO AND CFO then why would we put it past a couple of low level bussers. But I heard that they recently changed this which is why I am excited to get back there because other than that it was a great place to work for
Advice to Management: Make it easier to apply not all of us youngsters are tech savvy thanks guys

Title: "great"
Pros: great company to work for here/
Cons: Nothing at all I can say about the company.
Advice to Management: Nothing

Title: "Server"
Pros: It is very good money, and it is nice that there is such a big staff so you can get days off when you want them.
Cons: They do not care about employees, you are just a number to them. Management can be very rude at times.
Advice to Management: Treat you employees better. They are the face of The Cheesecake Factory so if they are happy your guests will be happy.

Title: "decent job"
Pros: Always busy, always able to make money
Cons: most of the Management

Title: "Many great things, but management is a problem."
Pros: Very popular & busy restaurant so it's typically a good place for a server to make money. Typically a good amount of shifts available.
Cons: Management can be unprofessional & too personal. They choose favorites. Often take a very long time to promote employees to higher positions, especially if you're good at your job.

Title: "Sr. II Manager"
Pros: Good up side to make it to Gm
Cons: Bonus program for managers is bogus

Title: "Okaybstepping point"
Pros: Easy work good stepping pt
Cons: Terrible coworkers and management, bad attitudes
Advice to Management: Hire better people

Title: "The location I worked was broken"
Pros: The Server staff was enjoyable to work with. The back of the house was nice. Parking was easy enough during non holidays.
Cons: Management insulted you. The back of the house was nice, but they sent out the incorrect food on a regular basis. I would have a food make error once per slow shift. Saturday night around 5 a shift. It was the dirtiest restaurant I have ever worked for. Nothing was ever cleaned properly. Floor to ceiling and every plate in-between I did not trust. Many things were broken and never fixed. Standing water in drains. You get the idea.I was also told I would be able to move up with the company. After leaving the company I found that was a lie to get me to work longer hours for free.
Advice to Management: Rebuild the restaurant.

Title: "Buyer"
Pros: Great overall company to work for, average compensation, benefits and paid time off. Positive atmosphere, there are many employees who have been with the company for 10+ years. 25% employee discount at our restaurants. Business Casual attire.
Cons: Would like to ability to work from home a couple of days a week, not currently available for most employees.

Title: "Line Cook"
Pros: you have an income to survive
Cons: Managers thinks we are slaves, they never pay vacation
Advice to Management: improve treatment to kitchen workers

Title: "The money is not worth it."
Pros: Great money. Flexible shifts. Ability to work overtime. Decent food.
Cons: Horribly managed. Nightmareish to say the least. I'm sexually harassed by management once a shift. I'm inappropriately touched by staff far more than once a shift. Management is short tempered and mean. They're desperate for staff constantly because of the high turn over. Left with bruises on my first official day from being slammed into walls by other servers. Management did nothing about it. I'm constantly forced to stay past when I should. I can take customers being rude but cannot handle how rude the staff and management are. Don't work here. I know you might want the money but it's really not worth it. Unless you're in the "Cheesecake Familia" you are physically and mentally harassed daily.
Advice to Management: Get better managers in your stores. Make better staffing decisions. Pay your food runners a livable wage.

Title: "server"
Pros: fun place to work at
Cons: clientele is not very nice

Title: "Great company"
Pros: Excellent training, great money, fun atmosphere
Cons: I have no cons about this company. If you work hard, this is a great place to work
Advice to Management: No advice, they do their job professionally

Title: "server"
Pros: easy scheduling, can request off or to work when ever you, easy to get your shift covered
Cons: blocked holidays, only receive tips you don't get pay checks just voided checks
Advice to Management: communicate better

Title: "Great company to work for!"
Pros: Excellent company to work for. There are many opportunities to move up and managers take care of you. Very flexible with your hours and feels like a family environment. Great money.
Cons: Can be a high stress environment at times.

Title: "Horrible"
Pros: They might care about you if you are white or a brown noser.
Cons: The unfairness in this company and corruption is alarming.
Advice to Management: If you have an employee that's dedicated 10 yrs to the company wanting to move up, PROMOTE HIM.

Title: "Hostess"
Pros:
Great "family" feel from all employees
Values hard work
Values team work
Cons: Does not often take ideas from staff to improve

Title: "Casheir"
Pros:
Friendly environment
Managers are very attentive to your work
Half off on your meals
25% off at every cheesecake factory
Cons:
Sometime have to stay overtime.
Inconsistent hours depending on how the day is going.
Have to put alot of effort since it's very fast pace.

Title: "Server"
Pros: Great company to work for. Hours are flexible and my management staff was awesome.
Cons: Some times you deal with long hours.

Title: "Loved it"
Pros: I absolutely loved working for this company not only do they work with your schedule but it is like working with a wonderful family
Cons: I don t have any cons really for working with the company. Sometimes I do feel like suggestions are always heard but changes may not take effect.
Advice to Management: I appreciate you allowing us to voice our opinions it would be more appreciative of you would let us know that it was received and give a reason as to why a suggestion will or not be used

Title: "Chef pasta"
Pros: Great staff great job management is fantastic
Cons: Alot of extras to do front of house employees

Title: "A good restaurant to start for your first serving job."
Pros: The food is good. You are able to release your shift and/or pick up shifts last minute. Big staff so you get to meet new friends.
Cons: Management sucks. Restaurant is super corporate. Like any serving job, it's a lot of hours in a week. Guests tend to be rude
Advice to Management: Care about your employees!!

Title: "Classroom Co-ordinator // Lead Trainer"
Pros: Rigid structure. Promote from within.
Cons: Too corporate. Sacrifice guest satisfaction for pure profit-driven model.
Advice to Management: Ease up.

Title: "Bakery"
Pros: Good desserts, coffee & placement
Cons: Slow to move up in location
Advice to Management: Be open to gradually moving employees up that show promise

Title: "Great place to work"
Pros: Good money available to those who work hard for it. Most managers always have your back. Very flexible scheduling thanks to Hotschedules. No real complaints about the company.
Cons: Its still food service. Many times fellow servers make life difficult, as do the customers from time to time. Long hours on doubles.
Advice to Management: Keep on keepin' on.

Title: "Great company to work for"
Pros: team based mentality, good benefit packages, managers always available for problem solving, excellent training, frequent meetings to discuss challenges, making each person feel relevant, the company stands behind their team. It is easy to sell their products because they are of high quality.
Cons: Most of their jobs include lots of memorizing and specific protocol, long hours, not too much flexibility in covering shifts.
Advice to Management: Most of their manages are well trained and friendly, however there are short comings. They are willing to work with new, unexperienced people to get them where they need to be. A more understanding approach to customer related mistakes.

Title: "Cheesecake Factory Coconut Grove, FL"
Pros: Flexible schedules were accommodated easily.
Cons: Career advancement was lacking in the South Florida area.

Title: "Good Overall Experience"
Pros: Forward thinking, positive attitudes, and good management for the most part. Its a big company with a great support system.
Cons: Sometimes by being such a large company there are things that take longer to accomplish. Most employee's are hesitant to voice their opinions or take ownership.
Advice to Management: If a project fails to meet expectations or deadlines, put someone else in charge of that project. Cut the deadweight loose.

Title: "Was good until they started blocking out the days you could request off!!"
Pros: Money every day as a server,reasonably easy side work
Cons: Stressful,rude,cheap guests,and the addition of not being able to request blocked out days off.
Advice to Management: When they started the blocking out dates you could request the place went downhill,before that when you requested a day it showed what number you were that requested that day,if 35 people request it off but you can only give it to 25 then the last 10 to request it are out of luck but at least they had the opportunity to request it,not being able to request it just brings more problems cause people are going to need the days either way.

Title: "server"
Pros: Fun, fast paced work environment. Great customer experience. Flexible hours.
Cons: Not always enough staff to cover shifts, can be stressful when at volume.

Title: "Operations Support Technician"
Pros: This is one of the most organized and resourceful companies that I've worked for. Corporate does its best to ensure that no one is left in the dark and that no questions go unanswered. Great people and okay benefits.
Cons: The pay is not competitive at all.

Title: "Great place to work"
Pros: The company has one of the best server training classes I've ever attended. They are very flexible with your schedule and personal needs. Most locations are always busy so in turn you make pretty good money. They offer PTO and Health benefits to the wait staff. They also encourage internal promotions.
Cons: Most locations are pretty busy so you will be scheduled doubles especially during the holidays. The locations operate 7 days a week and are only closed on Thanksgiving and Christmas.

Title: "Hostess"
Pros: Great environment and superb management, learned extensively about customer service and how to cooperate with conflicts, overall an amazing company to work for.
Cons: Hours are prone to be cut short.

Title: "Server"
Pros: Good atmosphere and people, they give you all the tools you need to succeed and car about you
Cons: Not much room for growth, if your looking to grow into a management position, expect to be a server for 10 years, they usually hire outside manager
Advice to Management: Very organized but not much room for income growth, good job for entry level but not by any means a career

Title: "good"
Pros: Great pay, free food, friendly environment
Cons: Non flexible hours, strict rules, long hours
Advice to Management: Keep doing what your doing

Title: "Great place to work"
Pros: Flexible hours, great management vey understanding and cared for you, great advancement opportunities, great food, free meal for napkin shifts, and overall positive environment.
Cons: Average pay, short hours in the summer (but this is at any restaurant), employee discount only 25% off, and rude servers. Also stressful during the fall and holidays.
Advice to Management: Overall great environment . Managers understood I had a life outside of work and were always very understanding. Always there when we needed them for guest complaints and reservations.

Title: "This is a good place to work for consistent tips."
Pros: The tips are good and consistent, this restaurant is a very well run place. No one does it as well as the Cheesecake Factory.
Cons: Very hard marble floors are hard on legs and feet. Plus you are required to wear shoes for crews and they are not supportive enough.
Advice to Management: Management was great. Secret shopper program was horrific

Title: "Excellent"
Pros: Great staff awesome cheesecake and polite people
Cons: Lack of soap not enough Sliverwear
Advice to Management: Keep up the great job

Title: "Voted one of 100 best companies to work for! True!"
Pros: Flexible hours, great management team, staff is like family even though there's 100plus employees, in Burlington Mall so always busy
Cons: In Burlington Mall so parking is tough
Advice to Management: Everyone plays favorites, but you shouldnt show it

Title: "Line Cook"
Pros: Intensive trainning, always hours to make money, discount food.
Cons: intensive trainning but too short

Title: "Great Company"
Pros: Awesome people. Family atmosphere. I recently started a new jb and they have been more than flexible in keeping me around.
Cons: The only negative thing I would say about Cheesecake Factory is that many of their employees go above and beyond for the benefit of the company. In which case myself and many like me believe we should be compensated a little more in checks. 4.75 is simply not enough to be making an hour. Often times employees will get a check saying "This is not a check". I feel as if it is almost punishing you for making good direct tips which shouldn't be the case at all.

Title: "All around a good time"
Pros: Great training program, opportunities for lots of money and advancement within the company, delicious food, friends you'll keep for a lifetime
Cons: Incompetent management, poor FOH/BOH collaboration, very corporate, sex and drugs culture that is at every restaurant.
Advice to Management: Value employees more, aim for excellence in management hires. Take the opportunity to reach out across race lines. Encourage working together and understanding culture.

Title: "Great company"
Pros: Great experience, always growing and changing. If you love to keep learning, this is the place for you!
Cons: Have to have thick skin, can get very very busy and overwhelming at times
Advice to Management: Remember you staff is on the front lines. And don't forget to thank them and give them a job well done

Title: "Dishwasher"
Pros: Free meals. That pretty much it.
Cons: Horrible management. The GM doesnt care about you.
Advice to Management: Get a new gm

Title: "Enjoyed Working but.."
Pros:
Great household name that everyone is familiar with so the restaurant stays busy.
Pay
Team Members
Guest Interactions
Cons:
Verbal Abusive Managers
Condescending Management
Worked at two locations and experienced managers that I just didn't like
I've had a manager take a drink out of my hand and throw it away
Advice to Management: Learn to speak to your employees.

Title: "Server"
Pros: A lot of the employees were great to work with, and the customers were nice
Cons: The managers always gave me a hard time when I needed them, which was often working at this kind of restaurant.
Advice to Management: Choose managers that are able to handle a high pace environment

Title: "server"
Pros: flexible schedule, decent money per hour from tips
Cons: deal with nasty guests frequently, high stress, physically strenuous

Title: "foreigners tiping"
Pros: fun environment and good food
Cons: foreingers dont tip for crap

Title: "Waiter"
Pros: fun environment, good money, and not difficult
Cons: bad management, horrible scheduling, do not care about individual waiters

Title: "Teamwork makes the dreamwork"
Pros: Typical server pros. Nights and weekends will be dedicated to Cheesecake. It can take a toll on your body if you consistently work day in and day out.
Cons: I love the teamwork atmosphere! Cheesecake has proven to be one of the best restaurants I have had the pleasure to work for. Opportunities for travel are open to the staff and they possess good values. I am pleased to have worked for this company.
Advice to Management: none

Title: "Line cook"
Pros: Great experience. New techniques. A lot of employees and a lot of hours. Great discounts great meal perks. Great food overall.
Cons: Downsizing employees. Phasing employees mid shift so u worked 2 hours and go home.. they treat u like a slave. Not a secure job even if youre told that.
Advice to Management: Be more respectful to the employees and treat them as they are humans. They are human like every human being not machines witch need to be consistent in everything. Consistency is death of originality and human nature. Nothing beautiful in striving for perfection.

Title: "Great company, terrible management"
Pros:
Great company
Great staff
Good hours
Cons: Terrible management: really the only downfall

Title: "Server"
Pros: The money, and working along with the staff is great
Cons: There were really no cons in working here.

Title: "Great place to waitress"
Pros: CF is a well-oiled machine. You will rarely if ever find yourself "in the weeds" (industry term), the money is great, the shifts are reasonable. I stayed for 4 years. No regrets.
Cons: Expect to train for nearly a solid month no matter what. Training is extensive and thorough. But once you get through it it will be a great paying part time job.
Advice to Management: None, they were all good and fair

Title: "Money's good"
Pros: You'll make good money as this location is always busy, however, the late night and weekend clientele are less than ideal. Also scheduling is pretty flexible at times.
Cons: If your availability is open, you will, i repeat, you will get worked to the bone. Management is almost 100% customer oriented at the expense of their servers sometimes.
Advice to Management: Bring back gratuity, put your "aces in their places", know which servers are trustworthy and trust them!!

Title: "Host"
Pros: Great food, great friends, and compensating salary.
Cons: No one owns the mistakes that happens. The managers don't want to be there, and the staff doesn't want to be there. There's no real organization when there needs to be.
Advice to Management: Managers tell you: the guest comes first. Your employees should come first, because without them, your restaurant wouldn't be in business. Take the time to get all of your managers on the same page, because organization and work relations are important.

Title: "Decent pay but lack of compassion."
Pros: Tips, room for career advancement, great environment for outgoing personalities, flexible most of the time.
Cons: Was scheduled outside of my set availability frequently and was responsible for finding coverage, most servers acted as those they were at the top of the hierarchy and other employees (bussers, hosts, food runners, etc.) were subservient. Treated poorly by majority of management staff. Was expected to work 12 hour shifts without a break. Leaving was not a hard decision to make.
Advice to Management: Take a genuine interest and care in your employees. Don't treat them as numbers or as expendable bodies. Stick to scheduling employees in the availability that you both agreed on. Fire the bad apples that are ruining the work environment for the few good employees that you have.

Title: "server"
Pros: Great atmosphere, great employees for the most part, great food
Cons: Nothing to speak of on survey.
Advice to Management: Nothing to speak of on survey

Title: "hostess"
Pros: Everyone is super nice and helpful. The ambiance and the people make it easy to feel great while doing your job.
Cons: Hard work even though it doesn't look like it.
Advice to Management: When someone does something wrong or is late, I recommend you to talk to them about it at the end of the shift rather than in the beginning. I say this because as hosts, we need to smile and be outgoing while working and it definitely affects your mood when you feel like you've already failed something or let management down.

Title: "Fresh Challenges Daily!"
Pros: Great group of people to work with everyday!
Cons: Too many TPS reports to count.

Title: "Hostess CCF"
Pros: Positive environment, great employees, will move you up if you work hard, awesome discounts!
Cons: Customers can be rude and demanding, a lot to learn at first, extensive menu.
Advice to Management: None

Title: "Server"
Pros:
- Always has business due to great locations
- Great brand name
- Pretty good benefit package
- Low employee turnover
Cons: - Very long hours especially on weekends.
Advice to Management: N/A

Title: "Server"
Pros: Working as a server at the Cheesecake Factory is a lot of work but it very rewarding! Not only do you have an amazing group of managers that go above and beyond to help you succeed every single day but your fellow servers will become more like your family! You really become a team in everything you do, even outside of the Cheesecake Factory walls. With their extensive training you really feel prepared for everything and truly are. I truly respect everything they do for their employees, they've really thought of everything! The best part is that you can pretty much work when you want to, the opportunity to take a week off is always available!
Cons: The uniform is so uncomfortable for us ladies! I feel like I'm stiff when I get out of there.

Title: "Great Starting Off Job!"
Pros: Work with an amazing team and flexible hours!
Cons: Very work intensive and tedious.

Title: "Server"
Pros: Very flexible (at my location) while I attend school for computer engineering. Meals are usually 50% off when paying for them (while working) if not free.
Cons: The lack of gratuity. It's really unfortunate that corporate has become such a cesspool that they obviously don't care enough about employee wages to fairly compensate us. For locations WITHOUT many tourists, who cares. Locations like NY, LA, San Fran, Chicago, Orlando, where it's HEAVILY based on tourists and foreigners, who typically are not used to tipping, we lose out, big-time. It has caused me to want to leave.
Advice to Management: Fight for your employees. You should actually care seeing as we are the front line of defense for your guests. Food can be the best on the planet but without great service, no one will return. The rating of Fortune's "100 best places to work" is garbage.

Title: "Waitress"
Pros: The good reputation of the place
Cons: I don't have any cons
Advice to Management: I don't get it

Title: "Server life"
Pros: Always busy with good clientele. Friendly staff.
Cons: Tip out is a lot.
Advice to Management: Smile more.

Title: "Good Company"
Pros: provides full menu reviews and educations
Cons: all depends on your store.

Title: "Fun place to be in, But needs better management"
Pros: Variety throughout work day.
Cons: PAY needs to improve for Bussers
Advice to Management: PLEASE GET ORGANIZED and MATURE

Title: "Good company"
Pros: Worked as a server. Good company to work for. I made good tips especially during summer. A lot of support from the management.
Cons: Fast paced environment, if you can't handle that not a good idea to serve in this restaurant. Winter time was dead and barely any tips made.
Advice to Management: None because cheesecake alone cannot change the fact that pay is $2.13/hr therefore pay check is 0 dollars every week.

Title: "Manager"
Pros: Lots of opportunities to move up or move location
Cons: Long hours. no set schedule

Title: "Server"
Pros: I was lucky to work as a server here because it is possible to make a living based off volume.
Cons: It is physically taxing work.
Advice to Management: Help your staff when they are in the weeds. Customers aren't always right.

Title: "Review for manager at ccf"
Pros: Loved it, great benefits, hard work but a lot of options to move up, love working for such a busy restaurant
Cons: There were definitely long hours and long shifts. I had to work all holidays and that was very challenging.
Advice to Management: I would say definitely know what you are signing on for if you choose to take on this position.

Title: "Great People to Work With"
Pros: The environment is great, great opportunities to travel if you become an opening DT
Cons: i dont have any cons for now
Advice to Management: Managers need to back their employees when a problem with a guests arises when the guest is in the wrong

Title: "Cook"
Pros: Challenging and fast past a large menu to learn for 7 stations and a lot of recipes to learn for prep. With right staff it can be fun.
Cons: Corporate and management gives promises but never follow through. I was denied my benefits when I qualified for them and was told I had to wait another 9 months before I could get the. Now I have a $150 thousand dollars in medical bill from an accident that I can't pay and would have been lower If I would have had my medical insurance that they denied me.
Advice to Management: Treat your employees like precious gold because with out them your business will not run. When you promise something follow through with that promise

Title: "Quality Casual Dining"
Pros:
Training intense but quality
Stable career path
Take care of their servers and bar staff
Good food
Cons:
Long hours
Low pay until AGM/GM level
Menu too large - complex recipes to memorize

Title: "Not much room for advancement"
Pros: Good co workers were what made it for me. Also the tips. Many of the customers gave large amount of tips.
Cons: Hard to move up, must start as a server. Large menu so it was hard to remember when you first started working there.

Title: "baker"
Pros: good management funny co workers, pay is okay
Cons: not enough hours low pay
Advice to Management: be fair give more hours

Title: "Server"
Pros: High energy atmosphere with great managers that support you with no bias.
Cons: Not many downsides to working there.
Advice to Management: Take better care of the bussers and back of the house staff.

Title: "Don't care about staff"
Pros: Meet new friends, fast cash
Cons: Rude guest, long ticket times,

Title: "Server life"
Pros: Flexible schedule, cash in hand
Cons: Working weekends and certain holidays

Title: "Love my job"
Pros: Great benefits and Traveling is always great.
Cons: Nothing at all really, just the same pressure as any other serving job, but if you love what you do. Than you will love it here.

Title: "Hostess"
Pros: The restaurant employs a large and friendly staff so the social environment is nice. Easy to get time off. Can wear your own clothes (just all black). Free meal on break if you work a double. Work with 3-5 other hosts.
Cons: I had two jobs as a hostess prior to working here and I did not enjoy my job as much; the others I really enjoyed. 1.) The pay was terrible, $8/hr with no tips 2.) It's common to work a double 2-3 days in a row. Keep in mind you're standing the entire time, you're not eating for hours, the restaurant is very large, and you're walking on stone floors. 3.) Only one host is allowed to stand at the front desk, the others have to walk around and do other duties like check restrooms, booths, clean the lobby, etc. Very monotonous 4.) Cleaning restrooms wouldn't be that bad if the guests knew what the hygiene bin was strictly meant for. 5.) I think the corporate setting restricted management. The guest was most likely always "right".
Advice to Management: For the most part management was really nice and reasonable. It's a corporate restaurant and I think their model works for that setting. I would recommend more breaks. One 30 minute break on a double was not enough. Time to rest and have a snack, like 5-10 minutes would be nice, because it isn't like there aren't enough hosts working.

Title: "Flexible"
Pros:
Flexible
Online Scheduling
Discount on food and cheesecake
Able to transfer to any location
Cons:
No automatic gratuity on parties
Complimentary Bread
Advice to Management: Get rid of bread and birthday singing

Title: "Good job for college students"
Pros: Managers are great with scheduling. Its a fun environment too. Tips are great compared to most chains
Cons: In Center City, so lots of tourists. Must stay on schedule year-round
Advice to Management: Order more supplies

Title: "In a place like this, the attitude starts from the top down."
Pros:
No matter who you are, you can most likely get a job there.
If you can last long enough to work your way up to become a server, you can make decent money.
The food is really good. Plus you can get waste slices of cheesecake that aren't perfect enough to sell for free. Easy job to gain 20 lbs if you're addicted to cheesecake.
Cons: In an environment like this, where it is fast paced, close quarters, and high level of responsibility the management will determine if this is a positive or negative environment. Sadly, my experience was negative. The management treated their employees like an object and not like real people, it created a very harsh and poison environment. It was hard to walk out of work with a smile on your face.
Advice to Management: Cheer up. Stay off the line and don't micro manage so much. Trust in your employees and stay out of the way. If they aren't performing the way you would hope, then that is because the training wasn't good enough and falls back on management. Instead you drive people away and have employees quit.

Title: "Good place for work"
Pros: Other employees were very nice and fun to work with, employment was solid
Cons: Hours sometimes sucked and when it got busy, people would over stress the situation a little too much
Advice to Management: none

Title: "Great place to work"
Pros:
Super extensive training
25% off for everyone on the check if you come in on your days off. NOT allowable friday or saturday
50% off when you work
Great great great food
Very non micromanagement
Hotschedules (online app for scheduling) Super easy to pick up and give away shifts!
Cons:
No room for job improvement
Managers dont care about you, they have their own jobs to worry about.

Title: "Server position"
Pros:
Excellent training program.

Very good management in general.

Some wonderful caring coworkers.

Busiest restaurant in the island. Very consistent, specially at dinner hours.
Cons:
Long hours with no time to rest. They say you can eat bread and soup at any time, but when you work in the busiest restaurant of the island you really have no time unless you forget your guests needs, after 6hours without a break to eat properly it doesn't seem human.

You are not told when you are in training for server that you will have one food run shift a week. Your average daily tip will go down with that.

It's Waikiki, most of your guests are tourist and the tip average will be low, from 10% to 15%. sometimes they won't tip because they don't know... The tip out ends up reaching 40% of your tips.

They also say ask anytime you have a question and be welcoming to new coworkers, unfortunately too much salty attitudes, in special from bartenders.

Sorry but great benefits doesn't make this one of the 100 best companies to work for by itself. It's organized and structured and in theory very good but the reality is another perspective.
Advice to Management:
Charge a service fee of 18% for foreign tourists with the possibility of correcting if the guest doesn't approve.

Management does a great job In general unfortunately failed to evaluate a conflict with me, did not care to know what happen. so next time listen both parts in private, keep the situation private and take conclusions carefully.

Title: "Human Resources Manager"
Pros: The Cheesecake was great. The bakery employees were great to work with. Good benefits.
Cons: The Corporate leadership was terrible, do as I say and not as I do attitude. Micro-managing but no follow up, just walk away. They talk a great game and for the restaurants they may be a great place to work but that does not migrate to the bakery.

Title: "Server"
Pros: The biggest pro is that it is a restaurant that knows what they are doing to maintain a customer base, and do not let any of their stores lack in cleanliness and upkeep. They provide a good training program and easy scheduling options.
Cons: A lot of the management is incompetent with organizational behavior and the top General managers rarely have any personal relationships and make decisions only based on profit maximizing rather than considering the employee morale ramifications.

Title: "They suck"
Pros: Good food, really good food
Cons: Management sucks, don't know what they want, lots of favoritism
Advice to Management: Train your manages better

Title: "Prep Cook"
Pros: High paid, good benefit, and flexible schedules.
Cons: May stand up 8 to 10 hours without break.

Title: "Great flexibility"
Pros:
The money can be good during weekends
Flexibility, whether you want to go on vacation or your in school.. Servers get lucky with their schedules.
Cons:
Dealing with rude guest
Not enough money sometimes
Very physical (back pain)
Unfair favoritism
Advice to Management: Focus on paying attention to who is the best versus who is your friend or who you like more

Title: "front desk"
Pros:
great company flexible
understanding management
accommodating to schedule
Cons:
long hours
terrible customers
fast paced
short staffed sometimes
double shifts are usually long

Title: "Server"
Pros: It was a fun fast paced restaurant to work at! The menu prices were high enough to make good tips and it was always busy.
Cons: There was a lot of turn over and much depend ended on what kind of manager came in.
Advice to Management: Be as flexible as possible with the employees, recognize and reward their achievements in order to retain good people.

Title: "Cheesecake Factory"
Pros: Great to work at fun
Cons: No real cons its fun

Title: "Avoid hosting or bakery"
Pros: The people you meet are pretty cool and the food is good. Some of the managers are awesome. BUT...
Cons: I was lied to three times during my interview. I was told I would make enough money to survive, I would get 40 hours and there was no seniority. I am not surviving (I can barely even pay just my rent), I have only gotten 40 hours once since I have started and people who have been there for 10+ years, stand around looking into their phones or yapping to eachother while you do all the work. Also if you are front of the house, you have to pay for your food (half off). The kitchen knows it's for an employee and the food tastes and looks like crap. The kitchen gets to eat free and they get paid better.
Advice to Management: Don't lie during the interview when a persons livelihood is at stake. If I was told "you will only be scheduled 25 hours, you need to pick up the rest if you want them." I would have passed. Those hours that you say are there to pick up, are actually not.....Unless someone quits, which is happening quit a bit right now.

Title: "Server"
Pros: Good tips, flexible work schedule, if you make a mistake it's not a huge deal
Cons: Poor management. They overwork you and don't take your health into consideration.
Advice to Management: Listen to your employees and treat them as if they are real people

Title: "ehh"
Pros: Coworkers were awesome the pay and hours were decent
Cons: Management was kind of everywhere they all were on different pages ..
Advice to Management: Hire people who know what they are doing

Title: "Server/ Bartender / Class Facilitator"
Pros: Great environment and fast paced.
Cons: Side work is online any other restaurant

Title: "Great Company"
Pros: Great Culture, people, and energy
Cons: hours and work life balance can be a challenge

Title: "Busser"
Pros: The management and staff always have positive energy and care about the reputation of the Cheescake Factory.... It's contagious.
Cons: The busser staff only makes 2.17$/hr plus tips like the servers do. However we do not have potential of making great tips or even a decent wage because bussers are tipped out based on a max percentage or the servers tips. Example, a server can earn 100$ in tips but only will have to tip a busser out a certain amount, 2%
Advice to Management: Management should increase the bussers base salary to minimum wage then add tips. There would be less turn over and the bussers could make a livable income and not rely on food stamps to survive.

Title: "great place to work"
Pros: the cheesecake factory is a fun place to work flexible schedule, great money fast pace place good benefits
Cons: working all holidays, but that is the nature of the business

Title: "Server"
Pros: Great company with great people and made good tips
Cons: Lots of menu items to remember, things were hectic sometimes and management didn't seem to take care of everything

Title: "Server"
Pros: Very flexible with your schedules. You can change your availability at anytime.
Cons: Insensitive managers. Managers treat employees as disposable, and push away great hardworking employees.
Advice to Management: Take care of your employees more, and be more sensitive to employee needs. It's not all about the customers.

Title: "Server"
Pros: Excellent training, good company reputation! Good health care benefits to those that are eligible. Good opportunity to make some good money compared to other restaurants. Love that the food and their sauces are made daily in house! Also love that fact that they make menu changes twice a year, to bring in new items and take off non-popular ones.
Cons: Can become very, very busy at times. Most locations are rather large, so there is a lot of walking from the kitchen, to the bar, to the bakery, and back to your tables. Can be difficult to keep a set schedule because the staffing changes.

Title: "Server"
Pros: Flexible schedule, better uniforms, good management, team like atmosphere
Cons: Not efficient set up to service the amount of guests, limited growth potential
Advice to Management: Stock basic items, higher base pay, recalculate tip out

Title: "Cook"
Pros: If you enjoy a fast paced environment akin to a workout this job is for you. You also get free food for lunch break!
Cons: There are times where taking a break isn't even possible without affecting service.
Advice to Management: Increase pay for people at the lower rungs who do the most work.

Title: "Fry Cook"
Pros: Supportive co-workers and interactive work environment, that allows for fulfilling work days. The chefs were helpful in training and gave a helping hand during busy shifts. And they allowed for a flexible work schedule.
Cons: Extremely exhausting work days with fairly low wages for the amount of work done. The promises for advancement and raises were not followed up on. No 30 or 60 day review and poor talent development.
Advice to Management: Find better ways to nurture young talent and allow for better growth within the company. Communication is a big issue in the kitchen, as the kitchen culture seemed to alienate workers who were not bi-lingual.

Title: "Great Place to work"
Pros: Most of the management was great to work with at times. Coworker helped each other get through long shifts and appreciate the time spent in the resturant.
Cons: Very busy at times. Epecially weekends where guests were tired of waiting hours so they would be rude to the Hosts.
Advice to Management: Train each employee to his/her potential

Title: "Not great, but you will love your coworkers"
Pros: The people you work with will be like family at a certain point. They are the best part of the job
Cons: Pretty much every service sector job has you dealing with people who feel entitled, especially if you are in a high income area. Sometimes management doesn't know what the hell they are doing, making problems more common.
Advice to Management: Every manager needs to be vetted on having managment experience. There were so many inept managers I worked with that really left a negative taste in my mouth.

Title: "Good Place to Work"
Pros: Get paid every night. Tips are more steady.
Cons: Customers can be very difficult. Stressful.

Title: "Serving at the Cheesecake Factory"
Pros: Pros to working for CF is the scheduling- as a restaurant that is open for lunch and dinner, late night dining, seven days a week...the scheduling possibilities are endless. My management personally tried their hardest to accommodate everyone's preference on a schedule. They also use Hotschedules, an online and interactive scheduling module that allows you to view your schedule, request days off, and switch shifts with a coworker per management's approval. I also made great money working at CF. The high table turn time and moderately sized section helped this. CF does not take reservations, but sits guests on a first come first serve basis to make sure your section is never being wasted. The majority of CFs are located at a mall where the flow of drive-bys and walk-ins is ever constant. CF is very good about promoting internally as well. Although this is an opportunity not presented to myself in my time there, many servers/bakery workers have been promoted to management.
Cons: A very large restaurant comes with the cons of just that....large sections. Diverse clientele. Minimal attention from management as they are usually running around with more work than one can handle. You are also working with a very large staff that you must interact and learn how to work with a lot of coworkers. You are also working on other peoples time. When it is busy, shift change can take up to an hour and checking out can take up to an hour as you must wait on a shift lead to check out your side work. Holidays are pure madness, and CF is open 365 days a year. Good luck getting the holidays off! This is the service industry, so it should be expected.

Title: "Line Cook"
Pros: High quality food and fresh ingredients are what makes the Cheesecake Factory a excellent and high quality Restaurant.
Cons: Full Training must be completed in order to obtain a fast paced and quality culinary preparation to finalize dishes up to 100 percent guest satisfaction.

Title: "Server"
Pros: Diverse group of individuals, they work well with school schedules, opportunities to advance, no longer have to wear all white
Cons: Don't pay their staff enough, got rid of gratitude, don't take care of staff financially, very dirty working conditions, lack of consistency, always running out of supplies
Advice to Management: Bring back gratuity, order according to restaurant needs, favoritism needs to be addressed, lack of professionalism, not everyone is held to the same standards

Title: "SR II"
Pros: Benefits are great, manager support is great, self development makes it easy to move forward at your own pace, no cut throat competition for positions because promotions are individually based, many resources to help get the job done, offer GM's BMW's and Stock options
Cons: Quality of life suffers a little but overall not that bad for the restaurant industry, a lot of studying at times and not always the time to get it done on the job, have to take work home at times to move forward quicker.
Advice to Management: Make development a priority, be consistent when checking knowledge, Corporate needs to get into the restaurants more as they seem detached from what happens day to day, Keep up the good work great company

Title: "Pretty good"
Pros: Pretty good, nice management and staff.
Cons: Nothing bad to put here.

Title: "Worst Job Experience"
Pros: Discounted food, enjoyed working with and preparing food.
Cons: Never get out at scheduled time(I would be scheduled for 6-8 hours and would end up being there for 9-10, sometimes more), my schedule had been modified after being posted without being notified, I did not receive the pay that I was promised.
Advice to Management: Realize that people have lives outside of work.

Title: "We were bodies, not employees"
Pros: decent food, some friendly coworkers
Cons: Management didn't take care of employees, overscheduled and overworked us, lousy location with bad customers, but mostly the management just didn't care. We were replaceable bodies for them to put on the floor, not people. The only time they showed compassion it was obviously faked for HR liability reasons

Title: "The Cheesecake Factory"
Pros: Love the people that I work with.
Cons: There is a lot of inconsistency.

Title: "Dishwasher"
Pros: They have good paying jobs.
Cons: They have a lot of dishes to wash.
Advice to Management: Keep up the good work.

Title: "Cheesecake Factory Review"
Pros: Moderate Hours & Semi Postive Staff
Cons: Moving up is hard because of the fast paced environment.
Advice to Management: Spend time in each area once every shift

Title: "Hostess"
Pros: They are extremely flexible with you schedule, you just tell them what needs to happen and they'll have your back, when you work a double you get free food from the staff menu and 25-50% off on a regular basis. There is room for professional growth and they are very clear on what your duties are, how to dress, what to say ect.
Cons: Most of the cons I would have to share are personal to my location but really other than that I can't say anything bad about the company or it's process
Advice to Management: Keep on being you

Title: "Great job!"
Pros: Great with scheduling, great tips.
Cons: Hardly any time ever to take a break
Advice to Management: Give us some sort of break, especially when working a double.

Title: "Work - no reward"
Pros: The pros are the name and having too many guests/customers to ever have to worry about having nothing to do. The place has great standards and wants to be the best at any cost.
Cons: The big con is the fact the company doesn't actually care about the staff or managers. It is more focused on stock price and making anything look good on paper regardless of what the staff and actual managers say is happening on a day to day basis. Every location cuts corners and the staff lose their job if anyone says anything about it.
Advice to Management: stop treating staff and managers like they are the food product you can simply get more of. The long term upper management only knows one way of doing something and gets rid of anyone that doesn't say yes quickly.

Title: "Not employee oriented"
Pros: Yummy food. Staff discount.
Cons: They say they are but, like most corporation, the bottom line is what matters.

Title: "Working as a Baker"
Pros: Nice people, good discount for food.
Cons: Gets busy, you're frequently on your own.
Advice to Management: Hire more bakers.

Title: "The cheese"
Pros:
Flexible schedule
Good money if willing to stay and close
Freedom to walk around and not be micro managed
Cons:
Management is not the best
Inconsistent money
No benefits
Advice to Management: Be consistent across the board

Title: "Not fun, hate working"
Pros: cheese cake and oreo crumbles yum
Cons: didn't like it work sucks bad

Title: "Server."
Pros: Co workers make it all fun while at work.
Cons: The demographic of the costumers.

Title: "Cheesecake"
Pros:
Pay
Benefits
Team
Corporate
Advancement opportunities
Good teamwork with bussers
Cons:
Poor management
Poor coordination
Understaffed bussers
Poor communication
Unprofessionalism in workplace
Advice to Management: Hire a new busser manager

Title: "Server/Bartender"
Pros: The cheesecake factory is a very successful company. Therefore, there are always customers coming in to eat. This means that you always have plenty of customers to tip you.
Cons: I felt like I was always overworked. Most days I was given little time to take breaks to eat when doing double shifts. The POS system is terrible when dealing with dividing up larger parties, which happened a lot. The company policy is to make the employee pay for checks when the customer bails on the check, which is ridiculous.
Advice to Management: I actually don't have much advice to management. They were generally really great people and I felt like they did an adequate job with the resources they were given. Most of the issues I had were with the company policies and not the way the place was managed.`

Title: "Cheesecake Land"
Pros: Fun and friendly work evironment
Cons: Very exhausting labor at times

Title: "Not the worst job I've ever had"
Pros: Meet alot of people, gain alot of experience working in a VERY fast paced environment, decent pay, understanding management (for the most part)
Cons: VERY strict with regulations and having things done the way the company wants things done, if you're a cashier, you will NOT get a break, and are expected to deal with customers who line up out the door for HOURS at a time which is not only physically, but mentally exhausting as well, you will not be able to work more than 40 hours a week, not very flexible if you need a holiday off.
Advice to Management: Make sure your employees are very well taken care of, and they will take care of you. Pay them more, let them work overtime if they want to. Obviously if they want to work, it makes more sense to have an employee who is willing to work there, than one who hates their life and would want anything more than to be there.

Title: "Great place to work"
Pros: Amazing company to work for!
Cons: No cons here, in my opinion.

Title: "Great Employees"
Pros: The employees really bond together and make the work place fun and inviting.
Cons: Sometimes feel like I'm being micro managed

Title: "Line cook"
Pros: Amazing staff and teamwork, Everyone helps everyone
Cons: I dont really have anything negative to say about this place

Title: "Good money, bad experience."
Pros: Money is great. I can't complain about being able to pay my bills. They let you transfer to any Cheesecake Factory that can have you... sort of.
Cons: Not very flexible hours. Managers choose favorites and give them special treatment (for example: better sections, days off whenever they want, free manager meals, they can pretty much get away with anything they want and not fired). Not given a break to eat on certain days (don't plan on eating on Saturdays, unless you're only on 1 shift). Given write ups for ridiculous reasons. Forced to work Sunday doubles.
Advice to Management: Don't play favorites with your employees. When faced with a problem at a table, if you know the guest is being completely absurd, defend your server (the customer is not always right). Stop treating your not so favorite employee as just a number.

Title: "Baker"
Pros: Great atmosphere with an awesome staff. The hours are super flexible and management is always easy to talk to.
Cons: Would have stayed if they offered higher pay. Too much work not enough pay...Weekend nights can get crazy and the restaurant will never be empty

Title: "Corporate but great place to work"
Pros: flexible schedule. fun environment. I was in college when i was a Server and it kept me active and the time went by fast. The money you make is up to you, I was focused and took on as much as i could and would walk away each night with a good amount in tips.
Cons: Management was a little too corporate for my preference. Very by the book but I understood. running around after 8 hours is very exhausting and sometimes by legs would ache pretty bad
Advice to Management: focus less on where the store is in terms of volume and keep the employees in higher spirits. Be more positive on the line and help out more like running food and walking the floor.

Title: "Line Cook"
Pros:
-Scratch Kitchen
-Great Management
-Great Hour
-Good Pay
-High Volume
Cons:
-Disrespectful FoH staff
-Language Barriers
-Miscommunicaton Sometimes
Advice to Management: I enjoyed the opportunity management has given me in The Cheesecake Factory. Just keep doing a great job Jimm and Jesus

Title: "Server"
Pros: Very busy and you get discounted meals.
Cons: You have to kiss up to a couple male supervisors and make sure you don't make any mistakes if they don't like you. Once I overheard a supervisor tell an employee he would fire him on the spot, just because the supervisor was upset. Hostile environment, I quit!
Advice to Management: Train your supervisors to not try and run the staff like slaves when they don't like them. I witness insults to staff in the kitchen, there is such things as verbal abuse

Title: "Cashier"
Pros: Best cashier job. There are a lot of perks and the staff are nice
Cons: They give you a lot of hours and management is hard on you
Advice to Management: Be nicer

Title: "This company does not have good pay plus no benefits"
Pros: They have great cheesecake and really good food as well as a good atmosphere and working environment. They are located in high traffic areas in large cities.
Cons: This issue that I don't like about this company is that it does not offer a benefits package for their bartenders. and this particular company has a very low hourly wage for there bartenders.
Advice to Management: Increase hourly wage

Title: "General mgr"
Pros: Best place ever. Needs better Corp mgmt
Cons: Cool but no communication. Is what it is

Title: "Great People"
Pros: Great staff and environment. It was my first restaurant job, and it was great. I loved the people I worked with and the teamwork. Everyone supports each other when they need it.
Cons: I didn't always get a performance review on time, so raises took a while. Management seemed to always be changing, which is probably normal for the industry.
Advice to Management: Fake it until you make it, when you stress out the employees stress out. Staying composed in a bad situation can work wonders.

Title: "host"
Pros: Fast paced, cool coworkers, management seems helpful and excited for employees to advance. you get free bread and soup, soft drinks every shift haha. Get to meet lots of interesting guests.
Cons: Can have some very rude and irrational guests. Tons of employees may not have as many shifts as you expect. Gets so busy sometimes you will be overloaded with extra work, in the weeds as they say.
Advice to Management: Maybe to ask which employees actually want to advance in the company and which don't and just want a part time job. search out those carrier employees.

Title: "Nice Co-Workers, Management Could Use Some Work"
Pros: Wonderful, supportive co-workers, fun interactions with a variety of people, and interesting regulars
Cons: Turnover is a real problem, management is a mess and isn't interested in your goals or desire to advance in the company, shifts never end on time (sometimes with a difference of 3+ hours without any warning or extra compensation), management is also quick to shift the blame and even quicker at reprimanding workers for minor, or even imagined, offenses
Advice to Management: Make your employees feel more valued and actually try to take an interest in their interests in your company. Please make more of an effort to end shifts on time. The fact that employees may still be on shift, 1, 2, 3, or even 4 hours after they should be home is insanely ridiculous. Also, get the whole story before you reprimand workers and try some compassion every once in a while. It would be nice if the whole management team was awesome instead of a couple select managers.

Title: "Server"
Pros: Extremely flexible work schedule, excellent medical/dental/eye benefits, and no major push to promote menu items that are not within character of the establishment.
Cons: Location makes for high volume, which wouldn't be a problem if the actual restaurant were larger in size to accommodate peak dining hours. Parking can be a chore.
Advice to Management: Keep putting up the good fight!

Title: "Good place to work"
Pros: Good money as a hostess. Free food and drink. Lots of downtime when restaurant isn't busy. Great place to work.
Cons: I can not think of any cons at this time. Really is a great place to work. Love the atmosphere
Advice to Management: i can not think of any advice to give to management at this time. All the managers were great.

Title: "cheesecake"
Pros: some of the best management staff I have worked with. Great staff working together as a team to make the shift run smoothly.
Cons: sometimes too many servers on the floor, some managers show favoritism in scheduling, so you have to try to pick up shifts

Title: "The Cheesecake Server,"
Pros: Some of the employees are helpful and friendly, Healthcare benefits for those who qualify, Food is tasty,Room for advancement
Cons: Long hours and most likely a very short break if you even get one. Stress and anxiety levels will go up, Some employees don't even acknowledge you or your food gets bumped but one of the four expediters haven't a clue on how that happened and blame the server for not checking, no problem but if I have to run the food than maybe the hostess should not seat 4 tables at once?
Advice to Management: When employees make mistakes, try talking to them directly instead of gossiping about that employee while they are standing behind you . It's not just the degrading , You have taken away this persons ability to succeed at the job they were intended to do. How can someone be a part of a team when one of the managers destroys their reputation while they are still initially trying to build relations.

Title: "server"
Pros: Busy most of the time, higher checks means more tips, holiday cheesecake for free
Cons: Sticker shock is very common, many stiffs and bad tips. Location is key to your restaurant and personal success.
Advice to Management: 'The customer is always right' is not true.

Title: "awesome"
Pros: Great company to work for
Cons: No cons at all a great place to work
Advice to Management: Keep up the great work

Title: "racist"
Pros: Hours Benefits Leniant Schedule Flexible Pay
Cons:
Racism from hispanic co workers
Not complimented on work ethic, ability, promptness
Advancement is slow
Multiple times being bullied and nothing was done
Advice to Management: Do more micromanaging in ALL areas of the restaraunt not just the front of house..

Title: "Great"
Pros: Great food. Very generous with with rewarding staff for accomplishments. Management is very understanding and there to help the staff and the business.
Cons: No one knows how to tip now-a-days. Not the Cheesecake Factory's fault. Back of the kitchen needed a different/better manager as did the front of the house manager
Advice to Management: Be more in charge with your ends of the restaurant. Run the place. Know what your doing more than just being great at on the spot solutions.

Title: "host"
Pros: it's an easy job, flexible hours
Cons: very low pay, no future
Advice to Management: start a road to moving up

Title: "Hostess"
Pros: Staff is friendly and feels like a family. Scheduling is great, you can go to school and work at the same time with ease. Just don't take on 30 hours or more as a student.
Cons: Stressful environment. Dealing with angry guests on a consistent basis can be exhausting. Must have thick skin and patience to work this job.
Advice to Management: Recognize your staff. When someone wants a promotion, communicate with them what must be done prior to the promotion. Don't leave staff in the dark with important matters like this.

Title: "Not worth it"
Pros: You make good money, sure, but only if your put into a decent section on a busy night. Co-workers are normally great, there's a good morale, but I'd say that's in a part due to everyone lives in fear of getting yelled by a manager or the customer not tipping.
Cons: Managers would blame servers for issues with the food rather than the cooks, you learn to know which co-workers really have your back and others who are only there for themselves.

Title: "Cheesecake"
Pros: Quality, positive culture, established, excellent training program at all levels
Cons: Long hours, stressful, limited advancement, unrealistic expectations

Title: "Good place"
Pros: It is a Good place to work
Cons: There are A lot of foreigners

Title: "Server"
Pros: Great pay, great benefits, always busy.
Cons: Huge menu, big corporate atmosphere
Advice to Management: Try to not play favorites.

Title: "manager"
Pros: great had a lot of fun
Cons: it was hard work at times.

Title: "A great place to work."
Pros:
flexible schedules.
Great personalities.
good food.
average money
Cons:
Too many standbys and Breaker shifts and
Food run shifts ( which you make less than 40 dollars a shift)
the place is 86 most items on busy days. also the kitchen crashes a lot.
Advice to Management: Not much they can do, but if they could fix the schedules problems. this would be a greater place to work.

Title: "Great place to make money"
Pros: Always busy great for many tips
Cons: They work you like crazy

Title: "Server"
Pros:
Good team environment where everyone helps each other get through the shift.
Extensive training
There are very Good opportunities for advancement as long as you let it be known.
Cons: Sometimes management seems to be on their own terms and has a disregard for employees. Sometimes the restaurant is understaffed and you are asked to take too many tables at times.
Advice to Management: Try to focus on what the employees want in their job as well. Not only the numbers that you need in order to get your bonus.

Title: "cook"
Pros: Really fun good enveriment place
Cons: Long shifts mean co workers

Title: "Overall review"
Pros: Most of the staff is nice. Money is pretty good.
Cons:
Older staff isn't too nice, not a fan of new people that they have to train.
You have to tip out others at the end of the night, bar, busboys, & food runners.

Title: "Nice job"
Pros: Awesome advancement opportunities if you have the right stuff. Raises, if you deserve them. Ability to travel and move around from station to station, if you can master your first.
Cons: As a manager, no work life balance

Title: "Great Company"
Pros: Great benefits, great team atmosphere with room for advances and raises. Great learning environment, with a focus on promoting within.
Cons: Long hours, stressful atmosphere. The kitchen tends to be hot and sweaty, but that's expected. Sometimes not given the resources to do a job in the best manner possible.
Advice to Management: Be able to give the labor hours needed to give the cooks and staff a chance to do the best job possible, in a fun, clean environment.

Title: "Great place to serve,"
Pros: Great culture, money to be made
Cons: Management only looks out for themselves
Advice to Management: Take better care of those who want advancement opportunities

Title: "Pretty good place to work at."
Pros: Pretty good money, and usually nice and crazy fun co-workers!
Cons: Very stressful at times, You make more mistakes than you ever thought you would because of the environment and situations that happen.
Advice to Management: Provide more opportunities for the people that want to grow in the company, also provide more incentives for working very hard for other co-workers and helping out!

Title: "Good and bad"
Pros: Great food you get good discounts and chances at free meals. Which isn't the case at my new restaurant. I miss the food benefits.
Cons: Management staff at particular location wasn't very organized. Lack of communication through out the entire staff from management to regular employees.
Advice to Management: Better communication all around. As crazy as the workplace is try and make it a more enjoyable experience. More organization needed.

Title: "Server"
Pros: Great money, flexibility, staff outings, food discounts and your coworkers become likes family to you.
Cons: Disrespectful customers who are allowed to behave terribly, management doesn't seem to care about the money servers are or aren't making. If you have a table leave you no tip, management doesn't help you out. Thank God I work in an affluent area. Also, servers should not be responsible for paying busboys and bartenders full salaries. That is the job of corporate. The tip out amount in this restaurant is ridiculous and corporate thrives financially off our backs!
Advice to Management: Consistency is key. Sharing is terrible and wrong under many circumstances especially when the restaurant is slow or near empty.

Title: "Hostess"
Pros: great company to work for
Cons: none really any, enjoyable job

Title: "Great place"
Pros: Pay,benefits, environment, staff appreciation
Cons: None so far. All is positive, maybe just long hours
Advice to Management: Continue doing as great as you do

Title: "Hard earned money"
Pros:
- Walk with cash every shift
- good food
- great co-workers
- easy sidework
Cons:
- not enough managers
- managers are lazy
- Managers know that no other restaurant does the same volume so they treat you like crap because they know you cant serve anywhere better
- us vs them mentality (instilled by managers) between FOH and BOH
- everything is always the servers fault and managers seem to forget that the company doesnt pay us. the 2.13/hr goes to taxes.
- dont expect to ever get a paycheck
Advice to Management: They need to understand that they dont pay us to worry about their BS. If they want us to care more pay us what you pay servers in California 9/hr. Then you can demand perfection. Until then, we work for the guests.

Title: "Superb option for a part-time."
Pros: Obviously if you're looking for something to fall back on ain't nothing better than waiting tables. You can pretty much customize your own schedule and if ever you need money on the fly all you'd have to do is go in for a weekend shift and walk out with $200-$300.
Cons: Your social life becomes limited due to the fact that the busiest hours are in the evenings and on weekends which is when you wanna work but coincedently it's also probably when all your friends and family wanna invite ya to join em on a night out. Depending on the company and on the current management, favoritism may become an issue
Advice to Management: There should be constant within management. If one manager says one thing and another says different, the inconsistency and different points of view may hinder the work group entirely

Title: "Great Company, Great Brand"
Pros: The company leaders are completely committed to it's values, including people our greatest resource, service-mindedness and quality I everything we do.
