There is a strong feeling of alignment and focus on a common goal, and great camaraderie and spirit throughout the restaurants and the corporate center.
Cons: There isn't a formal career growth plan or path at the corporate center.

Title: "Great Place to Work!"
Pros: Great management! Teamwork environment and great pay. Flexible schedule and positive atmosphere. Clean kitchen and floor! Great perks for employee meals and great food as always.
Cons: Walking on hard floors requires relly comfortable shoes at all times. Don't spill anything on your uniform at work because all white is hard to keep perfectly clean when serving.
Advice to Management: Keep it up!

Title: "OST"
Pros: Gain lots of experience with multi-tasking, reconciliation of sales, accounting, HR, benefits. Great place to move up in the company outside of FOH/BOH management.
Cons: Wage review is annually and the base pay without experience is severely low if your cost of living is high. May have to acquire a second job.

Title: "Cheesecake Factory cashier"
Pros: The hourly pay as a cashier is helpful for a steady paycheck. The tips are a big plus, the amount just varies.
Cons: It is not always busy. Mostly nights, weekends, and holidays are the busiest. As a cashier in the cheesecake section, you are not always needed. Your shift will often get cut short.
Advice to Management: Management was fair and not hard to work with. They valued the right things and seemed to have their employees' best interests in mind.

Title: "very good"
Pros: Good Business Outstanding co-workers Good Promotions.
Cons:
-Bad Scheduling
-Must Report to work in most in-convenient times
Advice to Management: There's nothing i would really recommend to the management about working at the cheesecake factory

Title: "Hostess"
Pros:
Employee discount
Location was nice
Cons:
No breaks
No scheduled end time

Title: "General Manager"
Pros:
Fun
High pace
The best food in the industry
Dinamic
Family feel
Cons: I can't think of any cons. This job is only for people that love the industry. Any person taking this job must love a challenge and be willing to learn and adapt.

Title: "Server"
Pros: Not quite enough tables in your section during your shift but if your by yourself closing you can make money taking that extra table or an extra hour
Cons: Your going to complain about others then about there sections. Not an exciting shift to look forward for
Advice to Management: sure they were great but never greeted me

Title: "It was good while it lasted..."
Pros: Take home cash, good pay (as a baker/cashier/curbside I make 10.50/hr)
Cons: My hours have dropped off severely yet I hear others complain about constantly working overtime. They won't fire the ones that really shouldn't be there. VERY high turn over. And I agree with another poster in regards to favoritism, it really sucks!
Advice to Management: Remain professional with ALL of your employees. Advancement should come based on performance not because you're playing favorites

Title: "Great money.. Great atmosphere... potential for advancement"
Pros: Pretty much great money... Bring home cash every day worked... PTO and insurance is available..
Cons: gratuity was taken away by the government, so you have a more likely chance of getting stiffed on large parties... high stress level...

Title: "Great Place"
Pros: Love my job. Love the people I work with. Love the busy work.
Cons: Hard work. I always have sores on my feet.

Title: "Cheesecake Factory Server"
Pros: Good people to work with, good benefits, and great money.
Cons: Not enough hours to schedule full time.

Title: "Great hospitality job"
Pros: The Cheesecake Factory hires wonderful people, making the restaurants a great and friendly place to work. They have high expectations and the job is fun.
Cons: The job can be crazy stressful with the high pace the company is known for. Which means it can be hell on wheels during a rush. Experience really depends on the management team that is in your restaurant, I have had excellent managers and I have had terrible managers. They make all the difference.
Advice to Management: Hire extremely competent managers - always. I firmly believe all managers should start only after they have been a server for many months.

Title: "Server"
Pros: Friendly management with very professional yet fun ways of training. The Cheesecake factory team is very hardworking and the management is very easy to work with. They work around your schedule.
Cons: There are a lot of workers at the cheesecake factory so it is difficult to remember some names. Overall happy experience.
Advice to Management: Keep up the great work! Thank you for acknowledging those who work hard and put in extra effort at work. They even celebrate birthdays without you having to remind them!

Title: "Baker"
Pros: Nice friendly coworkers. Good atmosphere. Good beginning restaurant job start off with.
Cons: Management can be stupid and horrible depending on the person. A lot of work. You're restricted from doing a lot of things until you are cross trained. Very corporate.
Advice to Management: Know different positions, so you can help out.

Title: "great work environment, bad clientele"
Pros: the peope that work there are amazing and very friendly. Very steady restaurant. Ben is the best GM I've ever worked for.
Cons: the clientele isn't always the best, being in the mall you get a lot of people that dont tip well or even at all

Title: "Great Place to Work for Students"
Pros: Flexible hours, great meal discounts
Cons: No benefits, lack of parking
Advice to Management: N/A

Title: "Fun, but micromanaged."
Pros: Good discount, and fun environment.
Cons: Management team micro manages its employees a lot.
Advice to Management: Let your employees do their job.

Title: "server"
Pros: training was thorough, food was good
Cons: disorganized, poor management, high school like atmosphere, rude customers, long hours, holidays, bad sections - only favored their favorites
Advice to Management: Get new management

Title: "Server"
Pros: Awesome tips, get hours except slow season
Cons: Summer time is hectic work long hours
Advice to Management: Some locations need more mangers, they are struggling

Title: "Meh"
Pros: Great crew in the bakery, love my Gm and manager
Cons: Not set out time (at least not followed) long hours

Title: "Server"
Pros: Great restaurant to work for in terms of the atmosphere and management style. Family-like environment between coworkers is the best part of being involved here. Managers are very supportive and always willing to try and accommodate any mix-ups with scheduling or last minute emergencies. Most employees are able to work their way up from hostess to server if they are interested. Benefits include discounts on meals and health insurance for full-time employees.
Cons: Only con I can think of is the type of customers that sometimes come in.

Title: "Cheesecake Life"
Pros: Fortune 100 company two years in a row. Great part time benefits. Extensive and comprehensive training to ensure success within company. Promotions are from solely from within.
Cons: Large numbers within work group making promotions really competitive. Hard to climb a pay scale. Inconsistent schedules. Unstable income.
Advice to Management:
Work on development of staff. Pay more attention to the dedicated staff that has voiced they are interested in growing within the company. Give the hourly staff more of a voice. Allow hourly staff to take sick days instead of being forced to come
In to work and risking the health of other staff members and guests.

Title: "Server"
Pros: I was a server for 3 years, and this was absolutely the best job while going to college. Great staff, great management, great money.
Cons: Scheduling was not consistent, and sometimes disorganized.

Title: "I actually love it"
Pros: Good environment, friendly people, managers will actually listen talk to you to help. Soup and bread are free for when you need a pick me up
Cons: Not enough hours, over staffed, no allotted "break" time: some shifts you go without even getting to go to the bathroom.

Title: "server"
Pros: Solid company with plenty of room for growth.
Cons: Physically demanding and sometimes affected by the seasons.
Advice to Management: Never forget where you started. Please listen to your staff.

Title: "SrKM"
Pros: Best company to work for..Fresh Food ..Tradition ..Pride
Cons: Hard work really long hours

Title: "Server"
Pros: Flexible Hours, Good Money and Stable
Cons: Limited Growth, Work is stressful and they maximize every minute you are there
Advice to Management: Make growth opportunities more known and help staff not just instruct.

Title: "Server-Brea"
Pros: Tips are usually very good, with exceptions of course. Your servers, depending on how you treat them, will most likely always have your back in a crisis. Management is overall effective and hard working.
Cons: Unfortunately there is 1 or 2 managers that micromanaged, and nobody liked, but because they've been there so long, people cant really say anything to them.
Advice to Management: Please don't belittle your staff members.

Title: "Great for students"
Pros: You make way more than most restaurants. Scheduling is flexible. It's one of the few restaurants to offer servers healthcare!
Cons: Your coworkers will probably be those people who complain about small stuff and hate life.
Advice to Management: Your DTs should need a peer evaluation first.

Title: "Designated Trainer/Server"
Pros: Great fast-paced environment! Wonderful leadership and colleagues. Quality food and dining!
Cons: Long hours, high stress during busy hours

Title: "Server"
Pros: Flexible schedule , great atmosphere, teamwork.
Cons: Inconsistent scheduled sections, stand by shifts, runner shifts, breaker shifts. You won't serve as many days as you work.

Title: "Great Place to work during school!"
Pros: I love the energy and the atmosphere! There is room to advance if you have the time to do so!
Cons: SUUUPER BUSY!! Sometimes your head spins with how busy it gets. If you love a challenge though you can overcome this con. For some it's just too much.
Advice to Management: Maybe have a free floater or someone "on call" for the bakery. Some Fridays and Saturdays got busier than I felt we were prepared for.

Title: "Fun Job! Great Money"
Pros: Great Money, good work experience, room for growth withing the company
Cons: Cheesecake Factory no longer offers servers the option of automatic gratuity on large bills

Title: "Best in the Industry"
Pros: Fortune 100 Best Places to work. Good benefits. Great company and great atmosphere.
Cons: There aren't any down sides to working at the best restaurant in the business.
Advice to Management: Leave behind everything you learned at the other brands. CCF is a whole other level of business.

Title: "The Cheesecake Factory"
Pros: Great Benefits and Core Values
Cons: High paced and challenging industry.

Title: "Nice tips, fast environment"
Pros: Nice tips, Helpful Management, flexible work schedule, great training
Cons: you need to be very fast, managers while very helpful arent too forgiving if you mess up

Title: "If you are female do not work here."
Pros: Money is great, team mates are friendly. Flexible hours and great scheduling app.
Cons: Management is never on the same page and often plays favorites. They also need some sensitivity training and training about sexual harassment. I was harrassed constantly on the job and after calling corporate hr, was fired. Zero employee accolades.
Advice to Management: Stop hitting on the employees and be professional.

Title: "If you only care about the money, work here."
Pros: Good money. That's honestly about it. Worst company Ive worked for by far.
Cons: Managers do not care about you. Work 13 hour shift no break, not even five minutes to eat. Managers flirt and goof around with employees. Veteran workers treat newer employees like garbage, including: cursing/using foul language with workers.
Advice to Management: Change the whole management staff. Get your priorities straight.

Title: "Cheesecake factory"
Pros: Great company. Family oriented. Very understanding!
Cons: Minimal hours. Small table sections.
Advice to Management: Schedule less servers on slow days to eliminate employees coming into work for nothing.

Title: "Meh you could do better"
Pros: Fun coworkers, lots of internationals, good life-work balance, easy work, free bread and drinks, meal discounts at locations owned by Cheesecake Factory
Cons: No room to move up, hourly show that puts off lots of fire and thus heat, less than ideal work conditions

Title: "Kitchen Manager"
Pros: The policy and structure were to be admired ,The area supervisors were great to deal with .Evaluations were given on a timely matter .Projects and goals were easily accomplished. The staff members were some of the best people I have ever come in contact with someone whom I worked with 12 years .I loved what I was doing I watched a 6 million dollar store turn into a 14 million dollar store
Cons:
The hours seemed to have been lost in the mad shuffles 55 was the expectation in reality it was more like 65 hrs.Bonus structure for the KMs were almost insulting .Quality of life was non existent
Family never came first . 8 years of management never got a raise !!
Advice to Management:
Add staff when needed ,Watch how you talk to people be honest people are your greatest resource .Recognize the people who truly love the job .Please review the bonus structure for KMs
Somehow get the KMs out of the building to spend more time with their families this really can effect moral .

Title: "Love the company"
Pros: Out of all restaurants I have worked for, this is by far the most professional and profitable for the servers. Everyone works together as a team, including bartenders and bussers! There is very little favoritism. Love this place!
Cons: Not many shifts available during the slow time

Title: "A Great Stepping Stone"
Pros: Opportunity to learn other job roles, which helps keep things fresh and new as an employee.
Cons: Mystery shoppers can and have cost people their jobs.
Advice to Management: Other FOH staff (besides servers) should participate in regular food tastings to better suggest menu choices to guests. Encourage hosts to step it up in their mode of dress, as they have become sloppy over the years.

Title: "Busser at Cheesecake Factory"
Pros: great staff, good money, always busy.
Cons: long hours, never know exactly when you will be leaving the restaurant.
Advice to Management: great management team, always on the floor working and advising staff. Continue to seek staff input.

Title: "decent, steady income"
Pros: Decent tips, good insurance,and opportunity to travel if you chose to become a Designated Trainer and do store openings.
Cons: They can be too willing to accommodate over-the-top obnoxious guests.

Title: "Food Server"
Pros: The company is willing to work with your schedule. You get lots of benefits. There are resturants everywhere so you can always have a job where ever you have to live.
Cons: Sometimes you do not get many hours. You always have to work the holidays. People treat you like poorly. It takes a toll on your body.
Advice to Management: Be good to your servers.

Title: "Great company with upside"
Pros: Great work environment. It is a growing company that offers numerous different opportunities.
Cons: Compensation is not as competitive as it should be.

Title: "Great, just alot of lazy people in a fast pace restaurant."
Pros: Great tips on busy days, able to work around your schedule.
Cons: Not the best management, more focus on the business then employees. Any manger can terminate you on the spot with no if ands or buts.
Advice to Management: Need a much better system on how bussers get tips. Servers and other bussers can hold out on your money and you wouldn't have know. Mangers don't get in volved which leaves other bussers VERY UP SET.

Title: "Bartender"
Pros: Great training. Allows you to be the best bartender possible. Seriously
Cons: It's hard work. If you can't hack it, it's because your doing the job for money not the craft.

Title: "like a 6 pack of beer, without the plastic holding it together..."
Pros: Ok pay, but never steady. In a regular six hour shift you can make anywhere from $40-$130. Your income is equivalent to investing in the stock market.
Cons: management has hit rock bottom, and they're starting to dig... staff gossip 24/7 as if they're in high school. I suggest management not breed. The staff aren't so much a "has been" but more so a "won't be", the staff usually works well under supervision when their cornered like a rat in a cage. The managers would be out of their depth in a parking lot puddle.
Advice to Management: Find new hobbies.

Title: "Server"
Pros: Flexibility with schedule. Able to request off as desired. Working on the books. Insurance.
Cons: Long shifts. Poor tips sometimes. Management are sometimes greedy and are only worried about the company's best interest.

Title: "Great place to work!"
Pros: This company cares so much about their employees. The culture is wonderful, supportive and fun!
Cons: Unfortunately, doubles could turn into 12-14 hour days of Never ending rushes.

Title: "Find a serving job somewhere else. You'll be happier."
Pros: Money is generally consistent ($80+/night), co-workers are generally nice people, managers are generally willing to be flexible with your schedule and things that might come up.
Cons: Very stressful due to huge sections, disparate treatment from managers, the guests are rude and finicky more often than not, no breaks (the managers went around last year with the legal form that was an option for employees to waive their breaks and instead they said, "Have you signed this yet?" as if it wasn't a choice- they do sneaky things like that a lot). Basically, their management style is pretty terrible and the job is quite stressful. I served there for over four years and in that time, the job did not get easier because management tends to focus on things that are unimportant instead of the things that would make the restaurant run more efficiently.
Advice to Management: Be good to your employees, because they are the ones who are going to take care of your company. Stop micromanaging. Listen more than you talk. Treat your employees as you would anyone else, everyone deserves the same respect.

Title: "bakery"
Pros: good work life balance free food discount
Cons: cant think of any, nothing wrong with the company i loved it

Title: "Designated Trainer"
Pros: Everything about the company was great. Very well structured and they know what they are doing. The staff is fun and becomes family. If you work hard and get with the program you can do anything with the company. Highly recommend.
Cons: Customer service can be challenging at times, but if you enjoy it, there are more good days than not.
Advice to Management: Management keep doing what you re doing. The games such as bingo make for a fun night of serving and helps servers push items they normally would not.

Title: "HR Coordinator- process new hires, terminations, daily balancing, invoice reconiclition"
Pros: Great benefits, the hours are flexible
Cons: If you don't have good time management you may struggle, lots of multitasking

Title: "always busy, always decent money"
Pros: extremely fast paced, if you can turn tables quickly you can make a ton of money
Cons: extremely fast paced, always busy

Title: "Hard work, terrible "guests", clueless management, great coworkers"
Pros: Excellent coworkers, fast paced, opportunity for serious money. I really enjoyed working in the downtown location because of the sheer volume of guests and the diversity of people who dined within.
Cons: Terrible guests, clueless management, outdated corporate structures. Do not care about the well being of employees and management has not a clue about retaining or rewarding key individuals.
Advice to Management: Listen more to the needs of your employees. Be more accomodating with the schedule. Reward employees for the hard work they put in and realize which of your staff is actually worthwhile.

Title: "Server"
Pros: Flexible hours, works great with my school schedule. Was a great place to work while going to school. Offered a good balance.
Cons: Having to work many double shifts around holidays.

Title: "This place stinks."
Pros: Can't think of any.
Cons:
Cheesecake takes itself very seriously, and they talk a big game about caring about employees, but they simply don't. Scheduling is a mess - there's absolutely no way you shouldn't be able to make a schedule for a 2 week period rather than just one released on Friday. I shouldn't have to wait until Friday to know if I'm free the following Friday - employees have lives too and they'd like to be able to plan their time. It's obviously management's laziness, and since there are 7 managers at any given time there's no way one can't take the extra time to just set the schedule. If you don't care about your employees time and work/life balance then don't pretend to care about your employees at all. Good luck requesting off ever - it won't happen.

In terms of why it is awful to be a server - most of the "extra steps of service" are asinine and actually take away from the customer's experience because if a customer wants a straw they shouldn't have to wait 10 minutes for their server to get it for them because they have to consolidate steps and have to get a bev nap to present the straw to the customer because god forbid you just have wrapped straws in your apron and you can't automatically give them a straw even though every customer wants one. It's a restaurant and yet they don't understand the basic wants and needs of the average customer.
Advice to Management: Do everything differently.

Title: "Great Company"
Pros: Good training, benefits, and work environment. Plenty of opportunities to gain more responsibilities and experience.
Cons: The people that come into the restaurant can be that certain power-trip type that always threatens to "call corporate" even if the smallest thing goes wrong.

Title: "The cheese cake factory"
Pros: Awesome place to work for amazing all the way around great environment great training great reward system great pay hard work but awesome
Cons: You do work your butt off and sometimes it can be a bit challenging with the amount of people coming to the door but that's awesome as well because that means people want to come and eat there
Advice to Management: Management just needs to always back each other up always work for each other always make sure to keep everyone in perspective and keep everyone in mind understand that the work is hard and challenging but you need to make sure that time off is given when needed

Title: "Not bad"
Pros: Co-workers pay great when we help them out, quick and easy money, paid in cash
Cons: Some days are good, some bad, most night are great and some not as much managers aren't smart

Title: "Schedule"
Pros: They're giving a flexible schedule
Cons: You are doing a great job
Advice to Management: Great Job!

Title: "Line -cook"
Pros: Working with chef marques
Cons: Too many things too listed
Advice to Management: Hire chef marqurs as head chef

Title: "Hectic Job, Good Benefits"
Pros:
Flexible Scheduling
Healthcare
Paid Time Off
Opportunity for Advancement and/or Cross Training
Ability to travel
Cons:
Disorganized Local Managers
EXTREMELY HECTIC (The volume is crazy if you aren't used to it)
Because of the volume you don;t always have the tools you need from managers
Employee retention sucks at the local level. A lot of people can;t handle the job or get fed up with management
Advice to Management: Listen to your employees especially the ones you value. Overworking your strongest team members will burn them out and you will lose them.

Title: "Host"
Pros: Good company to work for if you need experience in service industry and work on your people skills. Good vacation time.
Cons: Hours can be overwhelming but pros can outweigh Cons at the time.

Title: "It's the best restaurant gig I have had...and the worst."
Pros: Awesome co-workers. Majority of management is great. When tips are good, they are GOOD.
Cons: Customers act overly entitled and rude. Worst tippers I have ever encountered.
Advice to Management: Acknowledge everyone's hard work, not just the "favorites".

Title: "Hostess"
Pros: Great atmosphere, I feel really respected and valued by coworkers and management. Consistent/appropriate raises.
Cons: A plethora of rude customers, as with any job in the service industry.
Advice to Management: keep doing you!

Title: "Server"
Pros: Everyone worked as a team, good money, fun atmosphere
Cons: Management did not work well under stress, long hours, hard time getting time off approved
Advice to Management: Hire people who can work under stress and not show it. The managers were often rude and short with employees in times of high volume stress

Title: "Server"
Employee Title: Baker, Host, Cashier, Server, Food Runner, Trainer
Pros: Flexible Schedule, good money, benefits, internal promotions
Cons: Long hours, slow seasons, some bureaucracy
Advice to Management: Stop being scumbags

Title: "Cheesecake"
Pros: The people u work with and the pay somewhat.
Cons: No set hrs. Rules changing a lot. No time for your own lifestyles.
Advice to Management: Set schedules and hrs.

Title: "Take orders, open and close, handle cash, carry multiple heavy plates and drinks at a time, run food"
Pros: Some pros the tips you get on good days and making really good friends with coworkers, works well with a school schedule
Cons: Many cons involve past managers and how unprofessional they were, clientele has become a little more hostile than the past

Title: "Disorganized"
Pros: Have a flexible work schedule, opportunities to transfer to other locations, advancement to management, uses hotschedules, volunteer to help others
Cons: Management is disorganized and apathetic. Most cannot handle stress and lash out. And the clientele are the most obnoxious people.
Advice to Management: Using a rude tone of voice doesn't make anyone want to work harder for you. Be more approachable.

Title: "Server"
Pros: Great management and staff. Very easy to have a flexible schedule.
Cons: A lot of physical labor and can sometimes be mentally exhausting

Title: "Love working there"
Pros: making friends, hours, fun managers, making friends and discounts
Cons: dealing with the servers, answering the phone, hard to cross train, line cooks are rude and the people who come in

Title: "alright work if you need cash"
Pros:
nice people
helpful coworkers
staff is usually friendly depending on the mood of the day
good tips because restaurant is always busy
Cons:
managers tend to be overbearing
really busy and customers get upset
no scheduled breaks. had to be taken at managers decision which was not consistent
Advice to Management: work on doing better communication without getting frustrated and taking it out on the employees. its not fair and management should take some sort of anger management classes

Title: "Very flexible scheduling"
Pros: They work with hotschedules which has an app. It's so easy to pick up shifts or get rid of shifts. This job is perfect for students with changing schedules as well as people working on other careers.
Cons: In regards to having a flexible schedule there are no cons.

Title: "Positive energy"
Pros: you are always motivated to want to do better and are surrounded with people that are just as passionate to see the business do well.
Cons: It is very busy, so it would not be ideal for the lazy.
Advice to Management: Screen servers better.

Title: "Bartender"
Pros: I can't think of any good reasons to work here. If you like cheesecake, you get a discount.
Cons: You may or may not get a break while working a double. If a manager doesn't like you or you would sleep with them, your schedule could turn to many food running shifts.
Advice to Management: Communicate and be consistent. Value your employees and listen to suggestions. Give breaks without making servers feel needy.

Title: "server"
Pros: Great consistent money when you want to put in the time to work a full shift and not be first phased.
Cons: fast-paced, hectic work that can challenge people to have to deal with some of the nastiest guests around
Advice to Management: more staff support day to day

Title: "Very Hard Worker"
Pros: Always on time. And always ready for work. Very good insurance
Cons: Very long hours, with no break
Advice to Management: Stop scheduling doubles

Title: "Worst job ever"
Pros: New restaurant, decent co-workers, that's the best I can say. Preach absolute guest satisfaction as the highest priority. Culture does not reflect that!
Cons: Horrible trainers, sub par managers, horrible hours and pay. Multiple labor laws, health code, compliance issues never addressed by management. HR nightmare. Surprised they have never been sued. Injured on the job, and no report was filed.
Advice to Management: See the cons. Really sad they preach family, team work, "Cheesecake Rocks". It's a load of crap.

Title: "Great menu, great guests"
Pros: Always busy, great money, upbeat environment
Cons: Lots of turnover, can be long hours
Advice to Management: Smile, Support you team

Title: "Cheesecake Factory Wisconsin Ave"
Pros: Welcoming scenery and clean atmosphere.
Cons: Higher level needs better waiting area . Lots of traffic when busy .
Advice to Management: Smile !

Title: "The food is awesome and the People are better"
Pros: The food rocks and the awesome work environment.
Cons: There were no cons really
Advice to Management: Take it slow and work your way up

Title: "Server"
Pros: Easy side work to complete at the end of shift and a great group of servers to work with.
Cons: The kitchen is rude and terribly slow. The guests are very bad at tipping in this area.
Advice to Management: Start working more like a team and care more when a guests complains about something. A table visit should be done when necessary.

Title: "Front Desk"
Pros: co-workers, benefits, paid time off
Cons: high stress environment, late hours

Title: "Steady Server Position"
Pros: Everything is prepared and planned to make it easy to succeed.
Cons: Schedule can be a bit chaotic at times.
Advice to Management: Management was good

Title: "Not worth the hassle unless you want to be a career Cheesecaker"
Pros: Intense training makes you feel prepared for the job; discounts; perks if you stay with company long enough
Cons: Customers feel more entitled; managers and coworkers go from friendly to rude and cold post training, blatant favoritism between managers, waiters, as well as with the cooks

Title: "Server looking for a part time job"
Pros: Great place to work. There's some good, and of course some bad days for making money.
Cons: There's some monkey business around that some servers gives money to the hosts to keep their section full at all times. :/
Advice to Management: Raise the hourly wage Please :)

Title: "MGR"
Pros: benefits, pay, systems, training, and tools
Cons: rate of advancement, view towards external hired managers, lack of teamwork among managers
Advice to Management: visit the restaurants and get to know your management team outside of what a few jealous internally promoted managers have to say. Basically ENGAGE the ENTIRE team!

Title: "Typical Restaurant Job"
Pros: Flexible hours and easy to get days off. The staff is really friendly and it is a fast paced environment.
Cons: Depending on the GM of the restaurant, raises are hard to come by. They will promote some people and not others regardless of seniority or skill.

Title: "Cashier"
Pros: Family Oriented but it requires dedication and passion for the business
Cons: Your experience is completely based on management
Advice to Management: get more involved in all work groups

Title: "Manager"
Pros: Great culture, Rewarding Job, Accommodating schedule, Fair pay, opportunity to advance, consistent and ongoing training,
Cons: The hours in the industry, not much the company can do about it. The work can be brutal sometimes with the amount of business we do. Finding great applicants for this line of work.

Title: "good company"
Pros: flexible schedule, good money, decent benefits
Cons: long hours, work weekends and holidays

Title: "Ost"
Pros: Great company and environment with flexibility to move around locations
Cons: No enough upward mobility for Ost

Title: "General Manager"
Pros:
Stock options
Company leased BMW
Great healthcare
Executive Savings Plan
Paid Vacations
Company sponsored trips and conferences
Cons:
Hours are long
Achieving a work life Balance is a struggle because of amount of hours scheduled per day

Title: "cook"
Pros: Good company good food. The company Is ok to learn alot of the food industry. Half price on food.
Cons: hard work and bad pay
Advice to Management: help others and do something

Title: "Busser DT"
Pros: Decent money at times at nights
Cons: No lunch breaks after working all day
Advice to Management: Get on the same page

Title: "Bartender"
Pros: Always busy, good $$ and people spend money because the menu is so large they order too much food !!
Cons: The uniform is a bit outdated
Advice to Management: Treat people with respect !!

Title: "Happily worked there for years"
Pros: Great company to work for with consistent money year round
Cons: Work weekends and holidays with lots of pace paced working

Title: "great"
Pros: great place to work fun
Cons: work is difficult and can be rough

Title: "High-volume, fast paced serving position with extremely high standards to own up to."
Pros: Good money, great staff, awesome managers, fast paced. Fantastic communication with local restaurant and even corporate offices.
Cons: Two week long training can be tedious. No down time at all. The most corporate a company can get.

Title: "The Cake"
Pros: One of the few restaurant concepts that are closed on Thanksgiving and Christmas.
Cons: Scheduling and work life Balance take a backseat to profit. Bonus structure is completely inadequate
Advice to Management: Realize that you can't kill your staff or managers with the irregularity of the schedule.

Title: "none"
Pros: good for students. flexible schedules
Cons: the management team plays favorites
Advice to Management: none

Title: "Best restaurant"
Pros: Flexible schedule, family environment, everyone is treated fairly, amazing management, good money, angelic uniform, disounts are 50 off or 25 off and no discounts on fridays or saturdays, get free food sometimes, great teamwork
Cons: Gets too busy, guests can be crazy,
Advice to Management: Keep doing what you do :)

Title: "its ok"
Pros: flexible hours , you will never find a more organized kitchen or walk in fridge you can be proud of the food you cook all of it it is great great atmosphere and managers theres a sense of pride ever dish has to have in it . everything you need they get for you and bring to the line when you are cooking basically you come in cook wipe your station down change the pans and leave they have a clean up crew to do the rest . won't find that in most restaurants
Cons: not every week you get 40 hours some weeks you won't get that sometimes you have to work doubles the pay doesn't match with the work and the pay starts of at 11 .
Advice to Management: give better compensation to line cooks they are the back bone of the restaurant and should be treated as such .

Title: "Some Positives, Lots of Negatives"
Pros:
They were very accommodating to schedule requests
Free bread and soup
Availability to work more or less hours if desired
Cons:
They hire management with little experience in restaurants
I was not offered the 6-month review and upon my 1 year I asked again and they either forgot or disregarded. It wasn't until I put in my notice that they offered to give me a review/salary adjustment
Advice to Management: Corporate should make a better effort to become familiar with the staff and also to onboard floor managers so they are able to garner the respect of the employees below them.

Title: "Kitchen Managers"
Pros: Good place to work, great health insurance for Managers. Always have two days of back to back.
Cons:
Some long hours as a kitchen manager.
Some places hard to move up in the company.
Advice to Management: General Managers need to keep eye on getting their FOH & BOH mangers on task with their tool boxes.

Title: "Good"
Pros: Friendly nice coworkers good pay
Cons: Rude customers and constantly busy
Advice to Management: No advice

Title: "Great Place to work"
Pros: Your coworkers are the best part about the job. they make the time go by faster.
Cons: working in a fast paced environment where breaks are not encouraged. dealing with grouchy people
Advice to Management: promote people faster if they show that they have the skills to advance. and to hire people with the right skills for the job in the first place

Title: "Senior Manager, Corporate Support Center"
Pros: Great people, everyone is passionate about what they do. Great benefits, lots of food, fun atmosphere. Lots of laterite to do your job and easy access to senior executives. Leaders who care about the direction of the company, our staff and guests.
Cons: Staffed very lean... Each role at corporate does the job of 3-4 people from another company. My role was done by a team of 6 at my previous employer. Modest pay, no pension plan and moderate 401k.
Advice to Management: Sometimes when you scale the work and add projects you need to add resources or deprioritize other work.

Title: "Great place to work"
Pros: Co workers, clientele, food, discounts
Cons: Side work, closing
Advice to Management: Keep up the good work

Title: "food server"
Pros: The flexibility, and guests consistency
Cons: the turn over of employees and management
Advice to Management: to always open with positive when you're correcting a negative

Title: "Cheesecake Factory Perks"
Pros: Best in industry growth opportunity, even during bad economic times we are opening new restaurants all around the world. As long as you are willing and able to move, there are growth opportunities abound in Cheesecake Factory
Cons: Just like in an Food and Beverage Industry leading company, there are repetitive tasks, long working hours, and you are basically on call for the business. Having complete ownership has its' perks but can also take its toll if you have other commitments.
Advice to Management: Everyone is trained and hired from within, but as Cheesecake Factory continues to grow and possibly expand into new brands and new concepts, outside hiring is a good idea to get outside perspective.

Title: "Great place to make great money!"
Pros: I loved working for The Cheesecake Factory. Management was great and as a corporation they are very good to their employees. People come to Cheesecake ready to spend a lot of money and I made great tips
Cons: Long hours, they loved schedule multiple doubles in a row

Title: "Busser/Server"
Pros: High expectations from management in reference to both demeanor and appearance, resulting in superior service.
Cons: Management comps numerous patron meals for minimal and unrealistic complaints, encouraging this behavior on future visits.
Advice to Management: Support your staff, show confidence in their knowledge and abilities. This will contribute to a positive environment, which heightens the overall experience for customers.

Title: "Okay job"
Pros: Acquire great people person skills
Cons: Some days are slow

Pros:
Good Hours
Line cooks receive free meals everyday
Eat as you cook
Helpful coworkers
Cons:
I had very poor training
Rude expo workers
underpaid for amount of work done
Advice to Management: reevaluate yourselves please, you are driving employees away

Title: "Manager"
Pros: Pay is decent. Staff is usually outstanding.
Cons: Not conducive to anyone that has a family or children. As a manager you are taken advantage of all the time with the excuse that it's the industry. That is extremely false. Dm, rm, and gms will lie and are not looking in your best interest. In ten years experience this is by far the worst company I have worked for.be very careful if choosing this company.

Title: "Bartender/ Server"
Pros: If you move into management you will have great benefits and great pay for a restaurant job.
Cons: It is a Corporate restaurant.
Advice to Management: Get better at doing your job.

Title: "It has potential"
Pros:
Money CAN be great
Sometimes free food which is nice
The people you work with are usually pretty cool and close bonds
Cons:
- Managers care more about numbers than employees.
- managers have favorites and it shows in schedule
- getting time off comes at a price. One shift off= 3 crap shifts to make it up
- Sunday's off is almost impossible
- some gm ideas of priorities is cheesecake than family
Advice to Management: Care more about employees and learn how to work in all areas of the restaurant and actually be helpful.

Title: "Host"
Pros: half off food when working and 25% off on your off day. All the coworkers get along and its a fun work environment and a great job to gain experience from and work multiple job titles at
Cons: phases you often so you work only a few hours when promised a different amount for that day or week.

Title: "Sever"
Pros: good tips flexible schedule , , , ,
Cons: late nights, , , , ,

Title: "Eh could be better"
Pros: Long hours so you can rack in the money, great co-workers, great food to eat on break, discount to family and friends you are eating with.
Cons: The management system was horrible. The managers didn't treat the employees with positivity or make them feel like they are needed there.
Advice to Management: Treat the employers with better care.

Title: "Server Job"
Pros: Potential to make good money. Great team of coworkers. Helpful & encouraging management staff. Good schedule flexibility.
Cons: Not allowed to add gratuities to parties leaving many servers "stiffed" for an entire shift. Management gives write-ups to employees too easily & often, due to a large amount of corporate "rules".

Title: "server"
Pros: Good money, fast pace, awesome people
Cons: Guests can be rude sometimes

Title: "Waiter"
Pros:
Flexible schedule for college students
Fast past environment with comprehensive training
Minimum wage however tips make it a decent paying job
Cons: Entry training can be excessive

Title: "Servwr"
Pros: Great atmosphere. Amazing tips. Long and efficient hours. Management team was always there to help. Friendly co workers. Overall awesome experience
Cons: I think the only thing I would change would be the training process which was very long and tiresome
Advice to Management: I think I would tell the management that they need to lower the standards for training and also be more patient

Title: "Sometimes Great, Sometimes Not"
Pros: Most of the time you can make great money. The other servers, hosts, and bakers are great people to work with.
Cons:
Clientele and social dynamics of the restaurant. If you say the wrong thing, and a manager doesn't like what you said, then they will use their power over your financial stability to control you by cutting your shifts or by placing you in a lot of unprofitable stations. Be prepared for a lot of social anxiety on top of the already difficult clientele.

This particular restaurant is in a rough area. Be prepared to have to deal with a lot of unclassy people who lack knowledge of restaurant etiquette. After a while, the environment does start to get to you emotionally, physically, and mentally.
Advice to Management: Talk to people when there is an issue, rather than use financial manipulation. You are screwing with peoples lives.

Title: "Cheesecake Factory"
Pros: Flexible hours that goes well when working your way through college. Offered a decent health care plan. If working in the front of the house in a position earning tips, steady business offers opportunity to make consistent money
Cons: It's your typical corporate restaurant and all the negatives that come with it. Constant turnover but it's par for the course in the industry.

Title: "Life at the Cheese"
Pros: Money is good, co-workers are all nice, management is manageable.
Cons: The stress can lead to some pretty vicious vices if you don't cope well.

Title: "Food runner"
Pros: Great flexibility and always shifts available for pickup
Cons: Long hours and late nights.
Advice to Management: Offer more growth and coaching

Title: "Great Place to work For"
Pros: Definitely making great money as a bartender or server. Appreciate the staff, and recognition is given daily. Many opportunities for growth, and advancement. As a trainer the oppurtunity to travel and opening new locations,with great pay. They offer good health plans to full time employees as well as vacation time earned each week.
Cons:
if you don't know the menus it's not the job for you, it's not a restaurant that you can just "wing" it.
They are very disciplined on menu,recipe and spec knowledge. (not really a bad thing,if you want to make money) Not allowed to "upsell", must manage own hours, can't got Into overtime, or work 7 shifts in a row.
Advice to Management: Keep your staff happy, and appreciate them, which they did at the location I worked for.

Title: "Server//bartender/DT"
Pros: Obviously I like the company (I have worked there for about 6yrs. The benefits are expensive compared the directcomputition.
Cons: As you've seen earlier higher interest in giving us top motch management would be so nice. I have seen servers and great management leave due to lack of interest in their skills only to be chased by our area management after it was too late!!
Advice to Management: We sound around 40 hours a week and 10 of that is spent waiting to be "cut", come on, cowboy up, if we got hit with 5 or 10 more tables you can roll up those sleeve, GET OUT OF THE OFFUCE, and giveu

Title: "Not a bad gig"
Pros: My location, next to Disneyland, is almost always busy. People love Cheesecake Factory so there are always opportunities to work make money. Management is flexible with scheduling and is will to work around school schedules.
Cons: Employees aren't treated as well as they were in the past. Hard work isn't always recognized and rewarded. There isn't enough emphasis put on the importance of teamwork.
Advice to Management: Show employees that they are the company's most valuable resource by rewarding them when deserved. Also put a bigger importance on company bonding and teamwork.

Title: "server, hostess"
Pros: Amazing team effort. Great managers, fantastic thorough training.
Cons: I don't have any con comments.
Advice to Management: Love the company

Title: "Server"
Pros:
-consistent business
-can create your own schedule due to hot schedules and large # of co-workers
-work with a diverse group of people
Cons:
-poor clientele, some customers are good but a lot will rip you off with low tips
-high stress
Advice to Management: Let servers take care of guests and not get bogged down with running food and side work.

Title: "Overworked; under paid; unfair managers"
Pros: Their GM, Steve, was very nice.
Cons: All the other managers were terrible. Completely biased and totally unprofessional. I watched so many people get the axe for unknown reason.

Title: "dishwasher"
Pros: Free lunch that's all that kept me there for a month
Cons: Bad hours very very hard work , prepare yourself for burned fingers and soaked cloths every day.
Advice to Management: Hire more people

Title: "Server"
Pros: Great people and they really reward those who work hard.
Cons: More than anything, it was dealing with needy clientele.

Title: "Awesome"
Pros: Caring coworkers, awesome managers, good pay, a lot of flexibility!
Cons: Only thing I can think of is the clientele
Advice to Management: Keep doing what you're doing!

Title: "Server"
Pros:
-great online app available
-flexible schedules based on a lot of servers
Cons:
-managers(variable by store)
-hard to move up in company

Title: "Server"
Pros: new restaurant opening so everyone started at the same level, no seniority, good location
Cons: Over-hired, started with 140 servers which resulted in few shifts,

Title: "Senior Manager"
Pros: Good systems in place for running the restaurant.
Cons: Quality of life, lots of late nights and weekends.

Title: "Physically demanding"
Pros: The money could be good, depending on the night.
Cons: Those marble floors will murder your feet.
Advice to Management: Do a better job of making sure your staff can take five uninterrupted minutes to pee or grab a drink. I can't tell you how many shifts I ran for ten hours straight without the luxury of a potty break.

Title: "Best restaurant you can work for"
Pros: Management is awesome, very helpful and doesnt make you feel second rate or not worth it. this place is always busy. The money is 100% there but its not easy work. Co-workers make all the craziness of the restaurant so worth it.this place is probably my favorite job so far, i never thought i would say that about a restaurant
Cons: always busy.. it has its pros and cons. if you dont think you can keep up dont waste your time.
Advice to Management: keep up the awesome work

Title: "A very fast paced job"
Pros: the co-workers are super nice
Cons: It would be nice to have more than a 30 min break when working a double

Title: "Server"
Pros: Consistent money, fair managers, and very flexible work hours
Cons: The clientele can wear you down. They complain about anything, get a free meal, it is exhausting.
Advice to Management: Back your employees more

Title: "Horrible...just...horrible"
Pros: Can make a decent amount of money during the summer and on weekends but that's it.
Cons: Poor management, No breaks, Policies that make zero sense and waste time, Working like pigs and dealing with large obnoxious crowds.
Advice to Management: Invest some time and thought into your policies before making them and treat the people working for you like people, not cattle. Stop making up new rules that make no sense and stop stuffing your faces all day. Seriously, quit eating and work like the rest of us.

Title: "Server"
Pros: Able to transfer to any location
Cons: Inconstancy with schedule and pay

Title: "Great company! ...EXCEPT"
Pros: I've been with the company for a couple years now, I've worked for several different locations, and I loved coming to work. Cheesecake has it's own culture. Plenty of tables to flipped, and money to be made, granted the right service.
Cons: DO NOT work at the Aventura location. If you are a transfer, it will ruin your image of Cheesecake. This location is merely a store to create high numbers. Management is immature and unprofessional, and the guests are like no other (in a bad way). Stay far, far away!
Advice to Management: Keep it classy

Title: "If you're looking for fast paced work..."
Pros: The restaurant is always busy so the day goes fast, 25% employee discount, free soup and bread while on duty, excellent employee meal plan you can enroll in, free cheesecake at Christmas, 2 weeks vacation after one year.
Cons: The restaurant runs lean, so 9-10 hours with no break is not uncommon; Hours can be inconsistent, therefore pay is inconsistent; You will end up working most weekends as that is the busiest time; They tend to hire kitchen managers outside the company, which makes it tougher to move up the ranks.
Advice to Management: Adopt more of a "promote from within" culture for kitchen personnel

Title: "cheesy"
Pros: awesome money while going to school really flexible
Cons: there really are none one of the best serving jobs

Title: "Great Company"
Pros: Great benefits, good pay, good future.
Cons: Very busy almost everyday. High hours demanded

Title: "Great Managers"
Pros: I worked here in 2013 and the Managers were all amazing. Very kind, understanding, and generous. Love them. They love you back if you put the work forward!
Cons: The hours were horrible and extremely tiring. Everyone was tired all the time which made it a somewhat uncomfortable environment to work in.
Advice to Management: Please hire more people! the work cannot be done by the few people working. it would greatly alleviate the working atmosphere.

Title: "server/food runner/cashier/baker/filler/host"
Pros: Quickly move up and change possisions. Detailed server classes. Tons of staff not difficult to pick up or release shifts.
Cons: Large menu you will have to learn a lot. All white uniform.
Advice to Management: Be approachable. When talking to your staff try and word things so you don't sound condescending.

Title: "AWESOME!"
Pros: Management training is awesome! Lots of fun and the company is very focused on guest satisfaction and performance. I am held to a higher standard than most other people.
Cons: Long hours but that is to be expected. Most shifts are varied and can cause some weird sleep habits but that's what we signed up for!
Advice to Management: Focus on Habit #7! Have fun and be yourself! Coach and teach all you can before you move on and move up!

Title: "Great Experience"
Pros: Wonderful place to learn invaluable customer service skills. A great opportunity for a restaurant career or a chance to make money while chasing your dreams. I love the annual Thanksgiving feast!
Cons: Cons typical of any restaurant job. The all white uniform was horrible.
Advice to Management: My location had a great management team. Other locations are less fortunate. Make sure your managers care about the staff. Good managers and good teammates can make or break the job.

Title: "Horrible Managers"
Pros: Great hours, great pay.
Cons: The managers and the management system are horrible, you stay later than the time you're scheduled to get off (sometimes 2 or three hours later) every night unless given "permission" to leave on time, you only get a break if you work a double shift (10+ hours) or if you work a 9 hour shift exact.
Advice to Management: Stop looking down on the employees and start treating them with more decency and like they are welcomed onto the team.

Title: "Not a bad experience"
Pros: Great training, easy to pick up shifts
Cons: Large staff, Smaller sections, very corporate
Advice to Management: No advice

Title: "Server"
Pros: good company to work for, great benefits,
Cons: management at times is not so great
Advice to Management: pay more attention to your employees

Title: "Not a Great Place to work"
Pros: They pay managers well and the benefits are great. Also will work with you on your scheduling needs. You almost always get two consecutive days off in a row
Cons: The hours are awful and if your from an outside restaurant the culture is set against you, Your ideas and contributions mean nothing unless you were an hourly that got promoted to management. Almost hostile environment if your a manager coming from the outside
Advice to Management: Get away from the Cheesecake way or the highway and look at the restaurant from a different perspective.

Title: "I thought it would be great..."
Pros: In-depth training, can work as many hours as you want (and more), free soup and bread, outdoor seating
Cons: Management is brutal- no matter what a customer says about you, they write you up right after they yell at you and comp the guests meal. The culture of the place is like high school and the managers are the "cool kids" that can make or break you. The chain name attracts a lot of guests (in Milwaukee) that don't tip. A guest walked out on a bill one night and I was told by management to pay their bill or take a write up... Seriously... High Turn-over rates are to be expected with the lack of support for the servers.
Advice to Management: Support your servers and recognize when guests are complaining just to get their meals comped.

Title: "Okay"
Pros: Lots of hours and many fun people to work with. Management and staff were all welcoming and willing to help me.
Cons: Poor working conditions and one manager was mean. Poor efficiency and managers showed laziness during clean up process
Advice to Management: Get some new managers who aren't lazy and will work to get you out on time especially in the dish room.

Title: "Fast money"
Pros: The money is consistent and there are always people coming through the door, food quality is pretty high for high-volume restaurant
Cons: A lot of favoritism, no gratuity added at all anymore even for larger parties

Title: "Great Company"
Pros: Some of the best managers I have had have been at the Cheesecake Factory. Great staff and job all around
Cons: I do not have any downsides really. I wish I could have a perfect shift every shift, but the inconsistencies of serving are always there.
Advice to Management: Continue to do what you do. Keep up the great morale and continue to focus on what's important. It is just a great place to work in every way.

Title: "Natick was awful"
Pros: Not many, you can make money, if you are one of the manager's favorites and if the front desk is getting tipped.
Cons: The restaurant business can attract some of the lowest forms of life. This is one of those places. Natick had the worst, immoral, unscrupulous managers/predators.
Advice to Management: Fire all of them.

Title: "Senior Kitchen Manager"
Pros: Fast Paced and fun environment
Cons: Compensation is not as good as it once was.

Title: "server"
Pros: great money and schedule because you can use hot schedules to swap and release shifts.
Cons: needing a manager to do a lot of things on our computer system get annoying when you're super busy
Advice to Management: great work!

Title: "busy restaurant"
Pros: free meals, benefits for hourly employees
Cons: high stress and high expectations

Title: "Decent money, but get used to holidays and feeling like you don't matter at all."
Pros:
-decent money
-opportunities to move up/ promotions
-staff discount
-free meals for double shifts
-they attempt to train everyone well and give everyone appropriate knowledge to succeed
-food is good, easy to sell
-overall staff is welcoming and helpful
-suggested gratuity is printed on the bottom of every check and credit card receipt
-ability to get shifts covered/ flexible schedule (use of hotschedules)
-at my location you can get your shifts covered instead of calling out by offering monetary insentives for others to pick up your shifts
-aside from holidays, it is almost always quite busy especially compared to other restaurants
-health benefits available: you have to pay for them and you are required to work a certain # of hours each week to keep them
Cons:
-guests expect everything for free and many are rude and insulting to staff
-there are no automatic gratuities any longer
-plan on working every holiday for your entire employment w/ this company
-vacation time accrues, but who cares because it is only minimum wage, which when taken is completely eaten by taxes.
-1) competent kitchen, 2) competent food runners, 3) competent management, 4) busy enough to make money: pick two.
-management is mostly extremely poor
-knowledge expected by the company is honestly a quite ridiculous amount, even though the training is somewhat thorough, the extensive knowledge required, is for the large part, unattainable
-veteran staff are overworked and relied upon with no gratitude shown
-management plays favorites often: certain rules only apply to certain people, if you aren't liked you will be fired one way or another, and only certain staff's guest surveys are posted for everyone to read.
-Sundays are required because all of the guests on Sundays are difficult to please and a large majority of them don't tip.
-if you have a guest walk-out, you are blamed as inattentive server and forced to pay for their meal or be documented
-high turn-around
-high suggested tip out amounts
-if you do not document your cash and credit tips (separately) and tip out amounts each night for your personal records, you are sometimes required to claim more than you make if you fall short of what you "should be making" according to your sales
Advice to Management:
-stop making our job more difficult than it is
-guests do not listen to a single word we say, please print everything you'd like them to know in the menu
-show more appreciatation for staff (especially veterans)
-close slower locations during holidays where tipped staff make little to almost nothing for working those holidays
- fix broken machines/faucets/coolers etc.
-find a better way to train managers and keep them accountable. They are often truly incompetent, and most of them have no idea how to approach staff or guests. They can be insensitive, and not very understanding.
-find a better way to make sure your staff is tipped appropriately, either by increasing salaries to regular minimum wage in every restaurant or by including gratuities on all checks automatically, etc
-Stop hiring people based on looks and instead hire more competent staff who won't quit or be fired within months
-offer free health benefits to all staff, erase the paid vacation which we can't get off for anyway
-stop punishing staff for eating their employee meals on the wrong day, a free meal for a job well-done or a double-shift should be good any day.

Title: "Server , Host"
Pros: The culture of the company was the best. The colleagues that you work with are very nice and outgoing people.
Cons: Management doesn't always listen to what their employees have to say. They assert the ideas that they are better than you, often.
Advice to Management: Listen to the advice of your employees

Title: "Server"
Pros: My co-workers were awesome! Made a lot of lifetime friends. The food was awesome also. We got to taste new dishes as they came out every 6 months. (Used to) get employee meals for checking out someone's side work. The managers were very understanding on life issues that came up. Like any waitress job, the public can be hard to deal with sometimes and tips weren't always where you wanted them.
Cons: When I worked there, they had secret shoppers. To had to say everything the company wanted you to say. If a secret shopper came through, you got marked down on your score if you missed something the company wanted you to suggestive sell. Saw co-workers let go because they weren't adhering to the cope rules. I understand they don't do this anymore which is great!
Advice to Management: Treat everyone fair with no favorites.

Title: "I didn't make as much as I expected to. The job wasn't bad though, but there was A LOT to learn."
Pros:
The people I worked with were nice. During training we got to eat together and sample all of the food. That part was really fun. There was a discount for employee meals, so that's always good.

It's a nice, clean environment.
Cons:
SO MUCH information. Before you could start serving, you had to take multiple tests, like what ingredients are in foods. Also, at every table you had to memorize a long spiel of specials and soups, and introduce yourself a certain way, etc. It was a lot. I could always tell that the customers wanted me to stop talking or were bored. But I still said it all anyway.

I didn't make as much money as I thought I would. You really have to do lunch and dinner shifts (like both in 1 day) to make a decent amount. At least at my location. You have to tip out the bartender and the food runner, which cut into your tips.
Advice to Management: My managers were really cool. I can't think of any advice for them. They were really professional and were there if I needed them for anything.

Title: "Fast paced environment where you will either fall behind or push yourself for those $$$."
Pros: Lots of tips for serving . Busy consistently .
Cons: Stressful environment. Compensation isn't as good as you'd want it to be.

Title: "Great place to work, depending on who you work with (Busser)"
Pros: There are a lot of pros to working at The Cheesecake Factory in Knoxville. During your shift, the food is 50% off, and when you aren't, it's 25% off your entire bill. Depending on what you like and who makes it, the food is generally good, and the cheesecakes are delicious! The managers will be respectful and work with you to make sure you work the shifts that you want. When you work a double or help a manger, you get free food too. If you are a full-time worker, you accumulate paid vacation days, which is nice. You will meet a lot of people who you love to work with and love hanging out with after work. This company promotes a lot from within, so if you work hard you can move up.
Cons: While there are many pros, there are many cons to consider. Like a lot of restaurants, who you work with can either make your shift amazing or a nightmare, especially with the managers. Hard work is not appropriately recognized, and even if you work hard and give it 110%, most of the time the managers do not acknowledge it or reward you. The bussers are consistently overstaffed, which means you make less money and have a lot of dead time. Because of this, the managers will make you look busy instead of scheduling the right number of people. The dish crew is always running behind, and the managers will make you rack and run your own silverware if they get really behind. Also, when you work a double or help a manger, you'll get a green ticket which you use to get free food. The problem with this is that people who are friends with the managers will get green tickets without even doing anything. Finally, if you wish to move up in the company, you have to have a very flexible schedule. They hold classes for servers/bartenders once every 3-6 months. The class spans over a week and a half with most of them being morning classes. This means that if you are in school or have other responsibilities during the day, you may not be able to move up because of schedule conflicts. I tried to give as accurate a description of the pros and cons as I could. Good luck with whatever you choose!
Advice to Management: Recognize and reward hard work from employees to encourage them and stop overstaffing bussers.

Title: "Line Cook"
Pros: At cheesecake, you receive excellent training, gain experience in a fast-paced, multi-lingual environment, and you receive good compensation.
Cons: I experienced sexual harassment and hostility in regards to my availability. I was frequently scheduled to work outside my hours of availability. After facing sexual harassment, I was inappropriately consulted on how to handle the situation (they asked me if I wanted him fired, which places guilt on me). I worked at both the Natick and Newton locations.
Advice to Management: Pay attention to the line staff, and make it clear sexual harassment won't be tolerated. Have policies in place for handling sexual harassment, that all management is aware of. The front managers were generally aware of how to handle these issues well, but the kitchen managers (aside from one woman who checked in with me and gave me some resources for dealing with harassment) repeatedly showed a lack of interest in handling sexual harassment in an appropriate manner.

Title: "It was fun, crazy, and lucritive at the same time but could be stuffy and polotical at the same time"
Pros: Good money, always something to be done, great location
Cons: Traffic was a nightmare, made employees park a long distance away and ride an inconsisistent shuttle
Advice to Management: FOH training needs to be re worked for the new generation of young servers

Title: "Hostess"
Pros: It was fun and got free food sometimes.
Cons: It does not pay enough
Advice to Management: Care more about the employees.

Title: "This is the major league of casual fine dining."
Pros: People that work there love the food, and there is an abundance of diversity on the menu. People also love the culture, The Cheesecake Factory champions treating their hourly staff the way they should be treated--with respect! Managers are extremely flexible when it comes to scheduling, there are great opportunities for advancement, and servers, bussers, line cooks, kitchen managers and restaurant managers are friendly and promote a fun and safe working environment. This was easily the best company I have ever worked for in the restaurant industry, and I have been doing this for over 9 years. The opportunity for advancement is second-to-none. As a matter of fact, we, as managers were expected to be constantly training ourselves for promotions. I never heard of any manager that had worked for the company for multiple years that was not promoted. They encourage you to learn as much as you can about the food, culture, and systems. Staff are allowed free soup and bread (something you won't always find at other chains) and there's a meal program that takes a small amount of money out of your paycheck each day that you work and allows you to order most of the items on the menu (because just about everyone would take advantage of ordering the high priced items like the filet mignon or the ribeye). I will sorely miss the people, the managers, and the general attitude of every person I worked with, met, and became friends with while I was employed. Cheesecake Rocks!
Cons: The fast pace can be too much for some people and the hours can be long and arduous. As an example, I, as a kitchen manager, worked around 11-14 hours a day and it was exhausting. It was difficult to find the right work/life balance and ultimately I chose life over work. A lot of people in management, because of the long hours and having to work sometimes at home, reported their relationships with their significant other deteriorated and/or ended. While I was there, one of the kitchen managers was going through a rough divorce and a restaurant manager told me about how his wife divorced him because he became a workaholic and he ultimately had to step down as his role as the general manager and was demoted.
Advice to Management: The benefits package that came with my salary were great. Bonuses were based on the overall performance of all the managers. My only advice is to lower the amount of hours managers have to work in order to create an environment that will allow a better work/life balance and more time to spend with family.

Title: "I have worked here for 5 years"
Pros: Flexible hours and the ability to make good money. They treat the employees well and provide good benefits.
Cons: No cons to the job except some of the costumers are hard to deal with in this day and age.
Advice to Management: Management needs to continue doing what they are doing but i really don't think the consumer is always right.

Title: "Fun restaurant crew"
Pros: flexibility to pick up and drop shifts
Cons: Management using current roles as a stepping stone in their own careers lots of talk less action
Advice to Management: Consistent support to employees and don't play favorites

Title: "Excellent I learn to many things about customer service. Tremendous working environment"
Pros: Oportunity to grow up as a profesional
Cons: Not to much anything bad to say

Title: "It was the best serving job I've had"
Pros: great tips, great employees; great managers
Cons: micro managing, sunday clientele, health benefits
Advice to Management: Keep up the good work!

Title: "The people are great and it is a company you can be proud to work for."
Pros: Great culture, fun product, more than fair pay, good working conditions.
Cons: Sometimes we try to do too much without enough resources.
Advice to Management: Focus on growth, be willing to take a few more risks

Title: "Working for The Cheesecake Factory is amazing because they develop and nurture me to be the best I can be!"
Pros: My coworkers are like family. It's a great to come to work surrounded by people you really enjoy. Everyone is friendly and caring. Family like atmosphere. Positive people. My job is always interesting and I learn so much everyday. Also, my department listens to me and if I have a dream for myself, they give me the tools to help me fulfill it.
Cons: We run lean, so sometimes the workload can be a little much.
Advice to Management: Consider bringing a few more permanent positions in the office. There are a lot of hardworking temps that have to work 5 days at corporate and 1 day on the weekend. It doesn't leave much time for work life balance.

Title: "very good, nice schedule"
Pros:
schedule is how you want
always busy, good money
nice management
Cons:
runner shifts,

closing duties like in other restaurants

Title: "Truly a Best Place to Work!"
Pros: Great flexibility, ability to grow with the company, active and engaged corporate staff on all levels, great benefits, and lots of perks to bring fun to the corporate offices
Cons: A few bad apples higher up, but have come to expect that in corporate America
Advice to Management: Evaluate the traits of your leaders. It is not okay to say "yeah, that person is difficult to work with". Being difficult should never be an excuse. Those difficult people may deliver results you like but they treat others in the company poorly and that reflects on you and the company and brand.

Title: "The BEST place to work!"
Pros:
Leadership that cares.
Fun culture.
Many opportunities for growth.
Cons: Technology is outdated or lacking.
Advice to Management: Keep doing what you're doing!

Title: "The Cheesecake Factory Headquarters. This is truly a fun, enriching, family enviornment! Fantastic."
Pros: Recognition for a job well done. Celebration of milestones and achievements. The company lives up to it's Mission, Vision and Values. The Value," People - Our Greatest Resource", is exhibited everyday.
Cons: Heavy workload with minimal staff. However, very engaging and everyone is dedicated to a job well done.
Advice to Management: More real-time communication. It sometimes feels as if there is a delay while information is reviewed by 50 people. The delay makes it seem as if the company is trying to hold back information, or may not have a plan of action.

Title: "Simply the Best"
Pros:
• Hiring practices make sure that all employees are competent and NICE. Incompetence and unprofessional demeanors are not tolerated. Everyone who works here is friendly, kind, helpful, and smart.
• The perks are great. Competitive salary, great benefits, free-flowing coffee, tea, soda, and fruit. Lots of fun corporate activities. Many, many opportunities to eat cheesecake!
• Because this is such a great place to work, there is a tendency for people to stay a long time. This leads to lots of promotions from within. The company is comitted to everyone's development and growth.
• Fast-moving, challenging environment. But only in the most-positive ways.
• Beautiful offices.
Cons:
• Some people gain weight when they start to work here from all the great food.
• Calabasas is not a convenient commuting destination from a good part of L.A. county. But if you live in the valley or ventura county, this is your place!
Advice to Management: Keep up the great work. R

Title: "It's a whirlwind of activity and opportunities"
Pros: I love the people I work with on a daily basis. My department focuses on career and personal development. I feel supported in my decision making and my skill progression. I've been givien the opportunity to be cross-trained in several areas which gives the opportunity for greater compensation. I feel like my managers have my back. They are very understanding about work/life balance and encourage me to take my time off so there is no burnout and I can do things that are important to me and my family. My department is very busy and though sometimes we can be stretched very thin, if we ask for help they will bring in a temp or find us the support we need to get things done.
Cons: Some of the challenges of working here are that it is very busy. My department is small, but mighty and we are stetched thin at times. Sometimes there is a separation of information from department to department. Everyone is so focused on their projects that they forget that others need to know that information as well.
Advice to Management: Create a project or initiatives manager position that follow initiatives and projects and their communication from inception to dissemination to insure everyone has the information they need without having to hunt it down.

Title: "The Cheesecake Factory is an exceptional place to work where every staff members are passionate about their contribution"
Pros: High energy work environment with quality in everything from benefits to "perks"
Cons: It is very high paced and not for everyone who is not willing to roll up their sleeves and contribute.
Advice to Management: Continue to focus on delivering an exceptional guest and employee experience

Title: "Fun & fulfilling corporate environment!"
Pros: Everyone is very nice and supportive, robust culture, founder is still on-site and involved, incredible number of tenured staff, your voice is heard, snacks and food are out all the time, fun events, restaurant discounts and employee cake sales!
Cons: Low glass ceiling, fear of making the wrong decisions is widespread, only 2 weeks of vacation to start, small incremental raises, no bonus plans for Managers on down.
Advice to Management: Bonus plans and stock for more of the corporate staff. A staff member with a monetary bonus, along with company ownership = a very hardworking, focused, loyal staff member that will go above and beyond.

Title: "Love the Cheesecake - stay for your career!"
Pros:
Great company culture that supports a brand you can feel great about! The executives are approachable and truly understand the business. The campany does what it says which is rare in todays employment market. Meaning almost all companies have vision and values but few uphold them when there is a choice between doing the right thing and making an extra buck.
Here at the Cheesecake Factory - you will become part of an extended family that puts relationships and how we do things ahead of everything else. The culture here is one that supports everyone, while challenging you to always be your best.
By the way - if you love food - no one does it better! The care and passion behind our food is amazing! The CEO is hands on most days in the kitchen working with a fantastic culinary team to provide a contemporary amazing menu.
This is a great palce to stay for a long time as the company stays true to its history. We have many peopel that have been here for over 20 years and with our global expansion there is a ton of opportunity and growth in the future!
Fianlly a paid sabbatical at 5 years is amazing!
Cons:
We are very conservative at investing in support roles / administration. While this is a prudent financial decision, we are often asked to do a lot with limited resources. Again - if you like be challenged and stretched - this is great for you. I should also say that when a project is critical to the companies success - it receives the funding required.

Also being lean on the support staff limits the opportuntiy for career growth at the Corp Support Center. Many roles are very specailized and this limits the opportunity for cross training and growth.
Advice to Management: Keep listening to the staff and be as transparent as possible. Continue to invest in your people and know that one great Cheesecake staff or manager is worth many potential hires. Give them the opportuntiy to continue to learn and grow!

Title: "Server"
Pros: Very busy and good money. Great people and fun environment. Very high standards.
Cons: Relying on tips for income. Not much opportunity for advancement.
Advice to Management: Increase hourly pay for tipped employees.

Title: "Great food! Great culture! Great place to work!"
