Pros: I have an opportunity for growth in a fun yet challenging community of friends. In a company that seeks innovation, we have a voice in making things better and are recognized for our efforts.
Cons: The corporate support team runs lean. There is a great number of good ideas and projects with limited bandwidth.
Advice to Management: The restaurant level has a ton of processes and executes them at a high level. Let's continue to make it easier for them and make it a great experience for our staff and mangers.

Title: "it was okay"
Pros: free food, free cheesecake, free drinks, 25 percent discount
Cons: very low pay, not enough hours
Advice to Management: listen to the suggestions from your employees

Title: "Positive, supportive atmosphere that makes coming to work a plus."
Pros: Work-Life balance is encouraged. Activities for employees are vast and the atmosphere is fun.
Cons: There are so many snacks and parties that you may gain 10 lbs in your first year of employment if you are not careful.
Advice to Management: On-Site Gym or fitness classes and a cafeteria might be highly desirable and competitive.

Title: "The Cheesecake Factory has a family oriented culture, internal growth opportunities and offer many training workshops."
Pros: I like working for TCCF because of the benefits offered.
Cons: TCCF is a large company so if you want to advance your career, it's a really good ideal to build relationships so you don't get lost in the crowd.

Title: "After 15 years I still love it as much as I did when I started...it's a GREAT PLACE TO WORK!!"
Pros: I love the culture of passion, commitment to excellence, service mindedness and quality in everything we do.
Cons: We work hard to support our busy restaurants, but that's OK...we are the corporate support center.

Title: "Very fast paced and somewhat hectic but I love it!"
Pros: The money is good averaging $20 and hour in high season (Feb-May) we stay steady through the summer when other restaurants in area do not. Most servers have been here for years. Its fun working with friends! Health Insurance is offered and incentives to bring in new talent. Promoting from within is huge! Easy to relocate to another location and there are options to open new restaurants all over the country!
Cons: The hard working servers are sometimes overlooked with so many servers on the floor. Like anywhere there will be servers that don't pull as much weight as I do and that can be frustrating feel unfair. But at the end of my shift I'm usually pleased with the money I made in a short amount of time. After all, that's why I'm serving anyway!!!
Advice to Management: I will speak for most of the servers and say our bussers aren't the best. With the exception of a few newer ones that we have worked on to assist us a little bit when we are crazy busy prebussing and clearing dirty high tops that guests are waiting to be cleaned and to see 4 bussers standing together just waiting for a table to clear instead of hustling to help us. They would make more money and our guests would get much better service! After all they are our highest priority right? It's frustrating when the senior busser is training the new busser and telling them not to assist the servers. This issue has been brought to the GM's and managements attention many times with no avail.

Title: "Fantastic company to work for"
Pros: Fast pace, good opportunity, good people, great money
Cons: Management staff can get lazy if their store is a perpetual top performer
Advice to Management: Remember that your staff is your greatest asset

Title: "It's like being paid to be a part of the Food Network all day!"
Pros: People here ooze warmth and hospitality, love to have fun and are passionate about being the best. And what can be better if you're into food - whether you want to learn about nutrition, like dining out, enjoy unique food flavors, are amazed by great cooking techniques or enjoy wine tasting!
Cons: Haven't found any yet . . .
Advice to Management: Keep up the great work!

Title: "Food research"
Pros: There is always available positions and the management is nice.
Cons: Long routine experiments not related to research.
Advice to Management: Management could pay more attention to junior microbiologists joining the group as they can bring lots of new expertise to the company.

Title: "Great company to work for"
Pros: I love working for this company. All the staff and managers are great. There are also lots of opportunities for growth within the company.
Cons: can be stressful at times

Title: "Egos on parade"
Pros: benefits, wonderful food, 90% of staff are outstanding especially in the kitchen, pride in knowing you work for the most popular company in the business.
Cons: way too many egos, abundance of office politics, audio and video not matching(saying one thing doing another), integrity issues, lots of passing the buck from those who are accountable, most superiors do not truly care, growth does exist but you will need to "practically" beg for it, management pay is 10-20% below what it should be, and again, you will need to beg for any increase because they do not really want to give it to you, your ideas are useless because they already know it all, far too many extra meetings, employee events, etc, extreme hours, lots of working from home, overly structured, too many hoops, takes an act of congress to get things done, operating systems in place are overwhelming and much too complex for a restaurant, need to scale down and simplify, sanitation & operational failures are a daily battle, huge disconnect between corporate and operations, ivory tower syndrome, pressure is extreme at times feeling of life & death instead of food & people business, too much change to manage, unethical terminations
Advice to Management: see above comments

Title: "Great!"
Pros: Flexible schedule was the best.
Cons: I had no issues with cheesecake.
Advice to Management: Keep up the good work.

Title: "Baker, Customer service"
Pros: Baking and making people happy
Cons: having to close then open
Advice to Management: More benefits and career opportunities

Title: "Great company to work for"
Pros:
Staff feels like family
Great Food
Cons: few and far in between
Advice to Management: continue to maintain the quality of service that we employ

Title: "Great salary, excellent job growth opportunities"
Pros: CCF has a great work ethic and values, they pay a great salary, and are very flexible with schedules
Cons: The guests that come in sometimes overspend and end up leaving a lot less tip than suggested. You end up working a lot for nothing.

Title: "Kitchen Manager"
Pros: Continously growth as a person
Cons: Be aware of the customer base and changes
Advice to Management: Remain open minded allowing creativity

Title: "could be worse"
Pros: the co-workers are all pretty nice and they have super flexible schedules
Cons: management sucks, strict corporate rules
Advice to Management: employees need a life too

Title: "Amazing, demanding, and political"
Pros: Benefits, challenging, people, atmosphere, brand, and food
Cons: Hours, politics, investment required, compensation vs responsibilities.
Advice to Management: Don't always look at numbers with restaurants farther away from corporate. Rather then listen to the staff and what they go through with corrupted managers that hide behind numbers.

Title: "Good money"
Pros: Pick of shifts, good money, managers are typically helpful
Cons: High turn over, typical restaurant lifestyle

Title: "Fun and easy"
Pros: Lots of free food, fun co workers, easy schedule
Cons: Low pay, corrupt managers, lots of favoritism
Advice to Management: Be fair

Title: "It's just okay..."
Pros:
Great food
Thorough training provided
Friendly team
Good systems in place
Cons:
Management isn't that great and they have favorites
If a customer does not like the dish, the server is blamed for "not explaining it well enough"
uniform is all white
Advice to Management: Value your employees more

Title: "Server"
Pros: great money. good environment, good staff
Cons: long work hours. few days off. no breaks

Title: "Unpleasant experience, worked there for over a year"
Pros: Decent tip money depending on the night
Cons: Unfair division of table sections
Advice to Management: Stop micro managing and let the employees breath

Title: "satisfied"
Pros: organized, efficient, good management, well run, clean
Cons: long hours, hard work, lots of time spent standing up and running around

Title: "It's been good!"
Pros: You can make decent money, it's been a fun place to work.
Cons: Clientele and management can be across the board and wacky.

Title: "Great."
Pros: Good. Great company to work for.
Cons: None. They are the best.
Advice to Management: None.

Title: "Fast paced and fun"
Pros: Management took really good care of us, often were given free food. Extremely flexible scheduling easy to pick up and drop shifts via phone app. Several co-workers were fast-tracked to management within 2 years. Really solid teamwork.
Cons: Customers would essentially always get their way, most often when they are in the wrong, promoting them to walk over staff until they got their way. Menu changes were often and learning the system takes time.

Title: "Great place to work"
Pros: Very flexible schedule, I love using Hotschedules to pickup or release shifts and submit requests off or change availability. The company is growing and there are opportunities to get into management and open new stores. The company just opened their first international stores in Dubai and is doing very well. You work hard for the money, you'll make money.
Cons: Hourly pay wages suck for servers. As a server, I have to tip out 4% of my total sales- 2% to the bussers, 1% to the food runners, and 1% to the bartender.
Advice to Management: Jacksonville, FL and Charlotte, NC management is doing well and it has been a pleasure being part of their teams.

Title: "Great Company, but losing the feeling I first felt."
Pros: Flexibility, ability to move up, organization.
Cons: Removal of gratuities, high stress, sometimes it doesn't feel like management is on our side.
Advice to Management: Listen to your staff we are the backbone of the company.

Title: "Crazy location, great co-workers"
Pros: I worked at the Fort Lauderdale Las Olas location. The store has an awesome staff, and I met many great friends. Great serving job to do while pursuing other passions. Also, Cheesecake Factory has a rigorous training program while hard at first, it will grant you many future opportunities in the service industry. Cheesecake servers know what they're doing. I never found any issues with the managements, because I followed protocol and was respectful in the workplace. My work ethic was rewarded with compliments, good serving sections, and a prime schedule. The GM is a former football player and treats the restaurant like a sports team. I don't think that's a bad thing, actually. Play your part and you'll see results.
Cons:
The seasonal aspect of the location makes it hard to predict business. Some days were completely dead, and I'd walk out after only having 3 tables (September-October). Other times, you could be short staffed during shift change and end up running around like crazy. Also, the guests can be a little nuts and unpredictable, but that's South Florida for you.

I know it's like this in a lot of restaurants, but the cook line was ridiculously disorganized and cared nothing for anyone on the other side of the window. They don't cooperate with servers or managers and are just there to get a paycheck, rarely worrying about the food quality, presentation, or timing. Probably one of the worst lines I've ever had the displeasure of working with.

Title: "Awesome place for career waitressing."
Pros: Fun environment overall. People love this place too so fun to be involved with guest and their outings.
Cons: Training is very intense but only because the menu is so intensive. The plates are really heavy too, which was difficult for me to carry due to my weak wrist.

Title: "Great people, just not enough of them"
Pros:
Guaranteed overtime- can work as much as you want.
Great coworkers- 90%+ hardworking and funny
job security- usually busy
Insurance after 60 days
Cons: Guaranteed overtime- if you don't ask for time off, don't expect it to happen.
Advice to Management: Hire more kitchen staff

Title: "Great Company."
Pros: It is very organized, with great benefits.
Cons:
Majority of clientele are uptight, & they expect a lot.
Can be stressful during holidays.

Title: "Good place to work"
Pros: Flexible hours. Always busy. Good food. Easy side work.
Cons: Long hours. Work for tips.all white.
Advice to Management: Care more about servers who care about company

Title: "Sexual harassment. Complete disrespect."
Pros: Some of my coworkers were the most care free, fun, helpful people. They made you excited to come to work.
Cons:
I had been told the clientele had gone downhill. The most you can look forward to ever making is on New Years Eve, in which 400-600 (VERY RARE, ONE TIME OCCURRENCE I WAS TOLD) can happen. HA! No way! I'm sorry, making on average 100-200 dollars a night or more commonly on a double, being the most you make? NO ONE can live off that. I know tipping is not up to the company, but if the workers are being treated so poorly, do something.

Just because a server has been there for however many years, does NOT give you the right to micro manage, or butt into a conversation or problem that does not concern you. (I had been dealing with hard financial problems, and this server had the audacity to step in my way and disrespect me horribly, telling me how to give out more money to my coworkers, (on the night I nearly did everything on my own, all while I was fighting from becoming homeless, which I in turn did.) You are NOT a manager. So dont act like you are. Managers need to discipline or call out workers who try to talk down to others or act like they have authority over them.

Tipshare is RIDICULOUS! I at times would have to tip out a total of 40-60 dollars, making me walk with 30-50.... even on doubles because of how cheap, disrespectful and selfish this location has become! I'm sorry but if you are relying on tips, become a server. It is NOT our responsibility to make sure we give you a certain percentage a night, especially when at times we are the ones still bussing our tables (Happens so much) , run all our food (very rare) or waiting on drinks while you flirt or do whatever with guests (rare but does happen) To demand I give MORE of MY guests tipped money because you chose a less common tipped position, is NOT the servers responsibility. Instead the company should simply pay the buses and bartenders and food runners more.

On the topic of sexual harassment. I got pretty much attacked in the store, and management, pretty much refused to take action. I then noticed how the attitude shifted against me, treating me terribly and docking my hours. (Honestly dont know why I didn't go to court at this time.) Then it happened AGAIN, this time by a MANAGER! At that point I was fed up. If I had complained again, how much worse would they have treated me? This place is a nightmare, and a disrespectful joke.
Advice to Management: (To corporate) Fire everyone and start new management. I'm sorry but all management is either sexually harassing others or simply disrespect, and treat them like dirt, while playing favorites with those who have been there for years yet do the bare minimum. I have never seen such horrendous, horrible disrespect in management. Learn how to pay and treat your employees with respect.

Title: "Overworked, stiffed, and never given a break"
Pros: Coworkers (other servers, foodrunners, and bussers) are very nice and helpful.
Cons: Horrible clientele, bad tips, terrible management, scheduling problems, high turnover, no breaks, forced doubles, weird staff food policy.
Advice to Management: Try caring about your staff more than your guests. Then maybe they'd stick around for longer than a few months.

Title: "Server, Cashier, and Hostess"
Pros: If you work hard, you can earn a lot of extra cash! They also offer benefits after you have been there a while, which is a sweet deal for any server.
Cons: VERY fast paced environment, don't expect breaks, and with SOOO many co-workers, it is impossible for everyone to get along. Clicks are formed.
Advice to Management: At least TRY not to be so obvious with favortism!

Title: "Silly management"
Pros: Good money for a server position
Cons: Management seemed out of touch. I blame corporate breathing down their necks with unrealistic expectations. Food service can never be perfect all the time, but that seems to be the expectation
Advice to Management: Tell corporate to get a clue, somehow, someway

Title: "cheesecake factory"
Pros: flexible hours, always potential to make money any day of the week, very easy, very easy, very easy
Cons: long days, sometimes you get screwed over if you are in a different par of the restaurant, anagers are stubborn and have no common sense
Advice to Management: learn to manage

Title: "Good company that takes care of those who come in willing to work."
Pros: The income potential is much higher than most chain restaurants. The company culture really tries to make each location a family. For those who are willing to put in the work, there is nearly unlimited promotion potential.
Cons: Depending on the location you may face clientele who are difficult to deal with but that holds true with any restaurant. Getting days off during holidays is not always possible

Title: "good"
Pros: salary, work-life balance, bonus, health insurance
Cons: long hours, holidays, late nights

Title: "Nice place"
Pros: clean, friendly, nice, good, part time
Cons: hard, late, cheap, noisy, dark

Title: "Flexible, good place to get experience"
Pros: The training is thorough, the food culture is higher than average quality. It's a great way to start a job as a career server, and they were always very flexible with scheduling.
Cons:
Working in a tourist-heavy location, my tips were very inconsistent. That's a risk of working for tips in a restaurant, but the amount of work we do is not reflected adequately in the money we take home.

By paying us credit card tips at the end of the night, servers owe a LOT extra in taxes at the end of the year because $2.63/hr wasn't enough to cover the taxes.

The company does the absolute bare minimum required by the state to "take care" of its employees. We were basically forced to waive our break periods, bussers and foodrunners/backwaiters made the same hourly wage as servers.
Advice to Management: Care about your staff. Don't pretend to care, actually care more about the people who work for you than making a few extra dollars.

Title: "Doesn't appreciate their workers."
Pros: Some of the pro about working in the cheesecake factory is the heath benefits they offer, full time/part time. Also 50 percent of food but only when working, 25 percent when not working, but only weekdays. No discount on steaks.
Cons:
(Bakery only)
Little pay for a lot of work.
Really can't take break due to the facts that its always busy.
Long hours for little pay, sometimes from 5pm- 3am.
Advice to Management: Appreciate the workers because this company needs them. Keep them happy.

Title: "Bad conditions, GREAT friends and social atmosphere"
Pros: Work with great people, fun characters, and generally a fun place to work with a lot of attractive people
Cons: You will get screwed over by the guest, by the manager's, and unfortunately, by your coworkers, but it is part of the job as a server.

Title: "Great experience!"
Pros:
High tickets=great tips.
Great discount on food.
Offers health benefits, which is very uncommon in this business.
Food is amazing.
You get proper training before being put on your own.
I didn't have to join a gym running around the huge restaurant.
Cons:
All white uniform lol.
Huge menu.
You will gain weight if you have a slice of cheesecake every single night.
Advice to Management: Don't take life so seriously

Title: "Bartender-lots of work..."
Pros:
Insurance at 25 hrs
Tip out
Decent tips from higher check amounts
Lots of experience in high volume and mixology
Cons:
Horrible hourly compensation
Have to personally hunt people for tip out, managers won't handle it themselves
Several hours of bar prep at $2.13
Extensive amounts of prep
Did I mention how much prep we do? Yeah, not worth the pay...
Advice to Management: Better hourly compensation for bar staff!!! It's stupid we have been given more prep to do that the BOH used to do for us but we still only get paid $2.13 an hour 2-3 hours before we even open! It's just not right!

Title: "Caring coworkers poor management"
Pros: Caring coworkers and managers
Cons: Unorganized and always struggling to work due to the lack of product
Advice to Management: Be selective on who is being hired and monitor closing what the restaurant needs. Set your employees up for success

Title: "Great People, Great job"
Pros: Teamwork is encouraged, there is room for advancement and it is fast paced.
Cons: You have to deal with the public and food service poses its challenges. It's stressful at times.

Title: "Overall Satisfied"
Pros:
Server skills will greatly improve. Not an easy place to work at. First few months will be challenge for those who haven't worked in a quick-paced and high volume restaurant with an enormous menu.
Extremely flexible schedule (Valuable for a college student like myself). Easy to swap shifts, request days off and to pick up shifts(AM or PM).
High sales and inflow of customers.
Decent and consistent tips (Dependent on location).
Co-Workers become like a second family.
Great company spirit where teamwork is encouraged.
Part-Time Benefits

Eating all the mistake/dead food!!!
Cons:
Mandatory white uniforms, which required washing after each shift. Management is somewhat stingy with replacing or providing new aprons..
Everyone is expected to receive "Take-one shifts" which are essentially break and runner shifts on a weekly basis. If you aren't on good terms with your server manager are a weaker server, expect several of these.
Shifts can little long, with lengthy side work and checkout. Expect weekend doubles on a common basis.
Management is constantly swapped out or replaced.
Due to the enormous menu and the variety of ingredients used in each dish, guests will consistently modify and sub ingredients (Cheesecake is extremely lenient on this). This can cause a large amount run-errors(fault of server and food-runners) or confusion in the kitchen where the dish is improperly prepared.
% tip out is a little high, which is only slightly counteracted by the high sales.
Advice to Management:
Provide your employees with tools necessary to have a successful dining service. If more silverware/dishes are needed buy more! If your employees have dingy looking aprons, replace them!
Being too buddy-buddy with your employees is not a successful way to manage. Imo.

Title: "Cheesecake Factory Corporate is extremely dysfunctional. The executive staff in FN/HR/IT are immature and unqualified."
Pros: Restaurant Operations Rocks! They are professional, mature and do excellent work. They appreciate their workers and take pride in what they do.
Cons: Human Resources, Finance and IT need HELP! Basically unqualified and immature staff running a company this large? David Overton should rethink his executive staff and their direct reports. It's really sad when the staff is smarter than the executives.
Advice to Management:
No work life balance
Not a great place to work - forced to fill out the surveys with positive scores not true scores so that the 100 Best Places Can be Awarded
Not a team environment - watch your back
No recognition for work

Title: "Best Company to work for ever!"
Pros: Always challenging, Something new every day, Great leadership at both store and corporate level. It really is all about the guest!
Cons: Always busy, which is good for making money. Two menu rollouts per year up to twenty new items at a time can get a little overwhelming.
Advice to Management: Keep doing the great job!

Title: "Great people, solid work"
Pros: Consistent, great tips, easy to trade shifts
Cons: No real cons, parking was bad
Advice to Management: None

Title: "It's a job..."
Pros: Money is good. Very easy with the right personality.
Cons: Management is overworked which leads to unhappy and frequent outbursts.
Advice to Management: Use the tools that corporate has set up for you and uphold their standards and this restaurant would work a lot smoother.

Title: "Busy, Fun, Rewarding, and Frustrating Serving Job"
Pros:
- Money can be great at times
- Beautiful Restaurant
- Flexibility with scheduling
Cons:
- Lots of staff, only 3-4 shifts per week
- With the rapid expansion, restaurants are now opening up in smaller markets (I work in one) and the money while still good, is nothing spectacular when looking at other upscale restaurants in the area.
- Like an restaurant the managers play favorites

Title: "Great Place to Work"
Pros: Great place to work and balance of work life is wonderful
Cons: More scheduled hours would be appreciated

Title: "Great company to work for!"
Pros: Very team oriented and managers are very supportive. I have had nothing but positive experience at this job. The environment is very fun and fast paced. Most servers/bartenders become a family and always help each other out.
Cons: the only challenges can be the ones you create yourself.
Advice to Management: Keep it up!

Title: "Love this place!"
Pros: I enjoyed working for the Cheesecake Factory. Great co-workers, great guests & most importantly great money! :) The atmosphere is great as well! I enjoyed it here very much. Co-workers/Managers became family. My regulars even became family!
Cons:
-All white uniform = VERY easy to get dirty
-Long hours, but that is the restaurant industry for ya!

Title: "Miss it Already, Miss it Always"
Pros:
The Cultural and Systematic approach , along with the workplace relationships created make it an outstanding work experience.
The amount of sales potential make it lucrative in any position. This is due to the amount of hard work that comes with employment at a world class restaurants. It's like a theme part (e.g. Magic Kingdom D.W.)The guest wait to eat just like they wait for space mountain. It were people plan to celebrate at or come everyday to eat. One has the opportunity to advance if you navigate correctly through a very an opportunity laden restaurant company. The ever changing , but foundationally the same formula makes it possible for any competent -hard working manager to advance. Showing up early, staying late , building relationships, and learning the vast amount of operational information makes opportunity at the leader in upscale casual dining. Every location is unique as far as the "characters" but the story is always extremely the same. Busy and ever evolving.
The restaurant is a cutting end, world-class, advanced operational profit machine.
 Your co-workers become you best friends and the company creates magical experiences for the staff and the guest.
It will be challenging and most likely the most complex, busiest restaurant your ever work at.
It fun going to work if you like hospitality and sales volume.
Cons: Like any corporation who you know is often what moves you forward rather then what you actually do. Your direct supervisor is judge, jury, the major decision maker in your career progression. Often nepotism ,personal friendship advance people, rather than actual contribution. Mid- level management is potentially really leaned on to operate. You earn you money coming up. Accountability is inconsistent and many talented managers are not advanced in favor upper-management friendships. Each restaurant is like a 10-15 million dollar government. Truly ran like a Kingdom. Just hope you have a god royal family running the fraternity, sorority, even sometimes cult-like atmosphere.
Advice to Management: Area directors should get more involved not work less once they get there. Take the time to implement a real system to build relationships with the management teams in they're region , monitor operations. The service check company the company uses are easily skewed and a waste of money. The ethical core is inherently compromised because of systems the company creates. Some GM's abuse their teams and do a little work as possible and alienate managers/staff. Area directors should have more quality circles that are not rigged, loaded with plants. C.I.A. style is the multi million dollar restaurant can often be run. Every location is really impacted by the GM. The restaurants are so popular so it's hard to look bad as leader of the restaurant/kingdom. Area directors can look closer at what's going on, but many are the bad cops as Area Directors like when they were GM's. The Cheesecake factory is a reflection of the world. So like the world there is good and evil going on.

Title: "A magical, belt busting, high endurance job"
Pros:
-Flexible schedule
-Great tips-
-Great work environment
-Food discount!!
-Advancement can happen easily
Cons:
-When you do work, you will sweat straight through to your white uniform
-White uniform gets dirty remarkably fast
-As a server, you're treated somewhat disposable (easily replaced)
Advice to Management: No advice, They were okay. Some of my management team needed a lesson in Labor Management, but other than that, nothing but kudos

Title: "Love working at The Cheesecake Factory"
Pros: I have held many titles for the company. There is always room for growth and offers a challenging and rewarding atmosphere. Company culture is based on high service standards and maintaining a 'family' environment making the workplace fun and rewarding.
Cons: As with any company in the industry, it is difficult to budget as tips and wages vary throughout the year with the different 'seasons'.
Advice to Management: AS the company continues to grow, look towards the staff and managers to help analyze and adapt to changes. These are the people who interact with the guests daily, not just the ones who call corporate.

Title: "Baisic Stuff"
Pros: good work environment and management
Cons: worked late sometimes until 1am

Title: "I've had a wonderful experience working here."
Pros: The money is great, the coworkers are awesome, very open management team always available to talk. Open door policy. Commitments to excellence ensure strong work ethic and positivity throughout the company. Very team based culture. All in all, work is a fun time.
Cons: Trying to get time off can be a challenge due to constant need of staff.
Advice to Management: Hire more staff so we can get days off and not be overworked

Title: "Awesome place to work"
Pros: Fun environment with lots of room for growth. Lots of support for the staff . awesome management team and they listen to us.
Cons: No 401k for hourly staff . There are a lot of people who are not going to advance further than a staff member and should not have to worry about retirement.
Advice to Management: Keep up the great work!

Title: "Fast paced"
Pros: Corporate experience, fast paced, looks good on a resume for future jobs, most of the managers were nice
Cons: Not enough tables in a section to make money, can be stressful like any other serving job, your experience will depend on how you get along with managers
Advice to Management: Let your servers have breaks when working 12+ hours

Title: "Great experience"
Pros: Money was definitely good and work balance.
Cons: Long hours, management could be difficult. Also lot of drama

Title: "Great place, great people"
Pros: Corporate - because of benefits; consistent buisness
Cons: working with corporate, serving corporate , they feel they needed to be served more or better than other guest.
Advice to Management: management acted as support and model of character

Title: "Fine job; very corporate"
Pros:
The business is a finely tuned machine--its not a disorganized mess like many restaurants.
Good food.
Cons:
Very corporate; some ridiculous rules that are impossible to comply with and not enforced.
When I was there all servers had a mandatory food running shift each week.
Advice to Management: Cut down on the ridiculous micromanagement. Capable servers know what they need to do for a shift to run smoothly. Stuff like running side work is unnecessary--if you take the last of something refill it. There is no need to assign tasks like that.

Title: "Cheesecake takes care of their people"
Pros: The company stands behind what they preach and truly are customer service driven in all areas. Awesome training and detailed career map laid out for you. You are the driver of your own success with this company. The tools and skill sets are in place, each individual has many opportunities for personal growth.
Cons: Very, very, long shifts due to high level of volume, company is aware of this and does put forth all the effort to create a more balanced work/home schedule.

Title: "server"
Pros: A great place to work. A family like atmosphere among the staff, you make great quick money, and management is always willing to help with any concerns.
Cons: You make the most money during weekends and holidays so you will most likely be working then.

Title: "Good Company!"
Pros: Very flexible with work schedule, friendly atmosphere.
Cons: lots of long shifts, if you count that as a con.
Advice to Management: Everything gets held up by the dishwashers, they are underpaid, understaffed, and so the there are always 1 or 2 new ones per shift who are still learning and cant keep up,

Title: "Great business model, executes high volume without sacrificing service"
Pros: The restaurant itself goes through a great deal of people in a short period of time and does so very well. It's kitchen line is very well put together and functions well considering the enormity of the menu. It's workgroups are put together in a way that encourages teamwork and an environment that is striving toward a singular goal.
Cons: Vertical movement in the company can be somewhat limited. Also some shifts will yield better results for sales dependent positions than others.
Advice to Management: In my experience management was very well executed. Line of communication between employee and employer was always fairly open. Reaching out to employees for input on how the restaurant functions could be beneficial for the restaurant as a whole.

Title: "Coworkers are great but management sucks."
Pros: Coworkers are friendly, more hours
Cons: rude management, very long hours, heavy work for comparatively low compensation.

Title: "Very Difficult to Obtain Personal Goals"
Pros: You can create your own schedule as a server
Cons: Managers work far too much without having set days off along with 2 days off in a row
Advice to Management: Take care of your people more than focusing on generating inappropriate guests

Title: "Fun restaurant, great tips!"
Pros: There is potential for great tips at the Cheesecake Factory. A wonderful variety of food and beverage makes it easy to upsell.
Cons: Wearing an all-white uniform while waiting tables is not ideal. Management had a fairly high turnover rate which caused a lot of inconsistencies.

Title: "It was an amazing career of growth and opportunity."
Pros: The people are amazing to work with
Cons: I enjoyed the daily challenges
Advice to Management: Continue to support the teams

Title: "fun place to work"
Pros: great money cash in hand every shift. job security. and co workers are fun to be around and work with.
Cons: poor management, unfair schedules that go against your availability, and the managers make you fix there mistakes.

Title: "Utter hell."
Pros: Consistent work, organized, support given, great training.
Cons: Worst. WORST job I have ever had. The management is rude, and it's corporate to a fault =no common sense. 25 staff quit along with 4 managers at the Mission Viejo location, now I know why. Work at another location if you can!!! Run!!
Advice to Management: None. Get on meds or read self help books.

Title: "Consistent though frustrating. aka average serving job."
Pros: Management was always willing to work with me with my difficult scheduling, money was pretty consistent but my co-workers are what kept me at this job for so long. Business is pretty consistent, even though the slower months, and there is always money to be made if you're willing to work for it. There are promotional opportunities if you want to work for them, and we had a great manager team that supported those they felt were worthy.
Cons: Often didn't have the tools to do my job. Whether it was glassware, silverware, or plates we never seemed to have enough stocked. Even though these concerns are brought up to management, nothing seems to get done.
Advice to Management: Stock your restaurant and set your staff up for success. I also have a hard time believing that the guest is "always" right because this ALWAYS translates into the company buying off the guests to keep them happy. Don't get me wrong, there are plenty of opportunities to mend guest relations buy purchasing their meals when we got something wrong. That being said, we've left ourselves open to being taken advantage of by those guests who will take any excuse to get a free meal and do not draw a line between those who deserve compensation.

Title: "great job while in school"
Pros: flexible schedule, opportunity to advance
Cons: required to work weekends and holidays (minus thanksgiving day and christmas day).
Advice to Management: jacksonville store is doing a great job and has greatly improved in last 5 five years. I was proud to be part of such a great team.

Title: "Love the servers I work with, but managers are hit or miss"
Pros: Make money and get out most of the time. Social job. Works with college schedule
Cons: The managers have no consistency. Very corporate. We can afford TVs everywhere but not straws in the guests waters?!
Advice to Management: We should be more of a team not managers against staff

Title: "Great place To Work"
Pros: Flexible Schedule, Paid Vacation, Easy Job, Management,
Cons: Dealing with the people in this area.

Title: "Front Desk Great Experience"
Pros:
Room to grow
Fun, learning environment
Cons: Can be stressful during peak season
Advice to Management: Recognize great employees

Title: "Server"
Pros: Nice restaurant and great food.
Cons: Mall setting where people do not tip

Title: "Cheesecake Family"
Pros: The coworkers are the only reason i'm still here. It is a strong family environment. There is plenty of room to move up, if you really want it
Cons: Depending on location, there is a strong possibility the managers are lazy, but the company really sees you as just a number. There is no support when it comes to a guest complaint. You are always wrong.

Title: "Server and Bartender for 6+ years"
Pros: The company is a well oiled machine, which is why they are so successful. Sometimes it can be annoying doing everything under the "corporate" umbrella, but I have worked for restaurants with poor management and leadership and things just tend to fall apart. At the CCF, they have standards in place to keep operations running as smooth as possible.
Cons:
- Sometimes the guests
- Money can be inconsistent (much more consistent bar tending)
- Long hours when short staffed
Advice to Management: Take care of your employees and they will take care of you.

Title: "Great job, if you like a corporate atmosphere."
Pros: Excellent money. High energy atmosphere. Flexible schedule.
Cons: Mistakes are frowned upon. Guests are always right, even when they aren't. It feels like you're always walking in eggshells.
Advice to Management: Stick up for your employees.

Title: "Very stressful but lucrative."
Pros: Good money and flexible hours. The restaurant is very large and has high turnover for people that have worked under a year but the others have been there for a long time and for the most part they all work together and help one another.
Cons: No appreciation from management. VERY little room for growth. It is easy to get in a poor position bending over backwards for management and sometimes even doing things that make little to no sense and get no recognition or insensible for your efforts. It's best to keep to yourself and don't overwork yourself for nothing in return.
Advice to Management: Learn how to communicate and how to be a leader in the workplace rather than a dictator. Leadership skills are a valuable asset that is currently lacking in the restaurant I worked in.

Title: "Mixed feelings"
Pros: They are very flexible with your schedule, I've never had an issue getting time off, even with little notice. The GM is awesome! Very personable and quick to react when you have an issue. With the higher ticket prices, there is definitely the possibility of making money, assuming your guests tip.
Cons: The menu is HUGE!!! This particular location has a lot of... interesting people whom make it difficult to get along with them. Again, at this location guests don't tip properly- I'm not saying everyone, I'll make my 20% all day then have that one table that leaves cash for the tab, says thanks that's all you and it's $5 shy of the total.

Title: "I feel valuable to the company and there are many different options for career advancement."
Pros: Co-workers are friendly and pleasant to work with. As a server, I fortunately serve guests who really enjoy their experience at the Cheesecake Factory. My schedule requests are easily approved and I am able to make a decent amount working here.
Cons: Management acts as if they listen to your needs and prioritize them, but most of the time, it is in one ear and out the other. Simple requests to improve daily work efficiency is easily brushed to the side. Some upper management shows their care for the restaurant and company.
Advice to Management: Really listen to employee needs to improve the quality of the restaurant.

Title: "Decent serving job"
Pros: Never had a problem getting hours/shifts, the training was good for a restaurant, and no issues with time off requests.
Cons: The uniforms need serious updating, the store managers tend to micromanage, and they tend to schedule too many double shifts. The menu is huge but not hard to remember after a few months.
Advice to Management: Train your managers to not micromanage and don't burn them out! I saw so many managers come and go and not feel appreciated.

Title: "It had its moments."
Pros: Free food if managers were generous to give to a meal card. Some of the co-workers and managers were pretty cool
Cons: Long hours (10 - 15 hours, my coworker almost did a twenty hour shift once) with no breaks. Disorganized managers. Overtime frowned upon (manager lied to me about coworker being sick while the real reason was they did not want her to go over 40 hours).
Advice to Management: Happy employees make the best employees

Title: "Cheesin'"
Pros: If you get the right sections on the right shifts, you can make a killing. If you work your butt off, gain extensive knowledge of the enormous menu, and put in the effort with a genuinely good attitude, you can actually do very well here.
Cons: It can take a while before you have the "seniority" to get the high quality shifts. Often times when business is slow, management will keep you around even with 1 or even NO tables. Any customer complaint, valid or not, results in a knock against the server. It is also very sink-or-swim, and can easily overwhelm new employees.
Advice to Management: Trust and respect your employees more. (Don't have us come in for a patio shift when there is an 80% chance of rain or is 100 degrees outside, have us spend 5 hours waiting on a total of about 10 guests, and then wonder why we're upset)

Title: "Fair, methodical, and cut throat..."
Pros:
This company has incredible opportunities and for just about anyone who works here. There are many current GM's that were hourly staff members with the company. Management does also receive great health benefits as well a somewhat fair platform for advancement.

This is also a very classic type of restaurant that is always seeking ways to improve and be innovative, without compromising the grassroots of what a "true" restaurant is all about.
Cons: Meeting performance goals is always a challenge; especially becasue of the labor crunch. Some managers can come up fast, however to obtain more can take some time, and much sacrafice. Quaterly bonus is not too exciting either after all that a "good" manager must go through.
Advice to Management: True recognition should come from the heart and not as a byproduct of company policy.

Title: "If you can handle corporate BS, this is your place to work."
Pros:
The money is great. Tip percentage is mediocre but volume more than makes up for it.
The people are great.
You can pretty much set your own schedule due to the amount of servers.
Relocation opportunities are available.
Insurance is available but costly.
Cons:
Corporate atmosphere. You will get written up for anything. Forget bread? Write up.
No sense of development. Example: 2+ years of employment, no reviews.
Guests. Every once in a while you might get a great table but most clientele are pretentious.
You feel like you're walking on eggshells every move you make.
All white, all the time.
Advice to Management: Have your employee's backs. We're the one that have to deal with the guests. Stick up for us every once in a while. Tell us when we do well in addition to where we could improve, not just the negative. It makes for a not so fun work environment.

Title: "Server Life"
Pros:
NO shop reports
Trying all the new food
discounted meals
travel to new store locations to train, including international locations
decent pay
very flexible schedule
great co-workers
able to easily transfer to other locations
could work at different location during vacation
Cons:
open availability on Sundays, every major holiday, and major event weekend
extended hours for holidays
no holiday pay
hard to get pay increase
no longer able to add gratuity to checks of 6 or more ppl
corporate rules
pay for your own uniform (shirts, pants, shorts, shoes, etc) which is all white and not always in season

Title: "Wonderful place to work"
Pros: People and management are great!
Cons: Not alot of room to grow in ... depends on the department you are in.

Title: "Typical Corporate Chain Restaurant with some Perks"
Pros:
-Food tasting for Orientation
-Easy to get off with request and also people picking up your shift
-Cash at the end of the day.
-Only 2 entire staff meetings a year
-Best dessert and cheesecakes that I know of
-Transfer to one of the many different locations throughout the US
Cons:
-TIPS! They were very inconsistent because of the large foreign clientele in Las Vegas, and some of other larger foreign clientele locations.
- Food Portions are too large need to downsize a little and maybe save some money and reinvest. It seemed liked nobody could finish food.
-Typical Rigid corporate structure writes up, reviews and constant threat of negative reviews.
-as mentioned before a lot of favoritism when it came to the sections, and how much money you made, during the initial interview set wrong expectations of how much we could actually make
Advice to Management: Please think outside the box and be more creative to difficult solutions and problems. At times were too rigid with the corporate rules.

Title: "Will work you till you drop..."
Pros: Ok money and ability to move stores
Cons: Management makes you aware your expendible. Works everyone to the bone so no one wants to work extra. Constantly has scheduling problems where they let to many servers go on vacation at once so the rest have to kill them selves for nothing. GM is a nightmare and has no real clue. Won't fire a alcoholic server who comes in drunk every day and picks favorites. Hires servers that have never served ever and watches them crash and burn. If your are just starting a shift with 5 tables that are empty expect to have 5 tables sit all at once and be expected to pick up two more tables out of your area because that's how they do things here. Had a high number of management leave this summer. They lost almost entire management team and had a larger turn over for servers.
Advice to Management: Maybe look at your management team here talk to your very unhappy server team and see why everyone is looking to get away from this Cheesecake.

Title: "Too much expected of the employees"
Pros: Black uniforms, free soup and bread, glamorous hostesses
Cons: too stressful, rude managers, rude fillers, no breaks, horrible discount on food, horrible work, forced to clean bathrooms
Advice to Management: Give your employees breaks. Better discounts on food.

Title: "Very extensive menu, but a great place to work!"
Pros: Very organized, great training programs, and yummy food!
Cons: Small serving sections, which could effect your take home pay.

Title: "Very corporate, potential to make great money as a server."
Pros: Always busy, great management, good clientel, family environment, good benefits. EXTREMELY efficient on relieving/cutting the servers. If it is slow (rare) they want you out as soon as possible, which is a good thing, they want the servers who are on to make money. Very flexible with schedule.
Cons: To make the good money you have to work long hard hours. Somedays 12-14 hours with no break, but being a server this is where you really make your money. Having a pristene white uniform can be annoying at times. Have to be there a long time to advance.

Title: "Great, steady, reliable and consistant employment"
Pros: They provide training for everything. I can probably step into any restaurant and start serving tables flawlessly from the training provided here.
Cons: Sometimes politics can get involved making it difficult to move up.

Title: "Pays the bils"
Pros: easy consistent money, flexible schedules
Cons: you are disposable and they make you aware of it.

Title: "Great place to learn the business"
Pros: It's a great place to learn the inner workings of a very high volume kitchen. I could seriously walk into any other restaurant and feel comfortable that I'm as, if not far more, knowledgeable than the average cook.
Cons: They expect you to be extremely fast and they want everything that goes out to be perfect. Understandable. The problem is they provide very little training. Management seems to be fixated on micromanaging as opposed to training. Also, there is a HUGE pay gap between hourly and management. After four years I make considerably less than twenty thousand a year. Starting management makes around fifty thousand plus bonuses. Everyone is nice and treats each other well for the most part, but at the end of the day, you just feel like another small cog in a very big wheel.
Advice to Management: Hire more of your low level management from within the company. This is a complicated restaurant with complicated food. If your management had first hand experience on the line you would see a huge payoff in more well trained cooks.

Title: "Hostess"
Pros: The company is very flexible when it comes to scheduling. It was a exciting job with great coworkers and guest. You would receive a free meal when working doubles and discounts when eating in. Very great environment to be. Opportunity to advance.
Cons: Long hours on your feet. Very stressful at times when costumers are tired of waiting. Sore feet after standing and walking all day.
Advice to Management: N/a

Title: "It's a challenging environment but it is fun as well"
Pros: Tips are usually twice of what you would make in your dally hourly, hot schedule app makes it easy to check your schedual
Cons: You don't always get the good shifts so it can be slow in your section. You also don't have a certain schedule so you can work one day one week and not the next
Advice to Management: For those who have full availability it would be best to have a certain # of days a week not to few or way to many doubles

Title: "Overworked and not enough money"
Pros: Training was fun, they keep you well fed and I had fun while learning all of the food with my new coworkers. Management is decent, hotschedules makes it easy to give away or pick up shifts as you need. They also let you eat as much bread and soup as you want while you're working.
Cons: Double shift hours are RIDICULOUS. On several different occasions i worked nearly 14 hours with only two half an hour breaks, have had coworkers get sick from being overworked, and instead of sending them home, they have them keep working. Instead of letting doubles go home first, they send people home based on what section they are in. There is also no rotation in seating so if you're in a back section you make far, far less money than people on the patio or in a front section, and management plays favorites with who gets the good sections.
Advice to Management: Stop overworking your employees, 14 hours of serving in a day is TOO MUCH. and create a system for seating that makes it fair for all of the servers.

Title: "Great Part-time job"
Pros: Managers are good. Mark, the GM is an awesome dude. They train great leaders. You have a couple micro managers but the manager will work with you if you show up to work do your job and go home. I worked at a CCF in 3 states. Chicago (Michigan Ave.) was my favorite. So many people from all walks of life come through on a regular basis. Rich poor, celebrities common folks, etc. The employees are so diverse. I enjoyed working and learning from them. If you can deal with stress, high performance work, rude customers (every so often) bad tippers (every so often), language barriers and being on your feet for hours. Then do this job. Its still amazing to see this CCF coordinate such a huge crowd and 300 employee staff.
Cons: Turn over is very high. If someone doesn't show up, you have to pick up the slack. If you have a micromanaging manager, its the worst because this is an already stressful environment.
Advice to Management: Weed out the bad.

Title: "Great experience to make great friends."
Pros:
CCF offers extensive training for staff.
This is a great opportunity to make friends.
The food is really good.
Cons: There are too many menu options.
Advice to Management: Show genuine appreciation to staff.

Title: "Co Workers are great. Clientele sucks."
Pros: The people are great that you work with, generally good folks.
Cons: Co-Workers don't care about their job.

Title: "Fairly decent place to work."
Pros: With the maintenance department, you have more freedom than the rest of the plant. You work at your own pace as long as it keeps the plant running. Overtime can be achieved.
Cons: No sick pay. Production can be annoying sometimes. You will constantly have to train people you have previously trained on how to use equipment.

Title: "server"
Pros: flexible hours, upbeat attitude, fast paised
Cons: must be able to work weekends

Title: "Great Place to Work"
Pros: Best Server Training in the business.
Cons: nothing really bad to say

Title: "Great company to work for"
Pros: The management is great and the company is always investing money back into the company. There is also bi-yearly all staff outings that the company pays for
Cons: Sometimes you can get a Bad EGG gm or manager.
Advice to Management: Some great managers to work for

Title: "Pays the bills"
Pros: The side work is easy. You know the restaurant is always going to be in business. You usually always make close to a hundred a shift. Most of the people that work there are cool.
Cons: Dealing with people from every country in the World can be very interesting. The tips can be terrible. Way to much turn over in staff. Seems like your just another number. The managers are very moody, depending on the day.
Advice to Management: A Few of the managers are tough to deal with. Make the menu smaller. Some items people never order.

Title: "Work hard, play hard."
Pros: Very good company to come into looking for experience. My experience has been very good, moving up every few months learning multiple stations. If you put in the long demanding hours and show management you are dedicated, you will find yourself a nice comfortable home here.
Cons: Very very very high volume restaurant. I would recommend coming in with some line experience, because going down with 60 tickets for hours is very hectic. Long work weeks, some 50-60 hours. Lots of management changes.
Advice to Management: Consistency is key.

Title: "perfect student job"
Pros:
Managers really worked around my school schedule with my work schedule. but you have to at least available for three shifts during the week
i learned to have priorities on customer's satisfaction which was their highest priority
Cons:
they tried so hard to be like a fine-dining restaurant when they are not with customer service.
learning their menu was troublesome since their menu is like a book. but it wasnt too bad
employee benefits werent that great compare to other competitive restaurants.
Advice to Management: i miss getting my green ticket easily but it got really hard.

Title: "Love Working Here"
Pros: Good pay, family like staff, career path available if you want it.
Cons: Management is sometimes incompetent, takes a long time to advance in this career path.

Title: "Great company. Happy to work here!"
Pros: Benefits are great! Good work environment! Excellent Co-workers!
Cons: Development office seems somewhat separated from the Corporate office.
Advice to Management: Training workshops for the Development office.

Title: "Excellent"
Pros: Flexible work-schedules, great money, appreciate your input, constantly seeking ways to improve as a whole and individually.
Cons: Employee rotation common. Bringing in new people every few weeks means constantly learning how to work with a new staff.
Advice to Management: Work better together as a team and have the same ideas for the staff.

Title: "Fast-paced"
Pros: fast paced so the time goes by quickly, leave with cash every shift, not too much side work that ha s to be done
Cons: Have worked several 12 hour shifts with no breaks.

Title: "It's alright"
Pros: The best reasons to work at Cheesecake Factory is that they pay higher for hostessing than other companies
Cons: It is hard to advance within the company. They do not take school or other jobs into account. They work you like horses.
Advice to Management: Consider your employees, they have lives and other things going on. If they ask to be moved up for financial reasons take that into account and don't tell them no and then send out a message saying that you need servers. It was really a slap in the face.

Title: "The cheesecake factory was a decent experience. But i've worked in better restaurants"
Pros: As a server you can make great money
Cons: THe management was horrible
Advice to Management: The management needs to care more about their staff and the well being of their staff. You would get a lot more productivity out of the staff if you did and the ruen over rate wouldn't be so high

Title: "Can be good money if you can stand micromanaging"
Pros: Good people, decent tips. Avg price of a check is higher than most restaurants
Cons: Now that the IRS took away gratuity, you can really be screwed
Advice to Management: Have faith in your employees and stop micromanging

Title: "Great company to work for"
Pros: Great established company, set in their standards and operational procedures, make it easier to understand what they want from you and how fast you can advance.
Cons: The hours and consecutive days of work sometimes wear off on you.

Title: "Sweat-Shop"
Pros: The cakes are good if you ignore the ingredients that are in them.
Cons: The east coast bakery has gone through 3 plant managers in 3 years. Management is horid! The place is run like a sweatshop. Expired ingredients to save money, workers are treated without dignity. Supervisors are hired regularly because of incompetence. Breaks are very few. It's a cultural moral pit. Anyone with the least amount of ethics realizes very quickly how unethical the company us. Go through the plant, you will immediately think of osha and fda.
Advice to Management: Fire them all. Tell the investors. Reboot!

Title: "Great place to work"
Pros: Fabulous food, great location, friendly staff
Cons: Long hours and few breaks
Advice to Management: I don't have any at this time

Title: "Unapologetic Disorganized Management"
Pros: Flexible scheduling, great discount, free food for working double shifts and working on off day.
Cons: Poor communication among management. The team's moral was probably the lowest I have ever seen at any job, and it defiantly showed in the turnover rate. Constantly asked you to work if you were schuduled off due to unreliable staff.
Advice to Management: Communicate, and put a higher value in your employees

Title: "Worked there while I went to school"
Pros: Money in your hand that night, flexible schedule for school, well respected company
Cons: not a career job, have to relay on tips for income

Title: "High employee turnover for a good reason- treated as entirely expendable. Massive Overhiring, no lunches, etc....."
Pros: Strong business- Managers can be very helpful (if you are on their good side... VERY important). Nice place to work if you enjoy the atmosphere. Good hours (once again, if you're liked...). Your experience here is HIGHLY contingent upon being favored by individual managers.
Cons: Profits come before anything and everything else. There was a huge amount of overhiring, probably because they treat their employees as expendable and easily replaceable. NO lunches, NO required breaks.
Advice to Management: In terms of turning a profit, I don't really have any advice. With how singularly focused on profits the company is, there really isnt anything to improve on. Now as for business ethics, you should really challenge yourself to develop some.

Title: "Great corporate place"
Pros: Leadership, organization, team structure. They really want the whole restaurant to succeed~including you! They stand behind you, train you, and want you to deliver a world-class dining experience with a fantastic product
Cons: none. you know what you signed up for and with over 20 years in the service industry, I found it to be one of the best. Keep in mind there will always be some that you don't like to work with. With that said, it is a great place to work! The management team is top-notch. They really encourage talent!
Advice to Management: Keep up the great work! CCF is the cream de-la-creme of upscale casual dining!

Title: "The best of the best"
Pros: The upper echelon of technology. Especially for being a restaurant company. Oh, did I mention good money and benefits?
Cons: Lots of red tape, so change is slow.

Title: "Cheesecake Factory Baybrook :)"
Pros: Everything! Yes I had my bad days but over all I loved the atmosphere and the people I worked with! The managers and GM as well made that place home away from home! I love the company and I loved working there! We were a new store and when I had to leave (about a year later) a lot of the people who started with me were still there! If you have every really worked in a big,busy restaurant you know servers don't seem to last to long but this company took care of me and im sad were not close enough to another one so I could have transferred! I recommend this company all the way!!!
Cons: I have nothing bad to say! You have good days as a server and you have bad but I love this company!
Advice to Management: Ya'll were awesome and I miss working there!

Title: "Great people to work with."
Pros: Great co-workers. Busy atmosphere. Good tips. I worked at 3 different locations and they all brought something different but the money was the same.
Cons: Getting tables that don't leave a tip.
Advice to Management: Stay positive you work for a great company. I never reached management, but they seem like they would be a fun team to join.

Title: "It was good for the time!"
Pros: The flexibility of the schedules was great
Cons: Opportunities of advancement were limited.
Advice to Management: Stop growing so much and focus on what really drives the company, your employees.

Title: "High Volume"
Pros: Great quality and training. Only the best food and service. Systems designed for maximum efficiency.
Cons: Shifts are long and hours are challenging. GM schedule is Wednesday thru Sunday with mids usually on weekends. Very tough on qualityof life. Free BMW as GM but you never get to drive it since it's parked at the restaurant.
Advice to Management: Training is long- 11 hour days for almost 3 months. If you have a photographic memory you will do well since you will need to know every single (literally) recipe of every single item served.

Title: "Server"
Pros: Good Money, Fast Paced. Able to give away or pick up shifts with little hassle.
Cons: The customers are sometimes ruthless.
Advice to Management: don't show obvious favrotism.

Title: "3+ yr employee"
Pros: Great restaurant to work for! Flexible schedules, wiling to work around school schedules, great co-workers that you will make a ton of friends with, once you're serving there is a great opportunity to make money
Cons: Hard to move up in the company, it took me 3 years to move from the front desk to a server, long hours that are hard on your body, little chance of growth and development,

Title: "Full of young alpha males and females that thought they knew everything about serving. Huge menu, long training."
Pros: High volume and fast paced, on good shifts. Most people fun to work with. Time flies on good shifts.
Cons: When not busy you are phased out sometimes after only having a table or two, and those are the shifts new people get. Takes long time to get the good shifts.
Advice to Management: Way too much favoritism going on at store I worked.

Title: "Great place to work !"
Pros: Nice bunch of people with some over 30 years tenure. Good work life balance. You can learn a lot.
Cons: Nothing really stands out. I love it.

Title: "I love the people I work with"
Pros: The staff at the Cheesecake Factory's make my day and is why I continue to work there. They are very flexible with hours and are good with promotions.
Cons: Very tough work day, management seems to be on different pages all the time.
Advice to Management: Stay in sync.

Title: "Great money on a daily basis"
Pros: The only pros of working here are a flexible schedule and the fact that you can make between $500 to $1,000 a week depending on how hard you work as a server
Cons: It is a very busy restaurant and they do not give too many chances if you mess up.
Advice to Management: You guys need to work all the time. Not just when the regional manager shows up for his routine visits.

Title: "Austin location is wonderful."
Pros: Good hours, great money, cool people.
Cons: Will gain 30 pounds because of training and having to "try all the food".

Title: "server"
Pros: Good money, great work opportunity for advancement and traveling.
Cons: Usually attract a lot of tourists or people that don't tip well.

Title: "Great Fast-Paced Collaborative Team Efforts"
Pros: Management cares about employees, and before each shift there is a team rally to discuss relevant points for the upcoming shift and boost morale to ensure a productive experience for everyone. Teamwork is very encouraged, which fosters an environment that is great to work in. Lots of money can be made. Free meal on doubles.
Cons: Very fast-paced, extremely extensive menu if you are a server. Must put in the effort, but you will reap the results.

Title: "Good place to make quick money"
Pros: Easy to get time off since there are lots of servers. Flexible with schedules and being a student. Fast paced environment and usually always busy. Never had to worry if we were going to get business.
Cons: Easy to burnout. Asked to work all major holidays. Requires you to claim based off of your sales for the shift, not how much you actually made. Often was the case that I had to claim more than I made. Lead Servers were often in charge of the schedule, so politics involved in getting good shifts.

Title: "great place"
Pros: a very professional company to work for
Cons: If you are in Management you will not have much of a life outside of work

Title: "The Cheesecake Factory is a great company, but has poor quality of life for manager."
Pros: Organized, generally professional, fun, a lot of opportunity
Cons: Work weekends and long hours

Title: "Service Industry Job. Good for the service industry but not a good job"
Pros: Servers make good money because people usually buy dessert. Overall good company to be a part of, there is upward mobility if you are interested in a career but be prepared for it to take a very long time
Cons: Schedule was never consistent, so I couldn't ever plan out other things in my life more than a week in advance. Management was condescending quite often
Advice to Management: Don't promise people promotions they won't actually see for 6 months.

Title: "Great company for self driven hard workers."
Pros: The company is dedicated to excellence and does a fantastic job caring for staff and managers alike. The only limits to your growth is you. Good benefits, good pay and positive work environment.
Cons: Long hours and weekends. Can be overwhelming at times.

Title: "I am here strictly for the convenience, and consistency!"
Pros: They are willing to work around your schedule.
Cons: The company does not care about you, to them you are just replaceable, but yet try to act as though you are its "greatest asset." They do not have your back in situations dealing with guests, and let guests walk all over the employee to please the guest.
Advice to Management: Stick up for your lower level employees.

Title: "Great company to work for."
Pros: Honestly, it always feels like the upper management cares about their employees. The healthcare benefits are crap, but their meal policies are very generous and overall it's a very great company.
Cons: It's like a high-class Applebees, and the clientele shows it.
Advice to Management: Keep caring. Change the server uniforms to black.

Title: "Nice Place To Work"
Pros: Friendly environment! Room for growth.
Cons: Have to wear all white. Hard to keep uniform clean. Have learn all Cheesecakes and ingredients.
Advice to Management: None

Title: "Average Place to Work"
Pros: flexibility through hotschedules, ability to transfer to other stores
Cons: They took away gratuity on large parties, which has really affected our income (even though they could've figured out how to comply with the new tax law, but didn't because it would cost corporate some money). Won't let you work doubles, because it affects management bonuses at the end of the year. Breaker shifts and standby shifts, come on we are definitely in the minority here on these types of shifts. Also there should be designated food runners, who only have food run shifts and designated servers who only serve, no in between. When they need something they expect you to do it right away, when you need support (i.e. getting something comped, talking to a guest) some of the managers don't help. There is also a lot of favoritism for people who have been there longer, even though some of them are constantly in the weeds/having meltdowns. They get better sections, even though they aren't the best with guests or act like team players. Also if they need one of their shifts housed it's not a problem and managers don't ask for anything in return, but when a newer staff member needs help with a shift managers won't do anything unless that staff member does something for them (i.e. picking up a standby/breaker shift/coming in on their day off). The more you take care of your employees and respect them, the happier they will be and the happier the guest will be.
Advice to Management: Take care of your employees, we're your greatest resource. But by taking away gratuity and not figuring out a solution that would allow us to keep it, you have shown us that we're not worth it. We also need to be more conservative with our comps. Someone complains they didn't like something (but for example ate all the shrimp in it, don't comp that meal). Only comp for actual issues (burnt, undercooked, something was in the dish, food quality). We've become the place that scam artists love to come to because they know they can get something for free if they complain. I've seen people eat almost an entire dish, say they just didn't like it and get it for free. Are you kidding me? Also figure out the fries situation and always have runner friendly food. We shouldn't have to call for fries, the kitchen should be constantly be cooking new batches (especially on a busy night) and should plate them and then bump the item on the screen as ready to be run. Not bump the item and then make the fries so the person running the food waits for 3/4 min (which feels like 3/4hrs) and their guests are wondering where they are. Also stop bumping food as ready to run, even though it's not even in the window.

Title: "Manual ass labor"
Pros: Decent pay for a restaurant job
Cons: They treat the bakery employees like slaves

Title: "I love my job, I love my co-workers. Very family oriented!"
Pros: Tips, come to work and have fun, busy! I love who I work with, and who I work for. Certainly one of the best serving jobs I have ever had. You have to want to get up and go to work and do your job. If you cant do that... you are probably miserable in any company you work for.
Cons: Kitchen is a disaster... it is being worked on, sadly though, there are a lot of kitchen staff that just don't care. STOP PRE SELLING!!!
Advice to Management: I wouldn't trade my job for much of anything. I really love it here and appreciate my team. A great serving job is hard to come by. The advice to my management is that trainers should be held to a higher accountability. They should be setting good examples. I think that we should have daily training in food recipes. On going training is helpful for items we don't sell all the time.

Title: "Great Place to work"
Pros: Cheesecake Factory is very supportive and is full of great employees. Most of the managers are on your side and it seems that every co worker is always willing to help you out. Getting time off is never a problem.
Cons: It is hard to move up; I worked in the bakery for two years before I was moved up to being a server.

Title: "Fun atmosphere but hard to move up"
Pros: Social atmosphere and the restaurant has a good reputation. Pretty flexible with scheduling as well - easy to swap shifts with coworkers. Good working conditions, restaurants are well-maintained. I think servers get the better end of the deal (which can be seen by less turnover) whereas hostess/front desk does not get compensated nearly as well.
Cons: Hostesses don't get any tips and it takes too long to move up to a server (must move to the bakery first). The pay is just okay and hostesses are also required to maintain the bathroom throughout the day (deep cleaning is done by housekeeping).
Advice to Management: Allow for quicker movement for those who show good potential

Title: "Best corporate restaurant you can work for!"
Pros:
Excellent Management
Excellent Healthcare
Great Values and Corporate Culture
Cons:
Long Hours
Late Nights
No Gratuity on checks

Title: "Experience as s server"
Pros:
Extremely thorough training probably the best I have ever seen.
The management are very knowledgeable about the products and make it fun to sell.
Great products to sell.
Cons:
Not many incentives for the employees so it makes it hard to give it your all 100% of the time.
The management doesn't do the best of job of scheduling the servers with an opportunity to be in the better sections.
Advice to Management: Offer more incentives for the employees other than getting a cheesecake at Christmas time

Title: "Not as good as expected"
Pros: Makes good money on busy nights and holiday season. Nice environment to work at. There is a great diversity of customers
Cons: The money is not worth the sacrifice. Working past 3 am even though they close at midnight. Management doesn't really care about you. And is impossible to get a break even if you work a double.
Advice to Management: Value more your employees

Title: "Working as a Server"
Pros: Intensive experience in customer service, applicable to any industry that you make work in later on in your career. Great training and experience as a part-time job for a college student or recent graduate.
Cons: You are often required to work weekends and late-nights, and it is difficult to take off for holidays. Pay varies from week to week.

Title: "Loved the job"
Pros: I loved working at The Cheesecake Factory because of the amount of customer service skills I gained from there. I will continue to use that knowledge that they provided me for future positions in sales/customer service.
Cons: I think the only con I can think of, which comes with the job, is it's a fast pace high stress job on busy nights. But that's when you make a lot of money :)

Title: "Okay place to work"
Pros:
This restaurant is always extremely busy so you earn good money as a server
Free food if they mess up an order
Free soup and bread every shift
Cons:
The management is not the most experienced
Long hours and you need to always be running

Title: "Great company to work for in the restaurant business in PR"
Pros: Room for advancement, benefits if you meet the minimum weekly hours requirement, very understanding managers who try to do their best for their employees and the guests. Good hourly pay compared to most other places in the island. Good working atmosphere with other co-workers.
Cons: Hours cut or getting sent home when sales are slow. Sometimes we're not provided all the tools we need to do our jobs as efficiently as possible. Understaffed shifts in peek holiday rush days.

Title: "So far it has been great!"
Pros: Absolutely love our general manager!
Cons: No cons at the moment

Title: "I love the people I work with, the delicious desserts we make, and the benefits we have. Great place to work!"
Pros: Excellent opportunities to grow within the company, as the company maintains a good balance between recruiting outside talent and promoting current employees as positions open up. Free yummy food, coffee, tea, juice, soft drinks, fruits, and desserts are common at Corporate and the Bakery. Good benefits package. Co-workers are great. Lots of continuity as there are many employees that have been working in the company for decades.
Cons: Pay could be better. Conservative growth strategies limit the company's expansion in national and international markets.
Advice to Management: Investment in production facilities will really take the west coast bakery to the next level.

Title: "Great College Job"
Pros: This is a well-compensated job (when you include tips + benefits) and has a lot of flexiblity. Your experience completely depends on your management team
Cons: You get worked to the bone and the type of customers that you have every day shape the type of day you will have.
Advice to Management: Create more opportunities for growth within the company that go beyond just becoming a manager at the restaurant.

Title: "Great opportunity to be part of"
Pros: The staff is very organize and attentive
Cons: In-dining guests wait very long to be seated at times

Title: "Fun and good learning experience"
